story:
You Are Holy - Joshua Aaron's new studio project

This is the temporary landing page of www.Joshua-Aaron.org. Visit www.WorshipinIsrael.com/Joshua for scheduling and info.

Thank you all so much for your interest in our new album, You Are Holy. This is a compilation of worship songs written in Hebrew and English. We have completed much of the CD, but now need your help to finish it. There are several ways you can help.

  • Spread the word (word of mouth, email & social networks)
  • Give to this project (donate and receive incentives!)
  • Become a sponsor (market your ministry on the album)

It's because of you that our album Bo Yeshua has gone to the ends of the earth, and it's because of people like you that I believe "You Are Holy" will touch lives around the globe.

Check out the incentives for your giving on this page.

MORE VIDEOS TO COME!!!

VIDEO 1 - HOW GREAT IS OUR GOD (IN HEBREW)

VIDEO 2 - YOU ARE HOLY

VIDEO 3 - AARONIC BENEDICTION

story:
Hi, and welcome to our Indiegogo campaign to raise production funding for our old time radio show on CD of Yesteryear Radio Theatre "The Shooting , Story of the Kane Brothers"

This is a unique and original production of a complete 60 min western story told in the style of radio show of the 1930's.  With action, romance, drama, and all.

The video sample you have just seen is a short 5 min sample of two scenes from the story, the show and CD will be the complete story, a 60 min show, with old style commercials, cliff hangers, and some fun . It is a real old time experience for the whole family.

The goal:  To fund the making of the show on CD, that will be sold as a unique original production, and will be featured in our own webcast show (Yesteryear Theatre), that will be the first of an ongoing old time radio and film show from Groat Family Productions.

We have great perks, and rewards for you when you back our project, and have set five easy levels of backing.

This story is from the award winning film we produced in 1984, of an old style western movie in the tradition of films of the 1930's. We have been making films, and shows for over 30 years, and are excited about our new show "Yesteryear Theatre"  our original webcast show of old time story's and films. This project will be the first Radio style show.   Thia is a true old time radio version of the film story.

When this show is made, it will be the start of our webcast show, and the show will then be ongoing.  The CD, along with others in the show will be sold also as individual works.  You can reserve your CD here for $25. with your pledge, and it will have many other things added to it as a special thank you.

You can learn more about me, and what we do at the update tab for my background, and at my links, and if you have any question, just send a message.

The breakdown of budget: 1-A percentage goes to paypal, indiegogo.   2- The producing and mailing of perks and item for rewards $500.  3- The production cost in studio recording, and Pkg, and promotion  $1,200.   4- to be added to voice over and sound efx cost. $280.    Total : $2,200.

Please look at our photo section for shots from the film. And check back for updates.

We want to thank all our backers. Jump in and ride with us, and let's make a great story. Rick Groat.

story:
Free The Music!!


Firstly, If you are not familiar with my music, you can find me here: 
Frater Oz on Reverbnation


I find myself blessed with a really awesome opportunity. I am, for the first time in my adult life, able to focus solely on my music. It is an opportunity that I want to take full advantage of, but I find myself with all of the time and motivation, but without the money to make the most of it. I am asking my community of friends, fans, and followers to help me make this moment in my Great Work the best I possibly can.

I need some expensive pieces of equipment to do that.

I feel like so much of my time and productivity is being wasted waiting to be able to get into the studio. Here is what I need to conquer this obstacle to my work.

  • An electronic drum-set, and the software to run it.
  • A high-quality microphone, to get the crisp sound that I need.
  • A decent bass guitar.

There are also many smaller, less expensive upgrades that I really need to get the sound I want, but those are the three most important pieces, and those alone will get me to a point where I can really be productive and self sufficient here at home.

I am asking for YOUR help.

Please give. Please share. Help me make the most of this amazing opportunity that I have been presented with.

What You Get

I don't have a lot to offer in the way of gifts for individual donations, but here is my promise.

If I reach my goal, I will release all current material, and all material created for at least 6 months for free. again. If the goal is reached, all of my current songs and  releases for the first six months will be 100% free forever. I don't know what more valuable gift I could give than my music, which is a gift to all of you from my soul.

Please consider helping me pursue my Great Work.

Thank you for your time, and for your continued support. I love you all.

Oz

story:
Summary

Thank you for visiting my Indiegogo page! 

I’m Jasmine Jordan and my debut EP of completely original music, entitled TIME TRAVEL, is set to be released this January.  Feel free to head over to my brand new website, jasminejordanmusic.com and check out my debut single and music video for TIME TRAVEL directed by Andric Booker. You can also download TIME TRAVEL through the email list at the top right.

Since moving to Los Angeles after obtaining my Bachelor of Science Degree in Business Administration, I have actively been pursuing my dream of having a solo music career.  Over the past two years I have been searching for my new sound and connecting with people who share my passion for making great quality music.

Despite my devotion to music, recording an album is not an easy task, and there are many expenses that come along with building my brand and expanding my career. While I am continuously investing time and energy into making this project the best that it can be, financially I still need a little help.  Any donation will help bring me closer to not only releasing high quality music that I can be proud of, but more importantly music that you can enjoy. 

This project was produced and recorded entirely in Los Angeles by Andre de Santanna, and features an amazing cast of musicians that he handpicked for the project:

Drums: Lyndon Rochelle (Esperanza Spalding, George Duke)
Drums: Tamir Barzilay (Macy Gray)
Bass: Andre de Santanna (Jason Mraz, Sergio Mendez, Gretchen Parlato)
Keys: Bryan Velasco (Celia Cruz, Tito Puente, Everlast)
Background Vocals: Danielle DeAndrea (Sting, Kylie Minogue, Jackson Brown)
Guitar: Jon Maurer (Sugar Water Purple)


What We Need

At this point you may be wondering what exactly are the costs involved with releasing an EP. Besides hard work and dedication, here is a rough breakdown of what is needed to help me reach my goal:

Recording Expenses = $8500
Physical CD Manufacturing = $500
Music Video Production = $900
Website = $100

These are just a few of the many costs associated with getting on my feet as an artist. Any help you can provide is much appreciated!

What You Get

Now here’s the fun part: Everyone who contributes to my campaign will receive the following perks:

$1 - Digital Download of the entire EP "TIME TRAVEL" 
$10 - Physical Copy of the EP + Digital Download
$25 - Signed Tour Poster + Physical Copy of EP + Digital Download
$100 - 15min one-on-one Skype session with Jasmine + all other rewards

*All rewards (including downloads) will be delivered before January 17th. 
  Exact date TBA
  If you would like additional physical copies of the EP please send your request to   
  dave@chieftainartists.com

The Impact

How wonderful would it be for everyone to be able to snap their fingers and become exactly what they’ve always dreamed they could be? But in reality it takes more than talent and determination to make such things come into fruition. Although my journey is just beginning, the support from my family and friends has meant the world to me and confirmed that I am indeed on the right path. I am now in the most crucial position as an independent solo artist and any donation is helping to further the success of my upcoming project. You would not only be making a donation, but investing in my dream and nothing could mean more to me than to have the resources and funding to create beautiful music.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank goodness for social media! Even if you can’t contribute there are many ways that you can show your support. Feel free to shout me out and repost the link to the fund, music video and website on your social media media accounts. Spreading the word about my project is a key component in the future success of my career.

You can visit my personal website jasminejordanmusic.com for more information and music, or visit my Facebook page http://www.facebook.com/therealjasminej , tweet me @TheRealJasmineJ or tag me in your photos @TheRealJasmineJ

Every contribution big or small is greatly appreciated. Thank you and welcome to my TIME TRAVEL journey!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Cen'C Love. I am a musician (guitar, piano, percussions), singer, and songwriter.  This is my second full length LP ("Love Letter", 2011), and first Acoustic album, and I am happy to feature my friends, The Tuff Gang, who are also talented songwriters individually: Yezer Root (guitar, bass, percussions, flute), Asadenaki (guitar, percussions), Narry Berry (keyboard, percussions), and Ayeola George (harmony, though everyone sings harmony, really!).    

We are in the process of producing a 'tribute' LP, "STRANGE", (check out the VIDEO in Gallery section above) in observation of the plight of all indigenous nations around the world.  With the expansion of globalism/capitalism, indigenous tribes are being forced to come to terms with a devastating reality that threatens their history, traditions, natural habitat, and their very existence.  Genocide; spiritual, mental, AND physical, has been their worst nightmare come alive.  Though gravely downtrodden throughout colonial history, they still haven't given up the fight.  Through our Music we are here to show our undying love and support for the original peoples who are the genuine caretakers of Mother Earth.  We would love to share our special gifts with the world of loving people, WITH YOUR SUPPORT!

We have already composed all the music we want to feature, and we plan to record live and organic, without the use of electronic instruments (but with mics and computers of course). Now we need a significant boost to actualize our concept : Recording, Mixing+Mastering, CD duplication, and Online Distribution, can be quite a load for unsigned artists, but we know fans like you believe in us enough to help make it happen! 

What We Need

We took some time to work out a practical budget to get all this done in good time. We want to have a physical product by August 2013, which is the month for International Day of the World's Indigenous Peoples, and before most other Indigenous Month celebrations observed in specific territories.  We calculated that $8000 should take care of the production and duplication costs.

 For your love and support we have special gifts: free downloads, signed copies of the official LP (once production is complete August 2013), buttons, autographed posters, and t-shirts with album artwork, and if you decide to be extremely generous, you will receive a custom "nomad sack"- a drawstring bag the size of a rolled up yoga mat, made with authentic indigenous textiles, shells, and stones, and custom hand-engraved calabash bowls from Jamaica (for a real native feel!).

IF WE DO NOT REACH OUR ENTIRE GOAL of $8000 we will still find a way to supplement what we recieve.  This project is a mission for us and we will do all in our power to make it happen.  Every little bit helps! For our contributors,($35 and up) until we complete this production, we will still make available hand-engraved Calabash bowls for keep-sakes!

The Impact

Music and artistic expression have proven, since time immemorial, to aid in the struggle for freedom for many oppressed peoples throughout the world.  Not only to uplift the spirit through the senses, but also to raise awareness to pending issues, and to ignite compassion for humanity and all living beings.  This has been and will always be my mission as an artist.

Other Ways You Can Help

The beautiful thing about Indiegogo, is that you can help just by checking out our unique projects and passing on the information.  Promotion is very valuable to us artists.  Like us on Facebook, follow me on Twitter and buy our music oncdbaby.com. Thank You for your interest (by reading thus far) and please share with other people who care as much as you do using Indiegogo's share tools.

THANK YOU in advance!

story:
The Symposium:  Giving the Canadian a Chance! 

Hello everyone, and first off welcome!  

What this campaign is about is aiding in my attendance at the 2013 Oregon Bach Festival Composers Symposium.  I was selected to be one of the composers at this conference, and was also commissoned to write a new piece for it.  The piece will be performed and recorded as part of the Symposium, and I will have the opportunity to learn from many professionals in the industry during my 12 day stay.

I'm very grateful and excited that you've considered joining me on this part of my journey!  I am grateful to have the opportunity to have a new work premiered in the United States (a first for me), to have the opportunity to study under Grammy Award Winner Stephen Hartke, and to share and learn with other composers!!  I believe that when these opportunities show up in our lives, it is important for us to do everything in our power to make them reality. 

Not only is this a chance to learn and attend the conference, but I will also be able to return with a something tangible; a professional score and recording.  Something I can share with you.

For those who do not know much about me, I am a student of Dr. Derek Charke at Acadia University.  I am entering my fourth year of study with a CGPA of 3.51 (4 being the highest), and will be studying abroad at the University of Freiburg in Germany.  During my year in Germany I will study music composition, classical guitar, and Germanistik (German language/history), and upon my return will graduate with two bachlor degrees.  I intend to acquire my masters degree in music composition, write for film, by commission, for self, and perhaps teach at the University level.  


It is very important for me to do this, composing is what I aim to do with the rest of my life and I thank you from the bottom of my heart for your contribution and support! 

 

THE MATH 

I have put together a costs list, and I have concluded it will take me close to $2000 CDN to achieve my goal.  The flight itself is $1000, the conference $520, and room/board, as well as food expenses bring the total number to around $2000 Canadian. 

What is really cool is that is my first real exposure outside of Canada, and a great opportunity to earn some hands on knowledge! 

 

WHY YOU SHOULD SPONSOR?

You are providing me with the resources to be a part of a great opportunity to learn and grow both as a person, and as a musician!  I will be able to share with the other composers, and with you, just what I do!  Thanks to you, it will be possible.  Isn't that something worth investing in?  Regardless, I will be eternally grateful to you. 

I'm offering more than just a thanks, below is a chart of what I can do to give back to you!  

 

Sponsorships

 

Package 

Description

$5 (Price of a pint)

Cheers!

Thank you email, and my eternal gratitude.  I appreciate every one of you for your support! 

$10

Digital PKG

Digital copies of both the Symposium score and recording!

$20 (case of beer)

Pitcher!

CD Copy of recording, and physical score! (please add $5 for international shipping)

$50

The Two-Four!

Signed copy of Symposium score + Ohne Furcht (premiered at 2013 Shattering the Silence Festival). CD of both recordings, and a special thank you letter! 

$70

One on one! 

Skype music lesson with Adam + Signed Scores + Recordings + Special letter! 

$100

Head to head!

An in person guitar lesson with Adam!  1 hour session, any style of your choosing + Signed Scores + Recordings + Special letter!  (for far travel, we can discuss)

$200

Inside man! 

Your name in the foreword of the Symposium score + credit in following media announcements + Signed Scores + Recordings + Special letter!  

$350

You’re the boss! 

Adam will write/arrange you a short piece, with your choice of title + copy of score/recording! 

$500

You’re the boss, plus!

Adam will write/arrange you a short piece, with your choice of title + copy of score/recording!  The same as ‘You’re the Boss’, except with a greater contribution.

$1000

You are really the boss!

Adam will write/arrange you a short piece, with your choice of title + copy of score/recording!  The same as ‘You’re the Boss’, except with a greater contribution.

 

NO CASH?  OTHER WAYS TO HELP! 

If you are unable to contribute funds to my cause, what you can do is share my campaign!  Share it and talk about it with friends, colleagues, family.  I have learned that the best way to make someting work is by word of mouth. I would appreciate you sending this along to someone who is in a situation to sponsor me!  

 

LINKS

https://soundcloud.com/adamvj  -  To hear current recordings of my work. 

www.viciousisaband.com -   Other explorations of music with the metal band 'Vicious'!

It is very important for me to do this, composing is what I aim to do with the rest of my life and I thank you from the bottom of my heart for your contribution and support! 
 
THE MATH 
I have put together a costs list, and I have concluded it will take me close to $2000 CDN to achieve my goal.  The flight itself is $1000, the conference $520, and room/board, as well as food expenses bring the total number to around $2000 Canadian. 
What is really cool is that is my first real exposure outside of Canada, and a great opportunity to earn some hands on knowledge! 
 
WHY YOU SHOULD SPONSOR?
You are providing me with the resources to be a part of a great opportunity to learn and grow both as a person, and as a musician!  I will be able to share with the other composers, and with you, just what I do!  Thanks to you, it will be possible.  Isn't that something worth investing in?  Regardless, I will be eternally grateful to you. 
I'm offering more than just a thanks, below is a chart of what I can do to give back to you!  
 



Sponsorships
 


Package 


Description




$5 (Price of a pint)


Cheers!


Thank you email, and my eternal gratitude.  I appreciate every one of you for your support! 




$10


Digital PKG


Digital copies of both the Symposium score and recording!




$20 (case of beer)


Pitcher!


CD Copy of recording, and physical score! (please add $5 for international shipping)




$50


The Two-Four!


Signed copy of Symposium score + Ohne Furcht (premiered at 2013 Shattering the Silence Festival). CD of both recordings, and a special thank you letter! 




$70


One on one! 


Skype music lesson with Adam + Signed Scores + Recordings + Special letter! 




$100


Head to head!


An in person guitar lesson with Adam!  1 hour session, any style of your choosing + Signed Scores + Recordings + Special letter!  (for far travel, we can discuss)




$200


Inside man! 


Your name in the foreword of the Symposium score + credit in following media announcements + Signed Scores + Recordings + Special letter!  




$350


You’re the boss! 


Adam will write/arrange you a short piece, with your choice of title + copy of score/recording! 




$500


You’re the boss, plus!


Adam will write/arrange you a short piece, with your choice of title + copy of score/recording!  The same as ‘You’re the Boss’, except with a greater contribution.




$1000


You are really the boss!


Adam will write/arrange you a short piece, with your choice of title + copy of score/recording!  The same as ‘You’re the Boss’, except with a greater contribution.



 
NO CASH?  OTHER WAYS TO HELP! 
If you are unable to contribute funds to my cause, what you can do is share my campaign!  Share it and talk about it with friends, colleagues, family.  I have learned that the best way to make someting work is by word of mouth. I would appreciate you sending this along to someone who is in a situation to sponsor me!  
 


LINKS
https://soundcloud.com/adamvj  -  To hear current recordings of my work. 
www.viciousisaband.com -   Other explorations of music with the metal band 'Vicious'!

story:
Short Summary

First off, I really want to thank all of y'all for making my dreams come true. These past 3 years have been unbelievable. None of it would be possible with y'all.  We're proud of our first record but it's def time for a new one. As you know, Y'ALL ARE OUR RECORD LABEL! Without your support, we'd have nothing!  We need some help from our outlaw family. We're recording a new album in June. We plan on doing cds and vinyl. However, in order for us to make it to the next level as an independant band, we must fund our own radio campaigns to make sure it's heard.  Your contributions will go towards all of this plus our next videos and touring transportation. We're hoping the new product will help push us nation wide.  Even if you can't afford to help financially, the sharing of this campaign will help a lot! We thank you all in advance!

story:
I'm a local artist trying to be more than local! 18 years old born and raised in San Diego CA.

Working my hardest to record my first EP right now, but as many of you musicians know, studio time is extremely expensive if you want it done right! 

Even if I don't meet my total goal, every penny helps and I am so unbelievably grateful to everyone that chooses to donate to my fund and especially to those of you who support my music! 

If you're interested in hearing some of my originals, check out these links!

www.soundcloud.com/avalon-young

www.facebook.com/avalonyoungmusic

www.youtube.com/theavalonyoung

story:
Cheshire Moon is weaving a new tale for their second album, "Crowes and Consequences." While the first album focused heavily on home, this new album ventures out into the nine worlds and latches onto many different viewpoints. We're teaming up with artists Matt Hawk and Shawna Jaquez to bring the mischeif to life!

From the plucky sidekick to the princess who's tired of waiting for her prince, to the crow trying to catch his dinner instead of catching flack, the path winds and weaves to a final note of simple, elegant sweetness. 

But alas, it won't do much of anything without your help! So we're here to show you what we're up to!

We have some of our newest songs up in the Gallery Section. Come have a listen!

Once we're up and running, we'll be attacking our sound engineer with songs and forging Daleks! But these things both take time, so we're trying to be as realistic as possible about how long it will take to get everything ready. We know, November sounds like FOREVER away, but between recording, mixing, mastering, and pressing, it may well take us down to the wire to get this out to you...as the crowe flies. We'll be keeping everyone updated as we go, and if we can get everything out the door early, we will be hanging from the rafters of the sky letting everyone know!

story:
A Powerful New Arts Model 

Catskill Jazz Factory is a non-profit program founded in 2012 by Hudson Valley residents Piers & Lucy Playfair.

  • WE ENCOURAGE children and new audiences to participate at live performances. By partnering with schools, arts & community organizations, and local businesses, we offer in-school workshops and concerts, present in traditional and non-traditional venues, and fund a ticket subsidy program.
  • WE SUPPORT top young jazz artists with artist residencies, performance opportunities, and recording capability.
  • WE PRESENT at diverse venues to introduce world-class musicians to our region.


In Three Years our Achievements have been Phenomenal

  • WORKED with 18 schools across 6 Hudson Valley school districts 
  • PARTNERED with 17 regional & local arts and community organizations
  • PRESENTED at 18 venues throughout the Hudson Valley to diverse audiences
  • HIRED 81 Jazz musicians 
  • EMPLOYED 14 people and WORKED ALONGSIDE countless volunteers

"The Catskill Jazz Factory has the potential to be a model, not just for jazz and not just for Tannersville, but an example to show what art and a community of people in collaboration can do for the betterment of the human spirit".
 -Aaron Diehl, 2011 American Pianists Association Cole Porter Fellow in Jazz & founding CJF Artistic Director

Celebrate our Success and Support this Campaign!

This year will be our busiest yet and we need your support! Our campaign goal is $15,000 and every penny raised will go towards educational workshops, artist residencies, ticket subsidies, album recordings, and creative projects.

The Catskill Jazz Factory is a non-profit program, meaning that ALL donations to our campaign are tax-deductible and you'll automatically receive a receipt upon your donation.

   

The Impact

Hear from musicians and community members about the impact we have made:

"The Catskill Jazz Factory program is a remarkable opportunity for the children on the mountaintop. This really gives the kids a chance to connect things they have learned in the classroom with the outside world. Listening to live jazz - rather than on their iPods or YouTube - brings a broader sense of music and its possibilities directly into their world.  Thank you so much for this wonderful opportunity!!!"
-Shannon Hoyt, Hunter-Tannersville Elementary Music Department

“With this type of program, what they’re [CJF] trying got cultivate isn’t necessarily a thing where you show up one summer, you’re there for a week, and then your name is on the back of the 2013 T-shirt and that’s it, you never hear from them again. They are trying to cultivate different performance opportunities here, really create a community in the sense that every musician that’s been through this program, you’re building a base. You’re building a family.”
-Benny Benack III, trumpeter and CJF residency alum

"The Catskill Jazz Factory provided an once-in-a-lifetime experience for over 100 students in the Kingston City School District with a year-long artist residency, which culminated in a performance pairing students, educators and top notch jazz artists. It is my belief that programs like Catskill Jazz Factory that connect artists, educators, students, and community members are necessary to introduce and develop new audience members to jazz. The Catskill Jazz Factory is leading the way and my students thank CJF for letting us be a part."
-Dan Shaut, Kingston High School Jazz Ensemble Director

"The week I spent at the Catskill Jazz Factory was nothing short of life changing.  The work and dedication that everyone put into it was inspiring. I'm not going to mention anyone, because there weren't that many people involved. Everyone knows everyone. Yet, with such few people something so beautiful took place. I'm in eternal gratitude."
-Tissa Khosla, saxophonist and CJF residency alum 

"This [collaborative event] is another wonderful opportunity for the library to show the community that we are more than books! We so appreciate that we are able to have this partnership with the Catskill Jazz Factory and present these wonderful programs to the residents of the mountain top."
-Susan Kleinfelder, President of local library board of trustees

"Deer Mountain Inn is always excited to work with the Catskill Jazz Factory. Their commitment to bringing in seasoned performers as well as educating and showcasing the next generation of talent (and boy are they talented!) truly enriches the community. Guests at any event we host are consistently blown away that such creative, diverse, and top-notch programming is happening right in our backyard."
-Tricia Wancko, General Manager of Tannersville's Deer Mountain Inn

"Public Concerts, open rehearsals, master classes for the public, outreach programs for schools... We have a big city program in a little town!" 
-Angelo Mecca, Grades 7-12 Music Teacher


About Us

For information about our program, visit www.catskilljazzfactory.org or Like us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/catskilljazzfactory!

Previous programs boast collaborations with a number of world-class musicians, including pianists Marcus Roberts and Dan Tepfer, trombonists Wycliffe Gordon and Chris Washburne, and vocalists Charenee Wade and Cecile McLorin Salvant.

Other Ways You Can Help?

Maybe you can't donate, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Please share our story! Every contribution counts and spreading the word about our mission can be just as helpful as a donation.

Campaign Link:  http://igg.me/at/catskilljazzfactory

For Facebook & Twitter:

Help @CatskillJazz meet their #indiegogo campaign goal! igg.me/at/catskilljazzfactory! #catskills #education #nonprofit #jazz

Proud to support @CatskillJazz ’s #indiegogo campaign to bring arts ed to the Hudson Valley! #catskills #education #nonprofit #jazz

Keep the arts alive by donating to @CatskillJazz ’s #indiegogo campaign! Every dollar goes to students and artists. #jazz #nonprofit

story:
Dear Family, Loved Ones, Friends, & Fans, 

I've made a new record, and I feel that it's some of my best work to date. For now, I'm calling it "Safe and Sound," although the title may change. The songs are about trusting in what fate has in store, despite the temptation to lose faith; they're also about deep true love, the kind that doesn't come around every day. (You'll be happy to know there are only two breakup songs on this record! And one is a cover!). I had a blast collaborating with some incredibly talented producers and musicians on this project, including the amazing Oliver Newell, Josh Merrill, Stevie Blacke (Beck, Rhianna), and Rick Parker (Lord Huron, Ravonettes, BRMC). We recorded in a vintage airstream trailer-turned-studio in a magical orange grove up in Ojai, California, in a cozy home studio in Beachwood Canyon in the Hollywood Hills, and in a state of the art recording studio. 



I hope to release the record in late fall. If a label comes on board, that would be great; either way, I want to ensure that no matter what, I will have the means to make this release count. It is an incredibly eye-opening experience to realize just how expensive it is, in today's crowded music climate, to make a mark, and to have your voice heard, through the noise of the many new artists all over the internet. This requires some degree of marketing and publicity, to stand out. The conundrum is that in this day and age, in which music is basically free to consumers, the role of the traditional record label in developing artists' careers is no longer viable, except in a few cases -- usually highly commercial, pop entities. The bottom line is that no matter how great the music turns out, if no one knows about it, then all the hard work and passion go by the wayside. 

I would like to release this record in a way that will bring attention to it, and give it its due. To bring this project to fruition, I need to rely upon my own resourcefulness, and craft a strategic plan to help spread the word about it. Hiring a team of publicists, marketing companies, and radio promoters amount to many thousands of dollars more than I would be able to come up with via my yoga-teaching and piano-teaching day jobs! This is why I decided that it is now time to include my community in this process, and to raise funds here via indiegogo, to give myself a chance to get put this record on the map. I'm looking toward a release date in late October/ early November of this year. That will give me just about enough time to raise the funding, hire the team, and plan and (begin to) execute the steps needed to bring attention to the album. 

The Process 

So far, I've invested quite a large chunk of my own money into the actual recording, and I still have musicians and engineers to pay, videos to shoot, and touring to embark upon. All of this costs quite a bit, as you can imagine. A reputable publicist is several thousands per month, as is a radio promoter; and these folks don't do campaigns under two (and usually three) months, minimum. Getting myself to different cities to perform requires airline tickets, gas, food, Airbnb'ing, or Motel 6'ing, all of which adds up fast...! 

If you take a look at my indiegogo page, you'll find many fun rewards and perks for contributing to the process of making the record happen. These include a batch of my famous healthy homemade muffins (I ship them next-day air anywhere in the US), handwritten lyrics and signed photos, a Skype piano/ guitar/ or yoga lesson (!), cover songs of your choosing recorded for you, a song written specifically for you or your loved one, house concerts anywhere in the US or abroad, a Happy Birthday song, an outgoing voicemail recording for your phone sung by me, homemade dinner at my house, a visit to the studio or to the video set, and much more. I want to include you guys in the behind-the-scenes of what it takes to make a record and beyond, when the real work begins. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Getting the word out about the record takes much more than just dollars. I hugely appreciate any and all sharing, posting, emailing, calling, shouting, yelling, whispering, texting, and tweeting about my indiegogo page, and about the new album. I couldn't do this without you guys. Thank you from the bottom of my heart!
Love, 
Sara

story:
Musicians from the USA, Canada, Poland, and Israel will be gathering in Warsaw Poland for a special recording project at the end of August. It would only take about 5k for me touse these same musicians to produce a new messianic praise & worship CD while we're at it. This CD would be unlike anything you've ever heard before, and would open up new doors into Poland and Israel for the good news to go through. 

 

I have almost never done a fundraising campaign in 12 years of Ted Pearce Ministries, but I could REALLY use some help if you are so inclined to even purchase it in advance for $10. 

 

We can cut a "low budget" live recording for about 5k minimum, but that doesn't cover manufacturing when it's done, or my personal expenses of going to Poland so we're hoping to do even better. Please be generous?

story:
About Me

My name is Michael R. Jackson and I am a graduate of the Tisch School of the Arts Graduate Musical Theatre Writing Program at NYU. My music has been performed at ACT Seattle, Barrington Stage, Ars Nova, Joe's Pub, The Laurie Beechman Theater, 54 Below, and elsewhere in the New York City area. You can check out some of those performances here. 

I have been slowly and painstakingly working on my debut album Dirty Laundry Good Clean Music since 156 backers and I successfully kickstarted it in 2012 and I am now coming to indiegogo to close the deal and make the album release a reality. That's where you come in.  

About Dirty Laundry Good Clean Music

Dirty Laundry Good Clean Music, is a double LP of stylistically diverse songs that run the gamut from the sacred to the profane. Where the Dirty Laundry tracks are dark, intimate and push the envelope as far it will go, the Good Clean Music tracks are sweet, straightforward, catchy pop songs that are in their own way, a response to those who claim to thirst for more "appropriate" musical theater music. In tandem, these two bodies of work articulate my mission statement as an artist: to create and promote fun and smart musical theater; which is to say, songs that please the ear, touch the heart, and challenge the mind--all at the same time. 

As a result of my Kickstarter campaign, my team and I were able to record vocals and band tracks for 18 songs sung by me and some of the most talented performers in the business: Derrick Cobey, Annie Golden, Molly Hager, Darius Harper, Celisse Henderson, James Jackson, Joelle Lurie, Eric William Morris, Taylor Trensch, Brandon Uranowitz, Blake Whyte, and Jason "Sweettooth" Williams, to name a few. 

Recording only gets us about 85% there in terms of getting the album the ether and into your ears however. In order to complete the album, I need to fully fund the final recording elements (background vocals and some additional instrumentation) but most crucially, the back end production costs: mixing, mastering, pressing, photograhy, artwork, and the costs relative to an album release concert in August/September (pending venue availability) such as musicians, singers, rehearsal space, and other administrative fees. I have estimated that I need to raise $12,000.00 to ensure that the album is able to drop by end of summer 2014. 

A Dirty Laundry track:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KY4lQmen46Q

A Good Clean Music track:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DWTJMkJPlKo

Album Impact

I am a lifelong fan of the album format. As kid, nothing thrilled me more than going to the record store, buying a new album by my favorite artist, taking it home, unwrapping it, pouring over the artwork, liner notes (including the acknowledgments) and reading the lyrics as I listened to a whole work that was constructed to tell a kind of story around a theme. Nowadays it seems most albums are centered around individual hits and individual hits are great but I'm deeply passionate giving you the whole enchilada. Not only do I aim to make Dirty Laundry Good Clean Music a tangible calling card for me but also an artistic touchstone for your music collection so please consider throwing a few bucks my way. It will be so worth it. Get in on the ground floor! 

How Else Can You Help?

Follow me on Facebook and Twitter. Find out more about me, my music, and my collaborators on www.thelivingmichaeljackson.com. Share my music and this campaign with your friends, family, and co-workers. Every little bit helps. So whaddaya say? Can you help a brotha out?
story_txt: About MeMy name is Michael R. Jackson and I am a graduate of the Tisch School of the Arts Graduate Musical Theatre Writing Program at NYU. My music has been performed at ACT Seattle, Barrington Stage, Ars Nova, Joe's Pub, The Laurie Beechman Theater, 54 Below, and elsewhere in the New York City area. You can check out some of those performances here. I have been slowly and painstakingly working on my debut album Dirty Laundry Good Clean Music since 156 backers and I successfully kickstarted it in 2012 and I am now coming to indiegogo to close the deal and make the album release a reality. story:
the breakdown:

hey. i'm aaron and i'm a photographer. 

recently i applied on NASA's website to go and be a part of a small team of social media/photographers to and capture the launch of the rocket they call Antares, which in short, launches Cygnus (and unmanned spacecraft) to go resupply the international space station. this is cool stuff people! you might not have even known we had an international space station.

well, NASA has officially sent me the confirmation...i'm IN! but, i'm going to need some financial help to get there. 

where your money is going:

i figure i'm going to need $1200 to make this happen. 

a place to sleep - $350 - i found a modest hotel thats less than 10 minutes from the facility. i felt like close proximity was key, because i mean, who wants to be late to a rocket launch? 

gas to and from - $300 - 1400 miles round trip. i don't drive a prius (but if someone wants to let me borrow theirs this number can go down immensely).

sustenance - $150 - i'll be bringing some food with me, but this is a backup in case I have to eat at the facility and NASA charges me one arm and one leg for one cookie. 

the extra - part of the extra money will go towards your rewards for supporting me (you can skip below if you don't care for an explanation of the rest).  the other part honestly is just backup.  NASA was very clear in their acceptance email to me that everything has to be perfect for a launch, meaning it could be delayed a day or two which could result in me having to pay for another day/night of out-of-pocket expenses. make sense?

your glorious rewards:

i would love nothing more than to take beautiful pictures of this event for my supporters, and nothing would make me happier than those pictures being displayed in your probably outstandingly gorgeous homes/apts.  

all of the rewards are coming from artifact uprising, meaning, you can be guaranteed to get some quality products. they're committed to it.

$150 or over - an 8.5x8.5 hard cover custom book made specially for you with my favorite 50 photos from the trip. i'll sign it if you want, but my signature is rough. you'll also get 5 custom postcards prints.

$75-149 - an 8.5x8.5 softcover custom book made specially for you with my favorite 40-50 photos from the trip. same thing about the signature...i'm not saying "no", but I'm encouraging you to not ask me to sign it. you'll also get 5 custom postcards prints.

$25-74 - 5 custom postcard prints to send to your friends or keep for yourself. we'll keep it between us if you choose to be selfish. 

$5-24 - a sincere thank you note. you may shed a tear. 

more to the story:

long story short, my job is ending next week and i'll be pursuing photography full-time as of june 1. i feel like getting accepted by NASA to come shoot this launch was one of God's ways of showing me that he cares and has my back through this transition. some of you know this, but i turned NASA down initially knowing that my job was ending and that it wasn't wise to spend money on a trip like this. the only reason i'm going and asking for support is because you people, my friends, told me i'd be crazy to turn this down. i'm seriously getting emotional writing this (no shame here). it's humbling to have so much support from your friends and family. you've all encouraged and believed in my photography (so much recently!) and it's made a huge impact in me. 

so, thank you. i feel a very nervous excitement about this. just know that if you support this trip, i will give every ounce of being into capturing it the most beautiful way i know how. that is my promise to you. 

please share: 

some of you want to give money but you just can't. trust me, i get it. i'd be grateful, whether you can give monetarily or not, if you would share with those you think would be interested.

i cannot thank you enough for taking time to check this out. i don't have a lot of time to raise money (i was just accepted a couple days ago), so if you plan on giving, now seems to be a really great time to do it. :)

please email if you have ANY questions at all:  aaroncoury@me.com

story:
About Jordan Rain and Yogoman

Jordan Rain/Yogoman has been an active musician in the Pacific Northwest United States since 1994 (21 Years). Rain began his musical career in Seattle playing experimental pop, punk, hardcore, free improv music, touring the U.S. multiple times. Yogoman expanded his musical skills by DJing and periodically singing, rapping, informing and making natural sound effects on the microphone over Jamaican and Soul vinyl records from 1998 to the present, out of Bellingham, WA.

Rain began the band Yogoman (originally called Yogoman Burning Band) in 2005 when he realized writing and singing his own music was his calling in life and to set a proper example for his children to follow their dreams. Since then, Yogoman has been firing up crowds of all-ages with his positive and infectious Jamaica-New Orleans Dance Rhythms up and down the west coast.

Learn more about Yogoman at www.yogoman.com 

Why New Orleans Or Bust?  


For the last 10 years, Yogoman has been trying to get his Burning Band to New Orleans (NOLA) because he strongly believes that his music will be a natural fit if given a chance to breathe in the "Big Easy."  New Orleans roots music has been a strong inspiration in Rain's songwriting and his band's overall sound.  Financial concern is the only thing that has kept the band from touring that far away from home, but enough is enough...now it's New Orleans Or Bust!  Rain and his immediate family are prepared to drive there to see what they can accomplish from Mardi Gras through Jazzfest (February-April) whether they have to sleep in their car or not.  Meanwhile Yogoman has applied for festivals such as New Orleans Jazz and Heritage Festival during that time and will be working hard at marketing the band and seeking to collaborate with other New Orleans musicians during their stay. Another reason Yogoman wants to take his music to New Orleans is to bolster the roots sound of the band by either recruiting some members or beginning a NOLA chapter of the group, which would make future national tours more feasible from the South.   

Cost of this trip: $23,000.00

The Breakdown: 

Housing - minimum of $2,000.00 estimated in Rent per month X 3 months = $6,000.00 for hopefully a 2-3 bedroom house that we can rehearse at.  If you are interested in housing us for the duration of our trip, we are looking for sponsors and would trade private concerts and/or parties.

Estimated Gas costs - for driving down and back from Bellingham, WA, getting around the city with musical gear, and scouting out other festivals in Louisiana nearby = $3,000.00

Food costs - for family, videographer and any other players rehearsing or coming down to play = $3,000.00 ($1,000.00 per month estimated)

Washington State home monthly expenses - we have a rent sponsor while being gone which is a HUGE blessing, but other expenses include - car payments $200, Phone bill (for 2) $90, and Car and Trailer insurance $160. Total of each for 3 months is =  $1,350.00

Child Care - for our infant.  We found a great place for our little baby Buck to be taken care of on our last visit while doing business for $30 per visit. Calculating 5 working days a week that is 65 days February through April = $1,950.00

Promo/Audio Recording costs - we will want a budget to make posters to promote any concerts we might play, and for an opportunity to record at a studio. Estimated budget= $1,000.00 for posters/advertising + $2,500.00 for recording at a low budget estimate of $500 per day @ 5 days of recording/mixing = $3,500.00

Documenting the Trip - we feel it is important to document this experience to show the results of our work in New Orleans so we would like to bring our friend and videographer Peter Rand, who has made a full length documentary with Jordan previously and shot and edited the Indiegogo video for this project. His home costs for rent and bills are $1,400.00 per month totaling $4,200.00 for three months. We are planning on posting 2-3 minute video clips to our website and youtube channel on a regular basis along the way so you can follow our adventure.

What results can investors see by funding this project?

Yogoman wants to bring back something sonically different to his NW fans by having the opportunity to submerge his music in New Orleans.  Fans/investors will see new players on the next Summer tour schedule from this experience, new songs written while in New Orleans, and video documentation if enough funding is reached to bring along Rain's videographer friend Peter Rand.

Your business advertised on our website- Investors of $10,000 or more will be featured as a sponsor on the front page of the official Yogoman website for an entire calendar year.  Your business logo will be seen around the world as Yogoman's website receives consistent national and international hits.

Yogoman is extremely grateful to his fans and outer community in supporting his long-time dream of making this official New Orleans connection, which will open the gateway to regular national and international touring.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to donate you can still contribute!

  • Like us on Facebook

  • Share our Videos and Music with your friends

  • Use the indiegogo share tools

story:
Have you known that moment...

Have you known that moment when a song says for you just what you wanted to say? How the music moved you? Or how the lyrics felt like they were speaking right to your heart giving you language to understand your life that you didn't have before? Has a song ever whispered to you some word that kept you going in sorrow? 

That's why I became a songwriter 15 years ago. It's why I picked up a guitar more than 20 years ago. Life is beautiful, life can be so full of sorrow. Those times when a song rises up in the middle of joy or pain to help us understand who we are and what life is really about are a great gift. Will you help me make my next album? 

What does it cost to make a CD? 

It may surprise you how much money it takes to make a quality recording. Even on the budget end it can cost 20 - 30 thousand! Big names spend 200 - 300 thousand! 

I'm self-producing this one. That means I'm managing all the moving parts myself (like a contractor) and recording most of it in my home studio. This will keep the budget lower. However, studio musicians work hard and need to be paid, and once the recording is finished the final steps of mixing, mastering, and manufacturing are costly. 

I'm raising money primarily for these final steps. 

-What is mixing? Good question! Imagine all the recorded audio (vocals, guitars, drums) as basic ingredients from the grocery store. Next you take the ingredients to an accomplished Chef and he skillfully combines them just right so that they sound like the final song you hear on your CDs. Mixing costs around $500 - $1000 per song. (So 12 songs...)

-What is mastering? Good question! Once the musical ingredients are mixed perfectly they are handed over to another chef who's specialty is setting the oven at the perfect temperature and he bakes the cake so that it comes out just right. A mastering engineer takes all the songs and perfects the overall sound till its delicious. :) Mastering costs about $1000. 

- Manufacturing costs about $1500 - $2000.  

A lot goes into making a CD!  As an individual it's a lot to tackle financially. Will you help me make this next CD a reality? 

The most honest I've ever written...

Nearly two years ago I made a Bible Storytelling album called "Bright Came The Word from His Mouth"  in Nashville with Mitch Dane producing (Jars of Clay, Caedmon's Call, and others). It was a blast. You can hear it on my website (www.matthewclark.net/store.html).  

This new project is a very personal collection of songs. I've lately been influenced a lot by Andy Gullahorn, Eric Peters, Andrew Osenga and others. These songs are some of the most honest I've ever written. I want them to be a hospitable place where you and others can be welcomed. I've put my heart into them in hopes that other hearts can find a good habitat in the listening - a place to be honest about suffering, still enough to hear hope, and know that we don't have to remain alone. 

Help me make "Come tell your story". How else are you ever going to hear it? :) 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give financially... Help get the word out to folks you know who love to support quality independent music!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Caroline Spence. I am a 24-year-old Charlottesville, Virginia native now living in Nashville, TN. This past year was full of writing, touring, winning songwriting contests, and checking things off my musical bucket list such as playing at The Bluebird Cafe, appearing in American Songwriter Magazine, and co-writing with a Grammy-nominee. 

I have grown a lot since the last release and it's time to step it up a notch and record a truly professional album in an awesome studio with amazing musicians. I am so ready to make this album. I have over 50 unrecorded songs and we are going to pick the best ones and put them on a full-length album to release in September. 

Although we are doing this as inexpensively as we can, it is still too much for any up and coming independent artist to afford on their own. I do not have a record label supporting me but I don't need one because I have an amazing support system of friends, fans, and family that keep me going. I think together we can make this record happen! 

What We Need & What You Get

Here is where your money is going:

  • Paying the amazing musicians
  • Paying the brilliant producer
  • Paying the perfect studio
  • Paying the helpful engineer
  • Paying the genius who will mix and master the record
  • Paying indieGoGo their allotted fees for using this platform

To show my thanks I've put together some really special and unique reward packages

  • The NEW Album before it's official release date
  • my other album and EP
  • a custom mix CD featuring my favorite songs by my friends (a great way to discover new artists!)
  • Special Edition lyric posters for "Mint Condition" (3 in a set)
  • a "There's Nothing I Need Less Than Whiskey Watered Down" t-shirt
  • Hand-made hats or blankets knitted by ME
  • hand-written lyric sheets to the songs on the new album
  • a cover of your favorite song
  • a song written just for you
  • a house concert
  • a performance at your wedding
  • a song written just for you and performed at your wedding or house concert
  • a 2013 Gibson J-35 played by me and Lee Brice

The Impact

I paid for my two other releases on my own and, I'll be honest, it made for some financial hard times. Even though the songs garnered some recognition, the overall reach and sales could only go so far. This time, by helping me paying for the actual recording of the project, you are freeing up my savings to be spent on other things that will boost the release such as hiring a publicist and covering touring costs.This will all make for a smoother release and a greater chance of more people hearing these songs. Also, any money raised past the $15,000 mark will go towards covering these additional expenses. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel like you are not at a place to financially contribute, that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Tell a friend
  • Share on facebook, twitter, instagram using the indieGoGo share tools
  • Email that friend you played my song for that one time that liked it and tell them about the campaign
  • Get that friend to share the campaign link on facebook, twitter, etc. 
  • Repeat.

I LOVE YOU ALL AND YOU ALL MAKE A DIFFERENCE TO ME
story_txt:
Short SummaryMy name is Caroline Spence. I am a 24-year-old Charlottesville, Virginia native now living in Nashville, TN. This past year was full of writing, touring, winning songwriting contests, and checking things off my musical bucket list such as playing at The Bluebird Cafe, appearing in American Songwriter Magazine, and co-writing with a Grammy-nominee. I have grown a lot since the last release and it's time to step it up a notch and record a truly professional album in an awesome studio with amazing musicians. I am so ready to make this album. I have over 50 unrecorded songs and we are going to pick the best ones and put them on a full-length album to release in September. Although we are doing this as inexpensively as we can, it is still too much for any up and coming independent artist to afford on their own. I do not have a record label supporting me but I don't need one because I have an amazing support system of friends, fans, and family that keep me going. I think together we can make this record happen! What We Need & What You GetHere is where your money is going:
Paying the amazing musicians
Paying the brilliant producer
Paying the perfect studio
Paying the helpful engineer
Paying the genius who will mix and master the record
Paying indieGoGo their allotted fees for using this platform
To show my thanks I've put together some really special and unique reward packages
The NEW Album before it's official release date
my other album and EP
a custom mix CD featuring my favorite songs by my friends (a great way to discover new artists!)
Special Edition lyric posters for "Mint Condition" (3 in a set)
a "There's Nothing I Need Less Than Whiskey Watered Down" t-shirt
Hand-made hats or blankets knitted by ME
hand-written lyric sheets to the songs on the new album
a cover of your favorite song
a song written just for you
a house concert
a performance at your wedding
a song written just for you and performed at your wedding or house concert
a 2013 Gibson J-35 played by me and Lee Brice
The ImpactI paid for my two other releases on my own and, I'll be honest, it made for some financial hard times. Even though the songs garnered some recognition, the overall reach and sales could only go so far. This time, by helping me paying for the actual recording of the project, you are freeing up my savings to be spent on other things that will boost the release such as hiring a publicist and covering touring costs.This will all make for a smoother release and a greater chance of more people hearing these songs. Also, any money raised past the $15,000 mark will go towards covering these additional expenses. Other Ways You Can HelpIf you feel like you are not at a place to financially contribute, that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
Tell a friend
Share on facebook, twitter, instagram using the indieGoGo share tools
Email that friend you played my song for that one time that liked it and tell them about the campaign
Get that friend to share the campaign link on facebook, twitter, etc. 
Repeat.
I LOVE YOU ALL AND YOU ALL MAKE A DIFFERENCE TO ME

story:
A Quick Intro

From Executive Producers Bryan & Tam Little and Produced by Jonathan Clarke, The GRIP Music Video Show is a 30 minute internet show that premiers on a biweekly basis Fridays at 6pm Eastern Standard Time. The GRIP explores the lives of agents of change and ordinary people doing extraordinary things and is centered solely around relevant interviews while showing rap music videos from international independent label artists. The show is produced in different US cities and is highly praised as being a show that goes into the neighborhoods and the lives of the artists. The show includes articles and stories about living, ministry, activities, and Christian challenges.

With 26 episodes a year, we excel to reach to target a mix of ministry and industry influentials. We do this while staying current on what's going on in the world and how it affects the Christian youth community as host Jonathan Clarke or “Clarke Kent” hit the streets of cities from New York to Los Angeles.  Since its inception a few short months ago, The GRIP has had over 1500 individual views online.

What We Need & What You Get

The GRIP Music Video Show connects the viewer to how the Gospel of Jesus Christ has influenced those in the Christian music, television, radio, film, print media and a host of other industries. We provide self-help tools, advice, ministry opportunities and encouragement to the audience through through interviews, event coverage, reviews, and reporting. We also desire to be on scene at sites of NATURAL DISASTER or TRAGEDY which affects all of us in order to aid in relief efforts. The GRIP reflects the Christian lifestyle and issues of our target demographic ages 18 to 35.

Our work is only made possible with the generous help from you. I want to thank you for your commitment to our mission to advance the work of artists. We think it is so important to promote these important voices in society.

There are many ways to show your support besides helping to fund our initiative. Here are 2 ways you can help:

  1. Share #thegripshow with your online network https://twitter.com/thegripshow
  2. “Like” us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/thegripmusicvideoshow

What Happens If We Surpass Our Goal?

We would love to continue The GRIP’s mission to discover and foster independent Christian artists. Your investment advances the work of artists in music, film, television, print media and a host of industries, and music through advancing our artists programs and allows for us to continue providing a platform for artists to share their skills and talents with the world.

If we do more than $10,000, we will use the excess money to do just that. On average every $1000 - $2000 above our goal will allow us to expand the shows reach to satellite television and giving more opportunities to artists. Thank you!

**Investments are not tax deductible!**

story:
Our Story

Hey everybody, We hope you had as good a time at this year's Future Folk as we did.  We would like to thank everyone who made it out, and to those of you who couldn't, we hope you will make it next year!


This years edition was a blast.  All of the bands and DJs were stellar, from MUN to Space Jesus, Ten Sleep to GoferBoy, each set was a unique experience.  The wood stage, the beautiful field and camping area, and the great weather all weekend (except for a bit of rain on Saturday) provided the scene for a fantastic weekend of future revelry. 

Big thanks to all those who stepped up and helped out when it was needed most!


Unfortunately we did not get enough people to cover all of the festival costs.  Since Future Folk is a small not-for-profit organization, there is really nowhere for this money to come from, except our core member's future paychecks.


As a result, we are coming to you for help.  We hope you will consider donating even a small amount .


The Impact

Your money will help us pay off this years festival, so we can get working on the next!


Some of the specific things the money will cover are:

-porta-potties

-insurance bill

-sound and equipment rental


What We Need & What You Get

This money will go directly to pay off the outstanding bills for the festival. That's it.


At this point the Future crew has already taken a loss, we just want to make sure everything gets paid for without plunging our core members further into debt.


Any amount is greatly appreciated.


Other Ways You Can Help

(Unleash the DIWO! -- 'Do It With Others' by asking folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Don't forget to remind them about the share tools!)


Thanks for your time!


the Future Folk crew

story:
"Let's live and let others live by sharing excess of what was given to us by our Friend Above."

Foreword

Our first project is listed here and although it didn't reach the goal, we did get a lot of contributions outside of Indiegogo. For that, we would like to say thank you! It truly means a lot to all the people we are supporting. If you want to be updated on the progress of the 1st project, please visit our Facebook page. Thank you once more!

 

This picture is taken during the fluvial parade of 31 boats - Launch (1-5-2014)

Summary

  • I'm Ben Belasoto, a native of Estancia, Iloilo. Our family  is facilitating a livelihood project for Yolanda victims
  • We are calling on people with generous hearts who can help fishermen stand up and live again by contributing to fund and build boats for them to make a living
  • "Let them live" concept applies to Donors through funding, organizers through project facilitation(free services), recipients through their weekly payments.

Rent to Own at an easy payment scheme promotes Social Responsibility . Recipients are committed to pay rent because they know that proceeds will be used to build new boats for others on the waiting list. Thus, the number of recipients expand as it progresses.

  • Plain Boat - Weekly Payment - $3.25 (or P20 daily)
    Motorized Boat - Weekly Payment - $4.90 (P30 daily)

OTE: This payment scheme will also discourage unlikely recipients who would only desire to get a boat for free and then sell it for money.

What We Need & What You Get

  • A $2000 budget will help build boats for 10 households in Manipulon Island who signified to the "Rent to Own" livelihood project.
  • Being a DONOR, you will receive regular updates (texts/pictures, financial accounting) on the progress of the project through Facebook. Aside from that, depending on the amount donated, you'll have a chance to get thank you lanyards, photos and videos of recipients, Facebook shout outs and your names posted in Barangay Plaza. And of course, we'll offer a short prayer for your personal intentions.
  • Any amount we get (even if its below the goal) will be used for the project. Excess amount will be used for the same project on another Barangay.

If you are a donor, please send me your email address in belasoto@yahoo.com so that i update you with the accounting and progress of this campaign.

Weekend session in Barangay Daculan

 

Your contribution, regardless of the amount, is a means to rebuild the LIVES of these recipients and will mean a lot to them.

one of the 1st consultation meetings in Barangay Manipulon

Management Team(services offered free)


Sheila Penalosa (Adm. Clinician Sup | ConeyIsland, NY) - Proj Coordinator/Treasurer
Ben Belasoto (Site Lead& Director | TeleTech) - Project Director
Jose Belasoto (Asst. Municipal Statistician | Estancia) - Project Manager
Julie Ann Barlas (NIPSU Office Clerk) - Project Auditor


Here's where we are as of February 8 (90 days after Yolanda or Haiyan):
>70 Recipients from 2 Barangays (Daculan and Manipulon)
>23 left on the Waiting List
>16 Boats Coming (10 out of 16 is a pledge from one of the donors...)
>Total Cash received 758,958 Php with 80,432 Php Remaining
>Total Collections since it started in the past 4 weeks is PhP 30,000+
>Preliminary Talks Done with Tanza Kapitan to help the victims (in the 3rd barangay).

 

Other Ways You Can Help

As we know that not everyone can afford to help us financially we will be grateful if you could:

• Please spread the word to potential donors like your friends, relatives or colleagues and share it on all social networks you are on.
• Please also like our crowd funding page and share it. That would help us get featured on the Indiegogo homepage which could potentially attract more donors.

 

Latest Barangay Mission with 40 Haiyan Victims signing up

story:
Hello, friend!
Thank you for giving us time and maybe a chance for our new album - released not only in a ‘digital’ format but as a “PHYSICAL CD” with very beautiful packaging. It’s THE GOAL ! We are signed at Melodic Revolution Records label, our album is finished, Ed Unitsky created stunning artworks for it, great and famous musicians believe in our music and took part in this record - the only MEGADREAM for us now - to release beautiful CD with lush packaging that you will like with no doubt!

We (and personally me, Alex Kulak) are not simply “brave” here, in the End Of the World (as you maybe think about Tynda, Sybir, Russia). BUT we love to create powerful progmetal music in our own special style also mixing classics’ of the genres’ influence, from Dream Theater, Megadeth, and Yes, to Russian folklore and even “Queen” (thanks to our amazing singer Yann!). We are proud to present our 7th studio album, and the 1st Azazello’s album on English, called MEGADREAM. It based on a mystic/Sci-Fi story that was written by our friend, and Ed Unitsky’s artworks to the album show you the way!

Megadream: more than Guests!

We are happy that Kerry ‘Kompost’ Chicoine  (ex-Marc Hollow, now - Heliopolis), Bill Berends (Masternind, solo) and Michael Ogorodov (many projects including Pierre Moerlen’s Gong) believe in our music and you can’t miss their brilliant parts in several tracks at the album! This collaboration is really MEGADREAM for us. We are also speechless reading this comment from Kerry ‘Kompost’ Chicoine: “I was asked to contribute some bass for a great band called AzaZello based out of Tynda, Russia; definitely the longest-distance collaboration I've done yet. Azazello's music runs the gamut from math-y Dream Theater-esque progressive metal and heavy rock to Russian folk and melodic jazz. Highly entertaining stuff! Huge thanks to Alexandr Kulak for reaching out to me, I had a blast doing this and I am very happy to be in such great musical company”. Just… THANKS!

 

Megadream: Ed Unitsky’s Art

AzaZello’s big friend and famous artist Ed Unitsky (you can see his artworks for The Tangent, The Flower Kings, Anima Mundi, Mandalaband and many others) works with this release and all these amazing artworks have to be printed (at least!) for the best look! With this CD packaging we are going to bring something real and very beautiful in your music collection! The album: www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.564671646911830.1073741827.491414457570883&type=3

Megadream CD : what we need

This is what we need with your more than kind help: CD manufacturing! Here you can see many ways HOW TO MAKE IT REAL – with something pleasant for you ;)  And there is only 60 days to raise the sum!

Our minimum fund-raising goal is 3 800 $ that has to cover

-          CD manufacturing (we want to surprise you with not usual and VERY nice packaging!).

-          Indiegogo’s fees

-          Bank charges and postage for pledges

And any extra capital raised beyond this campaign goal would go for  extra-‘lush’ packaging. Anyway - we guarantee that you will be pleased by this release and all the merchandise. Thank you for your support from all our band !!!

Megadream: sweet memory…

This album is very special and important for all of us. Our dearest friend and Azazello’s drummer Vladimir Demakov has passed away in a tragic  car incident 12.10.11 just after demos’ recording for the album. We decided to keep all of his parts at this album – you can hear them and judge how talented our young friend was… Megadream album is dedicated to his sweet memory.

AzaZello, “Megadream”album:
Alexandr Kulak, Yan Zhenchak, Vladimir Kulak, Vladimir Demakov (R.I.P.)
SPECIAL GUESTS:
Bill Berends - www.billberends.com
Kerry 'Kompost' Chicoine  - www.facebook.com/kerrykompost
Misha Ogorodov – http://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/Огородов,_Михаил_Михайлович

Ed Unitsky -www.edunitsky.com , www.facebook.com/Ed.Unitsky.fanpage

Dmitry Bosov – “Clock Face” Story’s author

 

Megadream: poetry

Known rock-journalist, owner of www.dmme.net Dmitry M. Epstein created amazing and so “powerful” English lyrics based on a mystic/sci-fi “Clock Face” Story that was written by our friend – we can’t thank Dmitry enough!

AzaZello
www.facebook.com/AzaZello.page

www.melodicrevolution.com/page/azazello

http://www.myspace.com/azazelloband
http://www.azazello-band.ru

story:
Hello & Welcome.

This is Jimmy, Joanna and Phil and we are so excited to share our project with you! We have poured our hearts into this album and the reason behind it is one that we wholeheartedly believe in and believe it will resonate with you too! 

We named our album “A Letter” because God has written on our hearts a letter of Christ and this is our way of sharing that with you! (2 Corinthians 3:3).

Why This Project Is Important To Us:

For two reasons we consider this project our act of worship to Jesus.

1.  This project is our honest and humble efforts to express what Christ has written on our hearts, thus “A Letter.” (II Corinthians 3:3)

2.  This project is one of doing real justice in a really broken world by raising awareness and money to support Hope Ranch and their mission to minister and restore victims of Human Trafficking.  

As followers of Jesus, we believe our worship isn’t fully realized unless doing justice flows from it. For instance, look at Isaiah chapter 6. This entire chapter is an ebb and flow of God's Revelation and Isaiah's Response which is ultimately a picture of what worship is; Revelation & Response. In Isaiah, God reveals Himself enthroned and holy and in response Isaiah says "woe is me... I am a man of unclean lips and live among a people of unclean lips." Isaiah responds by confessing his immorality and at the end of this encounter Isaiah responds by saying "yes" to God's commissioning to go out into the world and speak justice to this people. In the same way, we have chosen to worship God and respond to His calling by using this album to support Hope Ranch and doing justice in our broken world. Hope Ranch is a safe & restoring place for girls who have been rescued off the streets and out of Human Trafficking. We will support Hope Ranch by giving them %50 of the money that we raise from "A Letter". The other %50 of proceeds will go to more House Of Worship Projects by local Christian artists, giving them a voice to share with you what God has written on their hearts. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are so grateful for your support in any fashion whether it be through prayer, financial support or helping us spread the word about this project!  

You will receive an album that we have poured our time and energy into! We have enjoyed the process of writing this album together and combining our musical and lyrical styles to produce this delightful album! We think that you will love what we've come up with!

On the right side of this page we have created exciting and pleasing perks with you in mind that we are confident you will enjoy! These perks are our way of saying thank you for your faith and support!

PERKS include but not limited to...

  • early bird digital copy of our album
  • a chance to sing on our album!
  • songs personally written for you
  • House Concerts
  • throwing eggs at Ethan (you read correctly)
  • A unique & creative Deluxe Album!
  • and much, much more!!!!
  • --- (pooling money together with friends is encouraged:) and 
  • --- (we can schedule delivery date for appropriate perks once perk has been purchased)
Your support raised through Indiegogo will make it possible for us to record and manufacture “A Letter.” To break it down for you, our cost is $3500 for the recording process and $1000 for the manufacturing of the album. The extra $500 will go towards tidying things up by paying for the materials used for the perks, shipping cost for the albums, and so forth. Any extra money made during this campaign will go to future House Of Worship Projects and supporting Hope Ranch.

We are committed to seeing this project through and are excited to partner with you!

Other IMPORTANT Ways You Can Help

You are a tremendous help by “liking” this page and sharing our campaign through    your facebook, twitter, instagram by using the indiegogo share tools above.

Partner with us by spreading the word!

Best,                                                                                                                      Jimmy, Joanna and Phil
story_txt:
Hello & Welcome.This is Jimmy, Joanna and Phil and we are so excited to share our project with you! We have poured our hearts into this album and the reason behind it is one that we wholeheartedly believe in and believe it will resonate with you too! We named our album “A
Letter” because God has written on our hearts a letter of Christ and this is our way of sharing that with you! (2 Corinthians 3:3).
Why This Project Is Important To Us:For two reasons we consider this project our act of worship to Jesus.
1. 
This project is our honest and humble
efforts to express what Christ has written on our hearts, thus “A Letter.” (II
Corinthians 3:3)
2. 
This project is one of doing real
justice in a really broken world by raising awareness and money to support Hope Ranch and their mission to minister and restore victims of Human Trafficking.  
As followers of Jesus, we believe our worship
isn’t fully realized unless doing justice flows from it. For instance, look at Isaiah chapter 6. This entire chapter is an ebb and flow of God's Revelation and Isaiah's Response which is ultimately a picture of what worship is; Revelation & Response. In Isaiah, God reveals Himself enthroned and holy and in response Isaiah says "woe is me... I am a man of unclean lips and live among a people of unclean lips." Isaiah responds by confessing his immorality and at the end of this encounter Isaiah responds by saying "yes" to God's commissioning to go out into the world and speak justice to this people. In the same way, we have chosen to worship God and respond to His calling by using this album to support Hope Ranch and doing justice in our broken world. Hope Ranch is a safe & restoring place for girls who have been rescued off the streets and out of Human Trafficking. We will support Hope Ranch by giving them %50 of the money that we raise from "A Letter". The other %50 of proceeds will go to more House Of Worship Projects by local Christian artists, giving them a voice to share with you what God has written on their hearts. 
What We Need & What You Get
We are so grateful for your support in any fashion whether it be through prayer, financial support or helping us spread the word about this project!  You will receive an album that we have poured our time and energy into! We have enjoyed the process of writing this album together and combining our musical and lyrical styles to produce this delightful album! We think that you will love what we've come up with!On the right side of this page we have created exciting and pleasing perks with you in mind that we
are confident you will enjoy! These perks are our way of saying thank you for your faith and support!PERKS include but not limited to...

early bird digital copy of our album

a chance to sing on our album!
songs personally written for you
House Concerts
throwing eggs at Ethan (you read correctly)
A unique & creative Deluxe Album!
and much, much more!!!!

--- (pooling money together with friends is encouraged:) and 
--- (we can schedule delivery date for appropriate perks once perk has been purchased)
Your support raised through Indiegogo will
make it possible for us to record and manufacture “A Letter.” To break it down
for you, our cost is $3500 for the recording process and $1000 for the
manufacturing of the album. The extra $500 will go towards tidying things up by
paying for the materials used for the perks, shipping cost for the albums, and
so forth. Any extra money made during this campaign will go to future House Of

We are committed to seeing this project through and are excited to partner with you!Other IMPORTANT Ways You Can Help

using the indiegogo share tools above.
