story:
The Story: 

The Belwop Project has been working for over 2 years to purchase a new home for the Belwop Children's Home in Nyeri, Kenya for the abused, neglected, and orphaned children there.

Right now, the home can house no more than 20 children, and the new home that is within their grasp can house 100 children!  

Over the course of 2 years, friends, colleages, college students, and others have donated, and Cultivate Wines (www.cultivate.com) had a voting session, with the grand prize of $50,000 going to Belwop to purchase this new home! 

And this is the final stride - Belwop Project needs $30,000 more to completely finish purchasing the home!

Here's the goal: 

1000 People + $30 Each = $30,000

 

What We Are Doing:

Isaac Gill and myself (Stephen Stonestreet) are heading on tour screening Belwop's 'Hope Has A Home' Documentary, playing music, spreading the word about Belwop and the needs of the orphans in Kenya, and raising support to purchase a new home for orphans. 

Below are the cities we will be touring too: 

- Norfolk, VA

- Charlottesville, VA

- Lynchburg, VA

- Charleston, WV

- and possible others...

 

The Impact

Through this tour, we hope to bring hundreds of more people around the Belwop Movement and raise a substantial amount towards the needed $30k, our hope is $4,000! 

We hope to inspire a movement of individuals on the East Coast to begin supporting Belwop with their voice, fingers (social media), and their finances! If the people who come to these events get excited (which they will!), then we'll not only have a group of people support Belwop, but their communities around them who will know about it as a result! 

 

What do we need? 

Here is what we need (in bullet point form): 

 

- A VEHICLE: $200

- Gas for tour: $175

- Food for our bellies: $100

- $25 for printing posters for the event(s). 

 

All money we receive here on IndieGoGo ABOVE our goal will go directly to help finish purchasing the home! And if we find a car to drive, and don't have to rent one, then the $200 designated for that purpose will be directly placed in the plate to finish purchasing the home in Kenya!

 

How To Help:


- Contribute via IndieGoGo to help us get on the road!

- Spread the word about Belwop and the 30K All The Way Campaign on your social media sites (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc...)! (INFO BELOW)

- Go on tour with us!

- If you have a vehicle, would you be willing to let us use it for the tour (Go with us)?

- Join the Belwop Movement to give hope and a home to more orphans in Kenya!

 

 

Spread the Word!

Post the text below on Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram using tags and hashtags, #belwop #30kalltheway #orphans #africa #kenya

RP Help @BelwopProject purchase a new home for #orphans! 30K All The Way: 1000 peeps + $30 each - www.belwopproject.com #belwop #30kalltheway

Tag us :: (Facebook) @Belwop Rescue Center (Twitter) @BelwopProject

 

*This IndieGoGo campaign was released by Isaac and myself to raise money privately to send us both on tour. 

*100% of all proceeds donated here goes directly towards the tour in order for us to raise awareness and funds to help finish purchasing a new home in Nyeri, Kenya for the Belwop Kids.

story:
Short Summary

We are a group of friends that decided to turn our jam sessions into a band and start trying to make a name for ourselves. We long to reach people with the music we make and the love that we show. We enjoy writing about life, pain, God and love. We came up with the name, Anchor North. The video explains a little bit more about the name and what it means to us. We all decided that we wanted to make this band something serious and start recording and playing as many shows as we could. So basically as a young group, we need as much support as we can in order to do what we hope to do these next few months.

What We Need & What You Get

We need about $3,000 to record this album and pay for traveling expenses on our summer tour. We are planning on recording this album with our friend, Wes Arvin. We cannot express how excited and anxious we are to start moving forward. Right now we are planning on touring this summer with our good friend, Kevin Rodriguez of TROTB. Hopefully we will be making a stop in a town near you!

We have done our best to set up some fun rewards for you to back our campaign. We can't wait to see what God has in store for us and our music career and we hope you will join us as we start this long journey!

The Impact

We are so grateful for the people God has placed in our lives and the blessings he has given us and we realize that without you we cannot do any of this. So the impact you are making on our lives is far bigger than you can see right now, but is sure to grow this year. By supporting our campaign and helping us fund this album and tour you are sending us forward so far and giving us the opportunity to show our music to the world and spread hope and love to those in need.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that some of you simply cannot give money and thats okay. We need just as much help promoting this on every single social media you have an account with! Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, Instagram, ANYTHING! WE NEED YOUR HELP! You can do this easily by either copying this URL into another site or by using the Indie GoGo share tools.

story:
Hello everyone its Mike Larry Draw here and I am ready to share. I spent the pass year writing the songs and producing instrumentals for this album, and more recently mixing and mastering with the equipment that I have.  Comprised of progressive arrangements, and various tempo changes by yours truly, I locked myself in a room, I made what I believe, and what others have told me, to be a great album that will make you pee your fucking pants for joy. It sounds like nothing I’ve ever heard, and I made it, Lol, Especially for its genre. This album has some great sounds, ORGANS, SYNTHESIZERS, GUITAR, HEAVY DRUMS and more PS “NO SAMPLES”. I hope to be touring this project across the globe this year. As I travel I will be working on some KILLER music videos,

DIRECTED BY ME!!!!!!!!!! Plus working on some art pieces I can share with everyone.

Im almost to the finish line, I am very close to having my creative freedom, and being a full time artist for the fans. BUT this same freedom has its drawbacks- since I don’t have the financial muscle and backing of a large record label, recording each album sets me back to cash zero. And once I release each album, there is no funding to produce CDs or vinyl, to promote the album, and NEVER any money left to equip, rehearse, and take a show on the road. Tour support costs way more than most people realize. And that's a cycle most independent musicians now struggle to break.

With your help I will take this new album and my other music out on the road in 2013 and play everywhere I can.

 

 

This is my chance. Donate and help me get this request to as many people as you can- and I'll use the money we raise together to manufacture, Promote, and go on tour. IT'S AS SIMPLE AS THAT.

 

 

 

With enough money raised I can share my art with the world weather if its on a poster, sticker, button, patch or a piece of clothing. I've spent many hours of the day designing for you all carefully, and I'm pleased to offer a variety of options that I personally would love to own. I will keep the quality as high as I can. You can find the full descriptions in the pledges on the right.

 

 

THANK YOU EVERYONE!!!!!!!!!!!

story:
• My name is Aaron Cloutier.  I'm a musician, songwriter and guitar/vocal instructor at the School of Rock in Chatham, New Jersey
  • I'm raising $1000.00 for a retainer for my attorney to contact a music licensing company as we have reason to believe there is a potential breach of contract between they and myself.  My song "I of the Obscene" is currently a Nickelodeon commercial and I have received zero royalties to date.
  • Your donation will help cover the legal fees necessary for my attorney to contact this company directly and investigate why nickelodeon has my song and why I haven't received royalties for the use of my song as is part of the contract I have with said company.  Any extra funds after legal costs will go towards medical bills due to a fractured arm I received on May 4 from being dragged a block by a NYC taxi cab.

"Hello all I apologize in advance for how lengthy a post it will be but if you can take the time to read, I would appreciate it greatly...........here it goes.

My song "I of the Obscene" is currently being used in a Nickelodeon commercial. Attached is a video taken by a fan of his own TV screen as the commercial is being aired. (There are other's floating around on Youtube if you feel like viewing them as well)

http://youtu.be/T2uc5UZ9hR4

After speaking to two different attorneys, it looks like I am facing a possible breach of contract between myself and a company in NYC (which will remain nameless until confirmed) I licensed my music through.

In 2012, An agreement was signed between myself and this company stating that there was to be an even 50/50 split of any revenue generated from the use of my music licensed out to any company. To this date, I have received zero royalties for the use of my song in the commercial and to my knowledge, the commercial began airing in October of 2013 and is still in rotation. So as it stands until we know more, it appears this company (who is affiliated with nickelodeon by the way) gave my song to Nickelodeon to be used in their commercial and I have not yet been compensated as part of our signed agreement. In other words, it looks like this company breached our contract.

To confirm this, my attorney will be contacting this company to find out more. However, I'm required to pay a $1000.00 retainer fee to cover legal expenses and will need to come up with half of the money by Friday June 6th to get the ball rolling. Unfortunately what with normal everyday living expenses/loans and my recent medical bills due to the accident involving me getting dragged down a block by a New York City Taxi driver on May 4th, ( Yes.  True story unfortunately) I don't have the money to cover a $1000.00 retainer.  This a very humbling position for me to be in.  I've always considered myself super independent and I really hate having to ask anyone for money but what with the time frame and the current circumstances, I really feel that I don't have any choice.  As a way of saying thank you for your donation.  I will be offering a list of services pertaining to my work as a professional musician.  I have worked with numerous musician's/artists from Latin Metal band Ill Nino, to renowned actor Christopher Lee and can only promise I'll give 100% to whatever product or service you decide to donate to.    Any support will be immensely appreciated and compensated for. Thank you so much for reading and please spread the word to those you know.

Thank you all again.

Aaron.

story:
Buy your BeatBuddy now! 




The Power of a Drum Machine, the Simplicity of a Pedal

Convenient: Plugs right in with your other pedals to play a drum beat through your amp or PA. 

Hands-free control

  • Insert fills
  • Transition from verse to chorus
  • Add accent hits (e.g. cymbal crashes or hand claps)
  • Pause/unpause beats with second footswitch, while song is playing
  • Advance to next song with second footswitch, when no song is playing

Professional-grade sound

  • Meticulously sampled drums at full dynamic range

  • Advanced algorithms generate realistic natural beats




"...a dream come true for one-man band singer-songwriters."
-- MusicRadar.com

“a genius idea… the simple hands-free drum machine guitar players have been waiting for.”
-- Gizmodo

"The BeatBuddy is something I can use for my solo gigs – of which I do at least 100-150 a year. It’s the one thing that I have been missing..."
-- GuitarGear.org

"I don't think I've ever seen such amazing support for a guitar related product... incredible! ...definitely looks like a lot of fun!"
-- Guitarnoize.com

"Accurate timing and a solid sense of rhythm is requisite for any musician. The BeatBuddy is the perfect solution and its a blast to work (and play) with! We're thrilled to introduce it to our student body." 
-- Brad Wendkos, Founder TrueFire.com The leading online educational resource for guitarists

                    


1.8" Color LCD display 


Pre-loaded with:

  • 10 unique drum sets
  • 200+ songs (verse/chorus beat progressions) in a wide range of musical styles
  • Computer software to load your own beats and drum sets

Adjust tempo with:

  • A turn of a knob
  • Tap tempo with a button or footswitch

MIDI Sync: Integrate with MIDI based loopers and effects in your rig.

Headphones Jack: For jamming without disturbing the neighbors!

Full stereo sound 

Beautiful strong construction made from anodized aluminum. 

Built for tough live performance environments.

Connects with standard mini USB cable.

Expand memory with standard SD card.



Completely customizable with included computer interface software:

  • Load your own beats and drum sets
  • Uses standard MIDI and WAV files
  • Add additional song parts (verse, chorus, bridge, fills etc.)


New beats and drum sets to be available for download on regular basis.  We will be producing both free and premium content packages

User Forum on our site will allow all BeatBuddies to share their beats and drum sets!  The BeatBuddy is not just a pedal -- it's a platform.



"Well designed and intuitive"
-- MusicRadar


1. Press pedal to start beat

2. Press again to add a fill. Different fills are played each time to create a live drummer sound

3. Hold pedal down to begin transition beat

4. Release pedal to end transition and go to next song part (e.g. verse to chorus)

5. Use footswitch (mono) to add accent hits. Accent hits are customized to the song part (e.g. hand claps for verse, cymbal crashes for chorus)

6. Use second footswitch (stereo) to pause/unpause beat.

7. Press pedal twice to stop beat with ending fill.





Here's what you get when you support this campaign. Just select your perk from the sidebar at the top  right of this page.


Bonus from our Partners:


The best drum machine is only as good as the content on it.  We have partnered with GoranGrooves Studio, a world-class drum recording service in Miami to create content for the BeatBuddy.  The sound samples are recorded and processed with meticulous care using top of the line equipment, drums and percussion.   The MIDI beats are not quantized and each drum is multi-sampled at various dynamic levels for ultra-realistic natural sound.

We are including general beats from a wide range of styles as well as the beats to specific songs.


We would like to hear your requests for musical styles or specific songs and drum sets you'd like to come pre-loaded on your BeatBuddy!  Please post them on our Facebook page.


Our first BeatBuddy Artist Demo:



BeatBuddy tutorial: Content navigation + dual footswitch functions



BeatBuddy feature demo: Tempo control



Check out this video of our process of creating the BeatBuddy's drum sets:



More videos coming soon!





David Packouz, Founder & CEO

Singer/Songwriter/Guitarist based in Miami Beach.  A serial entrepreneur, he has founded numerous successful businesses ranging from electronics import to government contracting to smartphone app development. The BeatBuddy is the culmination of his passion for invention and music.

Goran Rista, Director of Content

Founder of GoranGrooves, a world-class online recording service based in Miami. He is an accomplished session drummer and audio engineer. A pioneer of the online recording studio, he is dedicated to providing the highest quality professional music recording & mixing services to the music community world-wide.

Sylvain Ainsley, Director of Engineering

With 15 years of experience in electronics engineering and extensive knowledge of the latest technologies, he is responsible for designing the architecture and oversees the whole project so that every aspect comes together flawlessly.

Guillaume Frigon, Software Designer

With 7 years of experience in software and firmware development, he has worked on a wide range of graphical user interfaces (GUI) for the medical, broadcast and fitness industry. He is designing the song manager computer interface software.

Matthieu Ippersiel, Software Designer

With deep knowledge of embedded systems and high level mobile applications, he has been involved in various fields of technology such as medical, remote security and consumer applications. He is designing the software & user interface for the drum set creator.

Frédéric Paquet-Roy, Hardware Designer

An expert on analogue and digital electronic circuits, he has been involved in the design of many complex systems from aeronautics to high tech consumer products. Frederic designed the BeatBuddy's analogue audio circuits.

Marc-Andre Filion, Hardware Designer

With over 10 years of experience in electronic design, he has worked on many complex projects including mother board design for industrial computers and high speed communication interfaces. He designed the BeatBuddy's digital circuitry.

Olivier Bacon, Firmware Designer

With extensive experience in embedded applications, audio processing, and firmware designs, he designed the embedded firmware for the screen, switch, nobs, audio playback and mixing.


Jim Tremblay, Firmware Designer

Involved in wide range of product design projects from security to access controls to manufacturing, he has extensive knowledge of embedded systems, graphical user interfaces and production specs. He designed the BeatBuddy's firmware low-level peripheral access and the frame buffer manager for the user interface.

Daniel Tasse, Mechanical Engineer

Holds multiple object design patents, worked at Canadian Voice Data Switching, as supervisor of the printed and electromechanical circuit design department. He designed the BeatBuddy's enclosure.







We have completed all pre-production hardware engineering and we have a fully functional prototype.  

Currently we're working on:

  • Refining the computer interface software
  • Tweaking the firmware to make the BeatBuddy sound even better! 
  • Creating content: beats, drum sets
  • Tooling

We will soon begin the process of:

  • Getting product certifications
  • Materials procurement
  • Production
  • Building the user forum



  1. GENERAL
  2. FUNCTIONAL
  3. TECHNICAL
  4. DELIVERY

I see the Indiegogo campaign has ended. Is it too late to pre-order a BeatBuddy?

Not yet. We’re still accepting pre-orders on our website. The BeatBuddy will be $349 in stores this August, but you can still get $100 off by pre-ordering a BeatBuddy for $249 here: http://myBeatBuddy.com/pre-order

I supported the Indiegogo campaign, but I forgot to add international shipping. What do I do?

No problem. Just pay for the shipping on our site.

I play acoustic guitar/cello/trumpet... can I still use the BeatBuddy?

Absolutely! The BeatBuddy does not need an instrument to be plugged into it for it to work.  Just plug the BeatBuddy into your PA or use the standard 3.5mm heaphones jack to plug it into the AUX jack of your home stereo system -- it works with any speaker.

Won't my other effects make the drums sound bad?

The BeatBuddy should be placed at the end of your effects chain so the effects do not change the BeatBuddy's sound.  If you have effects on your amplifier, that will change the BeatBuddy's sound.  The BeatBuddy sounds best when played through a neutral speaker system.

When will the BeatBuddy be in retail stores?

We expect to have retail distribution in the USA by August 2014 (international distribution has not yet been set) -- Indiegogo supporters will get the BeatBuddy months before it's even in stores.

Don't you feel bad about putting drummers out of business?

We will never put drummers out of business.  You will never see Metallica replace Lars Ulrich with a BeatBuddy.  The BeatBuddy just allows musicians to play with realistic drums -- it's perfect for solo artists doing small gigs, practice sessions when a drummer isn't available, late at night when drums would wake the neighbors, and it's a great songwriting partner that won't get tired of the song you're working on!  Even drummers can make great use of the BeatBuddy to improve their timing -- it's a lot more fun to use than a metronome!  Goran will be making a demo video of all the ways drummers can use the BeatBuddy.

What accessories come with the BeatBuddy?

The BeatBuddy comes with a power adapter.  The computer interface software will be a free download.  We do not include the footswitch, MIDI or USB cable, as these accessories are widely available, and including these items would increase the price for everybody and not all users wish to use these features.

Do you provide a warranty?

Yes, we provide a standard 1 year manufacturer's warranty against defects.


What type of footswitch does the BeatBuddy use?

The BeatBuddy supports either a single or dual standard latching footswitch.

What does the second footswitch do?

When no song is playing, it moves to the next song in the folder.  While a song is playing it acts as a pause/unpause feature, so you can add drum breaks in the song. (There is also the option to make the second footswitch a dedicated tap tempo input, so you can change the tempo while the song is playing, hands-free.)

Do I have to press the pedal exactly at the beginning of a drum fill or release it exactly at the end of a transition beat?

No.  The BeatBuddy always ends song parts at the end of the bar, keeping you in time.  For example, if you trigger a fill too early, it will start at the right time.  If you trigger it too late, the remainder of the fill plays and ends with the bar, keeping you in time.

Can I have other song parts like a bridge or different verse beat?

Yes.  Different songs have a different number of song parts.  While most songs pre-loaded on the BeatBuddy will just consist of a single verse and chorus, some will have multiple parts.  Users can add and rearrange unlimited song parts (verse, chorus, bridge) through the interface software. All these song parts would play in the order arranged and then loop back to the beginning again.  Each song part has its own accent hit sound and set of fills associated with it.

Do I need to have an intro or outro fill?

No.  If no intro fill is present, the main beat starts immediately.  If no outro fill is present, the song ends at the end of the bar.

Do I need to know how to program beats to use the BeatBuddy?

No.  The BeatBuddy comes with 10 drum sets and 200+ songs and more will be available for download.  We have designed the BeatBuddy to be intuitive and easy to use right out of the box. However, if you do know how to program beats, you can easily load your beats onto the BeatBuddy as MIDI files -- as well as create your own drum sets.

Will the BeatBuddy have beats in my style of music?

We will include a wide range of time signatures and beat styles.  But if you want something specific, please post it on our Facebook page.  We will do our best to accommodate as many Buddies as possible.


Will the power adapter work in my country?

We will do our best to provide everyone with a power adapter that works in your country.  If we cannot, you can use any standard adapter that produces 9V 500mA, center negative power, like most Boss and Digitech pedal adapters.

Is the BeatBuddy true bypass?

There have been multiple definitions associated with the term 'true bypass', so we will tell you what the BeatBuddy does.  The BeatBuddy uses an analog mixer to combine the guitar and drum audio.  It does not digitize the guitar in order to preserve the quality of the guitar's analog sound.  But since the sound passes through an electronic component, if the BeatBuddy is not powered up, the sound will not pass through.

What type of files can I load on the BeatBuddy?

The BeatBuddy uses standard MIDI files for the beats and either 16 or 24 bit WAV files for the drum sets and footswitch accent hits. 

Can I use WAV files as loops instead of MIDI?

As of now, this is not supported, but we plan to add this feature as a software update in the future.

What kind of MIDI port does the BeatBuddy have?

In order to fit both the MIDI IN and OUT ports while still keeping the BeatBuddy in a single pedal format, we use a PS/2 port with a special MIDI Breakout Cable (sold separately) to convert to 5 pin ports.

What MIDI sync functions does the BeatBuddy support?

It has both MIDI IN and OUT -- so it can both control other MIDI devices and be controlled by them. Tempo, start, stop MIDI Sync functions are currently supported. 



What if I move to a different address before you ship the BeatBuddy?

We will confirm all addresses before we ship.

Will you ship to my country?

If you can order electronics from the USA, then we should have no problem delivering to you.

Will you change the value on the customs form so I pay less import taxes?

This is illegal for us to do and we would be fined heavily.  We will not do this.

What are the challenges?  

We are creating something completely new: a musician-friendly drum machine.  Though we have mitigated the associated risks as much as we can, there may be events outside our control that delay manufacturing and shipment.  However, we promise to keep you informed of any issues that may arise as we bring the BeatBuddy to market. Soon musicians everywhere will have great sounding drums a toe tap away.  


Got more questions? Ask us!

Add accent hits (e.g. cymbal crashes or hand claps)
Pause/unpause beats with second footswitch, while song is playing
Advance to next song with second footswitch, when no song is playingProfessional-grade sound
 Meticulously sampled drums at full dynamic range

Advanced algorithms generate realistic natural beats

200+ songs (verse/chorus beat progressions) in a wide range of musical styles

story:
Our Goals & Who We Are

Hey guys, were an experimental feminist/queer surf punk hardcore band called Bad Behavior. We want to give you the most awesome music experience that you can handle, which is why were making a record. Do you like feminism? Punk? Badass-sery? Satan? Do you want to see a woman and a trans guy succeed in music who don't give any fucks about societal norms or oppressive gender roles? Then you should donate to help us record our next album! As the stereotype goes, we are incredibly broke artists/musicians. We hate selling our shit because we hate capitalism, but unfortunately in this capitalistic, patriarchal society we gotta do what we gotta do to make cool stuff. At the end of the day, we really just want to make a cool record for you guys to listen to and enjoy. Support your local scene and DIY!!!

What We Need 

So, we need $1350 dollars to make this record happen. This will pay for studio time, recording and mixing and mastering. Just the bare essentials of recording the songs. Each song is $150 dollars and its an 8 song album, studio time is $150 dollars even. Any dollar you donate will go directly to making this album and that's it.

The Impact

This contribution would really mean so much to us, we really want to bring you great music that you'll enjoy and relate to. We can't make this record without money, and here's why we think its important:

  • We want to build a more awesome, inclusive scene for any kind of person to enjoy
  • We want to bring our feminist ideas to a mass audience
  • A donation to us is support in DIY culture and alternative media
  • We have a track record for producing awesome stuff. Our first EP "Never Trust a Dolphin" is a great listen. You can listen here: http://badbehaviorr.bandcamp.com/

Other Ways You Can Help

We love you more than your money. If you can't donate, that's okay, we still love you. But it would be awesome if you shared the campaign with your friends and spread the word! You're all really important to us and we couldn't be doing any of this without you.

story:
Who the Heck Is "Johnny Full-Time" and What's Full-Time Blues Radio?

I, "Johnny Full-Time" John Luttrell, started broadcasting Full-Time Blues Radio in June of 2008. The first episode signed on the air at 91.5-FM WUEV, at the very same hour that the nearby W.C. Handy Blues and Barbecue Festival kicked off their 2008 edition of the event. The radio station is owned by the University of Evansville, and is the only station in my part of the country that plays Blues music on the air. Being both a professional broadcaster and a Blues fanatic, I approached the management about volunteering, and the relationship has only grown since then.

I have since shaped Full-Time Blues Radio into "The Home for New and Independent Blues Music," providing a launching pad for virtually unknown Blues performers to reach potential fans. I feature a high turnover of new music from both independent acts and established performers. In addition, I have artists and bands on the show through in-studio performances and telephone interviews. I also keep folks in my area up to date on live Blues concerts to get out and support, and I feature music that literally arrived to me in the past week during a segment called "Johnny's Mailbox."

I'm so passionate about this original American art form, and I want to not only see Blues music survive, but thrive! Nearly all musical forms from the United States have grown out of or borrowed from the Blues traditions, and there are so many people out there who share my passion that are struggling to reach an audience because they have nowhere to get their music played. I love the all-time greats of the Blues, but you can hear them on any Blues radio show or online stream. The charge I've given myself is to put the spotlight on the lesser knowns of the world of Blues.

I became a victim of the economy in 2009, when my full-time radio job was eliminated. I pulled together the money to start my website, http://www.fulltimeblues.com in an effort to sieze the opportunity at making my dream a reality. In the past 18 months, I've been on a high wire without a net, and there have been a few spills, but more importantly, some amazing thrills. I was invited to emcee that very same W.C. Handy Blues and Barbecue Festival in 2010, and recently made my first trip to New Orleans as a featured panelist representing radio at the Cutting Edge Music Business Conference. The next step in my journey has now arrived...

My Goal

I am going to start an internet radio station through my website. Full-Time Blues Radio will no longer simply be a two hour weekly attraction on WUEV. It will be a 24/7 online source for hearing new and independent Blues music. The idea is to be more than simply a voiceless string of endless music, there are plenty of places where you can get that. No, the concept is to operate like a real FM radio station online. I've been a professional broadcaster working in radio and television for more than 5 years. I have two degrees in Broadcasting and Telecommunications from two of Indiana's most acclaimed programs. I have a passion for Blues music that is unrivaled by anyone, and a desire to see independent musicians make their dreams come true, while I do the same.

The station will operate via Shoutcast, which is a service by Winamp - a free media player for windows, mac, and linux users. Shoutcast radio is also available as a free app for iPhone and Android mobile devices, allowing folks to listen to stations on the go. This allows Full-Time Blues Radio to reach literally millions of potential listeners globally, providing a place where Blues music fans can hear artists they won't be exposed to anywhere else. I've created a programming schedule, come up with advertising packages, built an extensive network of record labels, radio reps, managers, an independent artists and bands. Perhaps most importantly, I also have an ever-expanding library of music.


If the project doesn't happen, I go back on the job hunt and, hopefully, Full-Time Blues Radio and WUEV maintain their partnership for many years to come; new and independent Blues music has a home for two hours a week, reaching a much smaller, but loyal audience; and I use the funds generated to make a donation to The Blues Foundation, of which I am a member, so that the money can still go toward keeping the Blues alive. I refuse to fail.

What We Need & What You Get

I have set a goal of $3,000 for equipment and startup costs.

I need to get a new computer in order to have a reliable and strong source to broadcast from. I'm currently running my website, and producing my two hour show, on two second hand computers that would crash under the demands of uploading a live 24/7 stream. I have budgeted $1,000 for this part of the project, and it is the most crucial aspect of "getting on the air." Once I have the computer, I can start the station and begin broadcasting.

The remaining $2,000 is for additional equipment to make the broadcasts more professional: a mixer, microphones, cables, stands, soundproofing materials to convert my office into an actual studio, and so forth. A significant portion is also to pay for the process of establishing Full-Time Productions, the parent company, as an LLC; so that I can operate as a credible company and have the proper information and identification necessary to report ad revenues, etc.

Your support goes beyond simply helping to start an internet radio station. One way or another, it funds efforts to keep the Blues alive. This comes with certain rewards, from me to you, for various levels of support, which you can find out more about below.

$10 Contribution - A social network shout-out.
$50 Contribution - A Full-Time Blues T-shirt (See It Here)
$100.00 or Greater Contribution  - Your name in a radio commercial

All contributors will have their names listed on a special "Friends of Full-Time Blues Radio" page on the website.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe in the project, please take a moment to share it with others who you feel would also think that my efforts are worthwhile, and might either make their own contribution or pass along the information, as well. There are links above to share this page in a variety of ways. There are links below to my various social networking profiles. And, if you'd like an example of my work, there is information on how to listen to Full-Time Blues on WUEV on my website, as well as archived interviews with Blues artists and bands. Please share this information with the Blues lover in your life and help me meet my goal. Every little bit helps, and any help is greatly appreciated.

Thank You!

"Johnny Full-Time" John Luttrell
Host/Exec. Producer - Full-Time Blues Radio
Owner/Webmaster - http://www.fulltimeblues.com
story_txt:
Who the Heck Is "Johnny Full-Time" and What's Full-Time Blues Radio?
I, "Johnny Full-Time" John Luttrell, started broadcasting Full-Time Blues Radio in June of 2008. The first episode signed on the air at 91.5-FM WUEV, at the very same hour that the nearby W.C. Handy Blues and Barbecue Festival kicked off their 2008 edition of the event. The radio station is owned by the University of Evansville, and is the only station in my part of the country that plays Blues music on the air. Being both a professional broadcaster and a Blues fanatic, I approached the management about volunteering, and the relationship has only grown since then.I have since shaped Full-Time Blues Radio into "The Home for New and Independent Blues Music," providing a launching pad for virtually unknown Blues performers to reach potential fans. I feature a high turnover of new music from both independent acts and established performers. In addition, I have artists and bands on the show through in-studio performances and telephone interviews. I also keep folks in my area up to date on live Blues concerts to get out and support, and I feature music that literally arrived to me in the past week during a segment called "Johnny's Mailbox."I'm so passionate about this original American art form, and I want to not only see Blues music survive, but thrive! Nearly all musical forms from the United States have grown out of or borrowed from the Blues traditions, and there are so many people out there who share my passion that are struggling to reach an audience because they have nowhere to get their music played. I love the all-time greats of the Blues, but you can hear them on any Blues radio show or online stream. The charge I've given myself is to put the spotlight on the lesser knowns of the world of Blues.I became a victim of the economy in 2009, when my full-time radio job was eliminated. I pulled together the money to start my website, http://www.fulltimeblues.com in an effort to sieze the opportunity at making my dream a reality. In the past 18 months, I've been on a high wire without a net, and there have been a few spills, but more importantly, some amazing thrills. I was invited to emcee that very same W.C. Handy Blues and Barbecue Festival in 2010, and recently made my first trip to New Orleans as a featured panelist representing radio at the Cutting Edge Music Business Conference. The next step in my journey has now arrived...My Goal


I am going to start an internet radio station through my website. Full-Time Blues Radio will no longer simply be a two hour weekly attraction on WUEV. It will be a 24/7 online source for hearing new and independent Blues music. The idea is to be more than simply a voiceless string of endless music, there are plenty of places where you can get that. No, the concept is to operate like a real FM radio station online. I've been a professional broadcaster working in radio and television for more than 5 years. I have two degrees in Broadcasting and Telecommunications from two of Indiana's most acclaimed programs. I have a passion for Blues music that is unrivaled by anyone, and a desire to see independent musicians make their dreams come true, while I do the same.The station will operate via Shoutcast, which is a service by Winamp - a free media player for windows, mac, and linux users. Shoutcast radio is also available as a free app for iPhone and Android mobile devices, allowing folks to listen to stations on the go. This allows Full-Time Blues Radio to reach literally millions of potential listeners globally, providing a place where Blues music fans can hear artists they won't be exposed to anywhere else. I've created a programming schedule, come up with advertising packages, built an extensive network of record labels, radio reps, managers, an independent artists and bands. Perhaps most importantly, I also have an ever-expanding library of music.

If the project doesn't happen, I go back on the job hunt and, hopefully, Full-Time Blues Radio and WUEV maintain their partnership for many years to come; new and independent Blues music has a home for two hours a week, reaching a much smaller, but loyal audience; and I use the funds generated to make a donation to The Blues Foundation, of which I am a member, so that the money can still go toward keeping the Blues alive. I refuse to fail.

What We Need & What You GetI have set a goal of $3,000 for equipment and startup costs.I need to get a new computer in order to have a reliable and strong source to broadcast from. I'm currently running my website, and producing my two hour show, on two second hand computers that would crash under the demands of uploading a live 24/7 stream. I have budgeted $1,000 for this part of the project, and it is the most crucial aspect of "getting on the air." Once I have the computer, I can start the station and begin broadcasting.The remaining $2,000 is for additional equipment to make the broadcasts more professional: a mixer, microphones, cables, stands, soundproofing materials to convert my office into an actual studio, and so forth. A significant portion is also to pay for the process of establishing Full-Time Productions, the parent company, as an LLC; so that I can operate as a credible company and have the proper information and identification necessary to report ad revenues, etc.Your support goes beyond simply helping to start an internet radio station. One way or another, it funds efforts to keep the Blues alive. This comes with certain rewards, from me to you, for various levels of support, which you can find out more about below.$10 Contribution - A social network shout-out.$50 Contribution - A Full-Time Blues T-shirt (See It Here)$100.00 or Greater Contribution  - Your name in a radio commercial
All contributors will have their names listed on a special "Friends of Full-Time Blues Radio" page on the website.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you believe in the project, please take a moment to share it with others who you feel would also think that my efforts are worthwhile, and might either make their own contribution or pass along the information, as well. There are links above to share this page in a variety of ways. There are links below to my various social networking profiles. And, if you'd like an example of my work, there is information on how to listen to Full-Time Blues on WUEV on my website, as well as archived interviews with Blues artists and bands. Please share this information with the Blues lover in your life and help me meet my goal. Every little bit helps, and any help is greatly appreciated.
Thank You!
"Johnny Full-Time" John LuttrellHost/Exec. Producer - Full-Time Blues RadioOwner/Webmaster - http://www.fulltimeblues.com

story:
Our Story

Believing in the importance of providing music for all, the mission of the Notre Temps String Ensemble, Inc. is to provide access to string music making to the members of the community regardless of musical experience or age.

Through structured rehearsals and concerts the ensemble members will gain basic knowledge in music making in a non-competitive setting.


The Impact

"What an opportunity! As I made plans for retirement, I knew music would be a part of those plans. It had been 50 years since my last piano and clarinet lessons. However, I purchased a cello, signed up for lessons at the SDSU

Community Music School and announced that I would like to be able to bring music into nursing homes and elementary classrooms as part of a small ensemble some day. This would be my way of learning something new, getting out of myself and possibly bringing some joy to others.

Notre Temps String Ensemble has provided me with all of the opportunities I had hoped for and more.  The musicians, all far better players than me, have welcomed and encouraged me during rehearsals and performances." - Suzi

"I studied viola rather seriously as a child up through high school. I had a beautiful instrument and loved to play. In addition to taking weekly lessons, I participated in numerous symphony and chamber orchestras and even a jazz ensemble! But as soon as I went to college, my viola began to collect dust. Fast forward to 20 years later, and I decided that my beautiful viola shouldn't just sit in storage, and that someone else should have the pleasure of playing it. So I headed over to a local music store to try and sell it. Well, I suddenly decided I couldn't part with it and, moreover, decided that I would instead start taking lessons! A 20-year break from practicing definitely took its toll, but I was astonished to realize how much I remembered, both physically and mentally. Over the past year, I have been gradually restoring my skills, and this is due in no small part to joining the Notre Temps String Ensemble. Rediscovering the viola after a 20-year hiatus was a little scary to me, but being a part of an orchestra that is low in stress and high in comradery has made it quite fun. I’m very much enjoying the friendships that I have developed as a result of joining the orchestra, and I look forward to growing with the orchestra over the years. Playing the viola again has filled a void in my life; I didn’t know how much I missed it until I started playing again. I feel so lucky to have the opportunity to play music with others in my community" - Jessica


What We Need & What You Get

We at Notre Temps are looking for donations to help pay for sheet music, copies, a rehearsal space, and advertising to recruit more people into our orchestra. But those are only the short term goals. The orchestra would like to eventually sponsor an aspiring musician with an instrument and lessons so that they may also have an outlet for music. We would also love to pay our Creative Director, Michael, who has graciously worked pro bono for the past 2 years.


If you donate to Notre Temps, you will be helping musicians to have an outlet for their love of music.


"Music cleanses the understanding; inspires it, and lifts it into a realm which it would not reach if it were left to itself."

~Henry Ward Beecher

story:
Our Story

   I am the artist known as L. Young. I have over 18 years experience in the music industry as an artist, songwriter, and producer. I've worked with Stevie Wonder, Nicole Scherzinger, R. Kelly, & KeKe Wyatt to name a few. I've released 3 albums to date (04's 'They Just Don't Know", 07's "The 12th Letter", and 2011's "Love Is A Verb). I also have songs playing in various TV and Films such as VH1's Basketball Wives: Miami, USA Network's Burn Notice, & BET's The Game. I'm surrounded by honest, hardworking industry professionals who, like myself, are frustrated with the lack of options available to the so-called "Urban" music listener. We think its important to have variety not only on the internet, but in mainstream music mediums as well. I, L. Young, with your help, pledge to bring balance back to the Urban music universe.


The Impact

   You may think, "why should I contribute to you when I have my own dreams and bills to go along with it?" This is an opportunity for us to show the power of unity, and that a little done by many can mean a lot. Rappers have been doing this for years. Their fans get behind them and create a buzz so strong on youtube, twitter, & facebook that radio and tv is forced to recognize them. We would not know who 50 Cent or even Drake is today had they not used their own resources to put out mixtapes and the fans who liked it spread the word. Can this not be done in R&B? Allow me to be the vessel in which YOU demonstrate to the industry professionals that you will not be dictated to as to what is "hot" and what's not. Bring real R&B back to today and let's stop reminiscing over the 90's when songs told stories and were built around strong melodies. WE CAN HAVE IT NOW. Lets say that we demand quality music again. And we WILL support it! If the industry sees that, it won't be so hard for the next generation of artist to aspire to use real instruments in their songs. Help them not to feel pressured to get the hottest rapper on their song. Make it harder for them to be shut out for aspiring to emulate Stevie Wonder as opposed to sounding just like their own contemporaries. If we can get 1 mainstream R&B artist to "blow up" totally off the support of the people and not some major label publicity and marketing campaign, the impact would be huge. It would open the Urban market up to a slew of artists who, up to this point, have been completely shut out.


What We Need & What You Get

   Here's the deal. I need your help in completing my music video and online campaign for the new single. I've enlisted the help of a talented up & coming video director named Delvon Simmons to shoot my new single "Hurt You." I've NEVER had any financial help in recording or promoting any of my 3 albums and I'm out of resources (I'm broke!!!). I believe with all my heart that this is the song that will not only do wonders for my career and name recognition, but also start the shift back to "real R&B. I need your contributions to help with the filming/editing, social networking and blog campaign that will need to follow as soon as the video/song is released. We will also need a constant presence on Youtube, Facebook, twitter, emails and phones daily for 60 days or more. The staff to do that will cost. Money will also be needed to travel to smaller markets outside L.A. to do D.J. pools, shows, giveaways, and appearances. Money will also be needed to design & press up DVD's, CD's, press kits, and merchandise like t-shirts for these trips. Yes, its possible that $7500 will not be enough to accomplish all the things I need, but its a realistic start. As money comes in, I will re-invest in myself. If you are one of the many who have ever attended one of my shows and said, "why are you not world famous?" Or after going to my site and listening to my songs have said, "why isn't this on the radio?" Well here's our chance to fix that and in the process create a path and business model in which up & coming artists can do the same. I CAN'T DO THIS ALONE! STRENGTH IN NUMBERS, and watch our numbers (sales, hits, views, downloads) be our strength.


Other Ways You Can Help

   There are other things you can do if you don't have a financial contribution to make. You can repost, resend, redistribute the link to this campaign to everyone on your Facebook, twitter, & email list. Send people by my website or Facebook/twitter page. Attend my shows. Call local live music venues in your area and ask them to book me. Call the radio stations and ask them why are they not playing my music. Every mention of my name and music helps tremendously.

story:
We are...
We are a fresh female soul reggae band from New Zealand, and unique to our band is the female vocals trio of a mother and her two daughters. Our music brings you uplifting messages of strength, understanding, good times and love through our high energy conscious reggae music.
NRG Rising's musical journey began in 2009 and has been a whirlwind rollercoaster ride of almost 100 gigs around New Zealand's North Island.  We successfully fundraised $10k USD on another online fundraising platform, which helped us record our debut album, From Darkness To Light. The album was released February 2011 here in New Zealand. The album was a finalist in the 2011 National New Zealand Māori Music Awards alongside internationally renowned New Zealand reggae artists 'Katchafire' and NZ reggae greats House of Shem and Box Juice.

Getting to the Gathering of the Nations Pow Wow, New Mexico 2012
NRG Rising has been invited (and confirmed) to perform as an international guest act at the Gathering of Nations Pow Wow in Albuquerque, New Mexico, USA 2012. Planning is now underway for the four performances at the Gathering of Nations and other mainland USA gigs. The core members of our band are family members, and this campaign will significantly contribute to the overall cost of taking our 7 piece band from New Zealand to New Mexico. This is the first time that most members of the band will leave NZ and travel overseas, so this is a life changing opportunity to share our unique inspirational and indigenous music live  with New Mexico and the growing fan base in the USA.  With the continued heartfelt help and support our our loyal and growing fan base, we know this exciting dream can become a reality.

Getting on the plane
This campaign is to help fund the band's travel costs to New Mexico in April 2012. All funds raised in this campaign will go directly towards the costs of airfares to attend and perform at the Gathering of Nations Pow Wow.

How you can help
You can contribute in amounts of $10, $20, $40, $50, $150 or $200, and you receive a 'Perk' from us to say 'Thank you'. For more info, see the section below.
The total we actually need to get to New Mexico is around $30,000, so all money raised here will go towards the costs of airfares whether we reach our target goal or not. We are also investigating fundraising activities to raise the money needed. Please help us get to New Mexico and you will be someone who turns dreams into reality.

How we say 'Thanks'
Please check out our 'perks' that include downloads of our singles, album, physical copies of our album, signed copies, and an opportunity to meet with the NRG Rising gals in person through Skype. But wait, there's more... if you are attending the Gathering of Nations Pow Wow and make a significant contribution, you will get to meet the NRG Rising gals and guys in person at the festival.

Other ways you can help
There are other ways you can help us too... please share our campaign with family, friends, and anyone else you know, the more people that know the better and this will significantly increase our chances of reaching the target. Also, remember to use the 'Share Tool', even if you can do this one action, you are contributing to turning a dream into reality.

story:
Help us build our urban sanctuary

7/15/15 UPDATE
Campaign ends in 5 days!!  Help us raise another $2500 by 7/19!!
At this very moment Bill is wrapping up a meeting with the wonderful architect who is creating amazing plans for us.  We are ever grateful and blown away by the response to this campaign.  We have received published funds to almost $5K, and private pledges for another $5K.  We are well on the way to breaking ground in August and would love your support to meet our next goal.    
Again, please share liberally!  
With love and appreciation,
Bill and Rachel

7/6/15 UPDATE
Let's get to 10K by Sunday 7/12!!!  
Your enthusiastic response has covered the cost of the foundation.  Now we need some walls!  Thank you to all who have sent such generous funding our way.  
We have pledges totaling $6K, which is about 30% of our goal.  Permits are in process and we are focusing on designs and plans for building the studio.  We are digging in with shovels and hoes, prepping the backyard to break ground soon, and we can feel this dream becoming a reality more than ever before.  We've got 2 weeks to go, so please help us boost our efforts and share widely with your friends and families. 
With gratitude and excitement,  

Bill and Rachel

Our Story

Hi!

For the past 20 years, we, Bill and Rachel Heron, have been nurturing our dream of building a backyard healing arts studio.  Now that we have purchased our own home, it is the perfect time for us to make this dream real, put down roots and build! 

We need your help to build this urban sanctuary that will be called Heron’s Nest.   Our practices in the healing arts of Yoga, massage, and movement therapy have become increasingly important in supporting many people to lead more balanced, engaged and inspired lives.  Our students and clients have let us know how vital and  nourishing this work is as an antidote to the stressful, everyday demands on their time, energy, and attention. 

(For more info on Bill’s work with kids and adults, check out  www.billmccully.org.  For more info about Rachel’s various offerings, go to www.sfbaydoula.com. )

Our vision is to create a studio that allows us to grow our vision bigger and brighter than it’s ever been.  We will be able to:

  • extend our offering to more people
  • hold classes and events that connect and build our families and communities
  • anchor the study and practice of these healing modalities which we are so passionate about. 

In order to build this simple and elegant studio, and create an urban sanctuary for the service and healing of you and many others, we need  to raise  20,000 dollars. This will cover the cost of design, materials, permits, inspections and labor. 

We would love your help! 

Please take a moment to contribute to our vision and and support the building of Heron’s Nest.  Donations of any amount are greatly appreciated.  We have generated a sweet list of perks (check it out, on the right) and are excited to reward your generosity.  

We can’t wait to share the complete vision with you.  Please contribute to this dream, come over to experience the benefits of our work, and participate in the co-creation of a magical and healing space. 

If you have more time than money, we would love to incorporate any other skills you can bring to the project.  In the future we will be organizing community work days to build, landscape, garden, and paint.  For now, your financial contribution will directly support us to build this urban sanctuary, and enable us to grow what we love most in this life.

Thank you so much,

Bill and Rachel
story_txt:
Help us build our urban sanctuary

7/15/15 UPDATE
Campaign ends in 5 days!!  Help us raise another $2500 by 7/19!!
At this very moment Bill is wrapping up a meeting with the wonderful architect who is creating amazing plans for us.  We are ever grateful and blown away by the response to this campaign.  We have received published funds to almost $5K, and private pledges for another $5K.  We are well on the way to breaking ground in August and would love your support to meet our next goal.    
Again, please share liberally!  
With love and appreciation,
Bill and Rachel

7/6/15 UPDATE
Let's get to 10K by Sunday 7/12!!!  
Your enthusiastic response has covered the cost of the foundation.  Now we need some walls!  Thank you to all who have sent such generous funding our way.  

We have pledges totaling $6K, which is about 30% of our goal.  Permits are in process and we are focusing on designs and plans for building the studio.  We are digging in with shovels and hoes, prepping the backyard to break ground soon, and we can feel this dream becoming a reality more than ever before.  We've got 2 weeks to go, so please help us boost our efforts and share widely with your friends and families. 
With gratitude and excitement,  

Bill and Rachel

story:
Stretch Goal: Our stretch goal of $1800 would allow those attending Somerset to stay in the conference hotel, instead of a budget hotel at a different location! This would allow them to get the full experience without having to worry about traveling with their harp on a daily basis.

A Summer Can Change a Life

Anyone who has attended summer camp knows that it is an experience not soon forgotten. You find yourself in a new place, with new friends, and new teachers. There is a whole new world to explore and discover. Summer music camps are not only a fun, educational way to keep kids out of your hair: the experiences they provide light a fire that propels campers to new heights. The environment surrounds them with equally talented peers who work equally hard. There is no parallel to this kind of motivation. A child is also given the opportunity to spend their days away from parents and classroom teachers, while exploring their art and social relationships in a safe environment. This fosters leadership skills, self esteem, and independence. 

Unfortunately, there is also a massive price tag that accompanies these kinds of experiences. The typical summer harp camp can cost anywhere from $500 to $2,500 per camper for a week or two. This price does not include airfare, harp rentals, sheet music purchases, and other miscellaneous fees. For many, it doesn't even include food or lodging. This makes camp prohibitive for most families, so that only wealthy children can afford these invaluable experiences.

Why Music Camp?

So, let's talk facts. WHY is music camp valuable REALLY? Well the Psychology Today journal had the following findings about camp:

  • Camps help children feel in control of their lives
  • Camps make sure that all children are treated fairly. Every child starts without the psychological baggage they carry from school.
  • Camps offer kids a chance to feel that they belong.
  • Camps give kids both cultural roots and the chance to understand others who have cultures very different than their own.
  • Camps environments form new relationships, not just with peers, but with trusted adults other than parents. Children learn to negotiate on their own with an adult for what they need.

But then what's so important about MUSIC?

  • Musical training helps develop brain areas involved in language and reasoning.
  • There is a causal link between music and spatial intelligence (the ability to perceive the world accurately and to form mental pictures of things).
  • Students of the arts learn to think creatively and to solve problems by imagining various solutions, rejecting outdated rules and assumptions. Questions about the arts do not have only one right answer.
  • Studies show that students who study the arts are more successful on standardized tests such as the SAT. They also achieve higher grades in high school.
  • Students of music learn craftsmanship as they study how details are put together painstakingly and what constitutes good, as opposed to mediocre, work. 
  • In music, a mistake is a mistake; the instrument is in tune or not, the notes are well played or not, the entrance is made or not. It is only by much hard work that a successful performance is possible. Through music study, students learn the value of sustained effort to achieve excellence and the concrete rewards of hard work.

When They Return

After the kids return to Philadelphia, they will perform a series of concerts throughout their community. This is intended to show others the benefits of hard work, and teach the kids that talent is meant to be shared.

What We Have Done So Far

The kids have already worked hard to raise funds to attend this camp. The last $1,600 is intended to simply fill in what they still need. Through the process of fundraising, the kids have both learned the value of money, but also that money should never be a barrier between you and your dreams. So far, we have:

  • Sold candy bars door to door
  • Busked in Rittenhouse Square
  • Held a fundraising party event
  • Set up fundraising booths at concerts and events

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute, but want to help? Already contributed, but want to do more?

  • Please spread the word about our campaign through twitter, facebook, and other social networking platforms. Post often, and make sure to say why the campaign is meaningful to you!
  • If you see a post about this campaign, be sure to like or comment on it. That helps the post become visible to more people.
  • Send individual emails to friends and coworkers. If you would like an email template to send quickly and easily, please say so in the comments.
  • If you've already donated, consider contributing again or increasing your donation amount.

story:
Aurin's 2nd Album w/ Grammy Award Winning Producer Jason Corsaro

Aurin, a New Jersey based, equal opportunity, hard rock band has been given the chance to work with Grammy Award winning producer, Jason Corsaro (Soundgarden, Motorhead, Madonna) and will have the album mastered by Howie Weinberg (Nirvana's "Nevermind," Staind, Disturbed).  Aurin will be going into The Barber Shop Studios in Hopatcong, NJ come January 2014 to record what we believe to be the culmination of everything we have been working towards thus far as a band.  We will be set to release this album in Late Spring, 2014.

We are asking for your support in order to help make this album the best production that it possibly could be and help make our dream a reality.  We know you have been asking for the release of new material, and now through this campaign we will be able to get it out to you!!

Incentives for Donating

We currently have raised $8,000, but are asking for an additional $6,000 to cover further recording expenses, mastering of the album, artwork, and printing/distribution.

We will be offering one of a kind prizes for those who donate, which you can not get anywhere else. :-)

Prizes include but are not limited to: early release of the album, early release of "November" (long before it is released ANYWHERE else), limited edition merchandise, drum lessons, bass lessons, Sarah will guest vocal on your band's track, a date with Aurin, and MORE!

What You Will Help Accomplish

With this album we are going to seek record label interest, more radio play, and expand the areas in which we perform.  We have been given a chance to put our music in the hands of legendary producer/engineer, Jason Corsaro, and the Master of Masterers, Howie Weinberg.

We are humbled to have been given the opportunity to work with these people, and we are asking you to be a part of bringing new hard rock music into the spotlight.

Your donations mean the world to us, and we need your support!!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everybody has the means to donate, but that does not mean you that you can not help out.  Please spread this campaign by any means you can think of to all of your friends out there.  Please feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools to assist you in the process!!

story:
Dave and Brian "Put it On"

As some of you may know, we recently had some success with our Christmas Parody Video, "Deck the Halls (A Wrecking Ball Parody). We are hoping to follow up on that success with a brand new video for our  new original song, "Put it On." "Put it On" is a dance pop song, that compliments those girls who are not afraid to wear too much clothing.The video will follow a girl who for the sake of this write up is named Christina. She enters a typical dance club wearing an excessive amount of clothing, and becomes the center of attention. 

We are working with the same Engineer who worked on our "Rockenspiel" album, and the same production company that made the Christmas video and "The Dork Anthem" video. The Christmas video helped us to triple the number of YouTube subscribers we had, and has given us access to direct contacts at very popular media outlets on the Internet. We strongly believe, that given the chance, this can be a very popular video that will help us get our name out there, while making a humorous statement about fashion. 

We were able to afford to do the Christmas video, because a lot of very talented/professional people donated their time and abilities. We want the new video to be of the same quality, but it will take more financing. We are asking you, our fans and supporters, to come along side us so we're able to afford to make this project a reality. We aren't asking you to do this for nothing though. We want to offer you unique perks for donating to the project. On the side of this page you will not only see the typical perks like receiving an early download of the song, and autographed cat posters, but we are also offering heavily discounted performance options for those interested in booking us in the next couple months.

 If you can't support us financially at this time, we could still use your help sharing this promotion with your friends via Facebook, Twitter, or Carrier Pigeon. We can also use your help when the video comes out to help us share it with the world. 

If we raise more then the $5000 goal, the extra funds will continue to go towards the video seeing as this goal is still under the budget of the project.  Thanks again and we really appreciate YOUR CONTINUED support!

story:
This is My Story.

Hi! I’m Heather McMillan  

I am about to attempt "world domination" with a kids’ sing-along album and I thought you might want to be part of it!

Do you ever think about how to inspire kids from around the world to grow up and live extraordinary lives? To find the purpose they were created for and reach it, even against all odds? 

I think about it a lot. 

There are probably many ways to go about this, but it’s my passion to inspire kids to live Virtue-Lives. Motivating them to choose honesty, perseverance, kindness, diligence, and forgiveness as a lifestyle is what gets me up in the morning.

No. Actually it really does. 

That’s why I started We Choose Virtues, and after seven years, thousands of families and teachers are using our virtue cards and posters to simply inspire character. Now all we need is some toe-tapping, hand-clapping, virtue songs that will stick in kids' heads!

We actually started this album a few years ago, but it became seriously delayed when I had to fight to survive a failing kidney transplant and then cancer. By God’s healing grace, I won, but not without a tremendous battle that tested me and my family to the core.

I came out of that season even more determined that children, in order to survive in life, must be equipped with certain skills. We must give them the extraordinary gift of character.  

That’s what I believe, and I think there are a lot of other people who think the same. Maybe even you.

So, yes. It's a simple sing-along album…but it is so much more than that. It will further the cause of virtue in children, the magnitude of which could be staggering! 

Are you ready to do this with me? YES! 

Ummm. How are we going to do this? 

I am not a Musician, song writer or even a singer...but don't worry. We found some skilled people who also LOVE the project. 

  • Pamela Barnhill, one of our Virtue-using moms, cleverly set our tried-and-true Virtue Catchphrases in fun, recognizable childhood tunes. 
  • Bryce Buckland, a musician friend, arranged the music, choosing various genres of music to keep the collection fun and lively. 
  • Jhauvon Harrison, studio musician and music teacher, took the project from there, arranging, playing the instruments, coaching the singers and producing the album.  
  • We turned to Biosonic Recording Studio in Seattle to track, mix and master the album, and so far it sounds incredible! We'll keep you posted!
What We Need.
The Cost of Recording:

Song arrangements:    $1,500
instrumental tracking: $1,900
vocal tracking:                $2,400
mixing:                               $1,300
mastering:                        $  900
Grand Total:                 $8,000 

If we exceed the goal of $8,000, we will spend the additional money on replicating and packaging the physical CD. So, that will be fun! 

Ways You Can Help.

What can you do to be part of this project?  Two things.

  1. Please consider backing our album! (with our deepest gratitude) We have packages that range from $5 for "Virtue Likers" to $1,500 for "Virtue Extreme Enthusiasts" with 4 other options in between! Everybody will get access to backer-only updates and a very special “Thank you” on the We Choose Virtues website.
  2. Sharing this project is a HUGE part of its success so please tell your friends right away. You can do this in your own way, or use the handy Indiegogo Share Tools. This campaign ends on September 1, so maybe you should do this step first!

Wait. Pick a pack first, then tell your friends. Ahhhh! Do both. Do both!

What You Get.

Check Out Our List of Exclusive Backer-Only Perks!
