story:
UPDATE 4: Blog post: Inferring function types

UPDATE 3: Blog post: Basics of Automatic Annotations

UPDATE 2: A runnable demo is now available on Github!  Try it out!

UPDATE 1: Blog post Introducing Automatic Annotations!

My name is Ambrose Bonnaire-Sergeant and I am implementing automatic type annotations for Typed Clojure.

Here's the main idea: we can use tests to generate types. We already write tests to specify our functions, what if we could also use them to generate type annotations?

To type check untyped code, you must write type annotations. Unfortunately, they are very annoying to write! When CircleCI abandoned Typed Clojure, they cited the annotation burden as a top reason for doing so. Even though they loved the key ideas underlying the type system, annotations were just too much work.


This is why automatic annotations are so badly needed: with this tool, you can get the benefits of a type system, without the tedium of writing annotations manually.

How to use it

To generate annotations for your namespace, simply:

  1. add core.typed metadata to your namespace,
  2. run your unit tests for the namespace,
  3. run clojure.core.typed/runtime-infer in the current namespace.
Voila! Here's what our prototype produces.


The Benefits

Annotations help us do more than just type check untyped code.
Other benefits include:
  • documenting code: We can answer questions like "Given the current inputs/outputs, what kind of function have we written?". We can ask questions like this at any time in development.
  • runtime checking: Annotations can also be enforced at runtime, using infrastructure developed for Gradual Typing, my previous campaign.
  • generative tests: We could even use the automatic annotation infrastructure to generate clojure.spec generative tests!
The Plan
I have already developed a prototype that generates type annotations for a subset of Clojure programs. We plan to release this prototype in a future core.typed release (preview branch). The prototype infers function types, recursive map types, immutable collections, mutable atoms, and other base types.
From here, we plan to test our prototype against a suite of popular Clojure libraries. We will compile, evaluate, and release these results, then iterate on our prototype.
There are several dimensions to improve the generated types, including:
  • correctly chosen recursive types: generated nested types are squashed into recursive types based on a configurable algorithm. The correct choice will be based on real-world trials.
  • well named aliases: type aliases are used to share commonly occurring types between functions. Choosing good names for these aliases helps readability.
  • suitability for type checking: type annotations are used as fuel for type checking Clojure code. If a generated annotation successfully checks the definition and most usages of a function, then it's probably a good annotation.
We are aiming to submit an ICFP paper (due ~February).

The Feedback

I will keep everyone posted on our progress via my Twitter and my blog. Major releases will be announced on the core.typed mailing list. Our paper drafts will also be made publicly available.

Why I need your help

If you are excited about this project and want to help it succeed, funding this campaign is the best way to support me. This campaign will help me to:
  • attend industrial conferences like Strangeloop, Clojure/conj, Clojure West, and Curry On,
  • connect with the Clojure community via local meetups, and
  • sustain my PhD program by staying out of debt.
Funds donated from the programming community have been vital in my progress with Typed Clojure.
Your support is greatly appreciated, and I hope you're just as excited as I am about the future of Typed Clojure!
Thanks for your contributions!
story_txt:
UPDATE 4: Blog post: Inferring function typesUPDATE 3: Blog post: Basics of Automatic AnnotationsUPDATE 2: A runnable demo is now available on Github!  Try it out!UPDATE 1: Blog post Introducing Automatic Annotations!My name is Ambrose Bonnaire-Sergeant and I am implementing automatic type annotations for Typed Clojure.Here's the main idea: we can use tests to generate types. We already write tests to specify our functions, what if we could also use them to generate type annotations?To type check untyped code, you must write type annotations. Unfortunately, they are very annoying to write! When CircleCI abandoned Typed Clojure, they cited the annotation burden as a top reason for doing so. Even though they loved the key ideas underlying the type system, annotations were just too much work.
This is why automatic annotations are so badly needed: with this tool, you can get the benefits of a type system, without the tedium of writing annotations manually.
How to use itTo generate annotations for your namespace, simply:
add core.typed metadata to your namespace,

run your unit tests for the namespace,

run clojure.core.typed/runtime-infer in the current namespace.
Voila! Here's what our prototype produces.The BenefitsAnnotations help us do more than just type check untyped code.Other benefits include:

documenting code: We can answer questions like "Given the current inputs/outputs, what kind of function have we written?". We can ask questions like this at any time in development.

runtime checking: Annotations can also be enforced at runtime, using infrastructure developed for Gradual Typing, my previous campaign.

generative tests: We could even use the automatic annotation infrastructure to generate clojure.spec generative tests!

The Plan
I have already developed a prototype that generates type annotations for a subset of Clojure programs. We plan to release this prototype in a future core.typed release (preview branch). The prototype infers function types, recursive map types, immutable collections, mutable atoms, and other base types.
From here, we plan to test our prototype against a suite of popular Clojure libraries. We will compile, evaluate, and release these results, then iterate on our prototype.There are several dimensions to improve the generated types, including:

correctly chosen recursive types: generated nested types are squashed into recursive types based on a configurable algorithm. The correct choice will be based on real-world trials.


well named aliases: type aliases are used to share commonly occurring types between functions. Choosing good names for these aliases helps readability.


suitability for type checking: type annotations are used as fuel for type checking Clojure code. If a generated annotation successfully checks the definition and most usages of a function, then it's probably a good annotation.

We are aiming to submit an ICFP paper (due ~February).
The FeedbackI will keep everyone posted on our progress via my Twitter and my blog. Major releases will be announced on the core.typed mailing list. Our paper drafts will also be made publicly available.Why I need your help
If you are excited about this project and want to help it succeed, funding this campaign is the best way to support me. This campaign will help me to:



attend industrial conferences like Strangeloop, Clojure/conj, Clojure West, and Curry On,

connect with the Clojure community via local meetups, and
sustain my PhD program by staying out of debt.

Funds donated from the programming community have been vital in my progress with Typed Clojure.

Your support is greatly appreciated, and I hope you're just as excited as I am about the future of Typed Clojure!

Thanks for your contributions!

story:
Short Summary

I love singing more than many things in life. Close to a year ago I decided to make an honest go of it professionally, quixotic a choice as it seemed, and challenging a path as I knew it would probably be. During that time, as a result of hours spent holed up in my room with my keyboard and accordion and set of bells, I managed to coax a few songs out of the ether--songs I happen to think the world needs to hear. I had the opportunity to record them in September with the help of the amazing Dara Hirsch of 1989 Recordings in Brooklyn, but unfortunately had stop there. The thing is, I need a lot more money before I can turn those recordings into an EP, and I can't raise it all by myself.

I need $1,000, and here's why:

  • I need to pay session musicians who recorded tracks for my project (namely, a violinist and a cellist),
  • pay Dara and her team for working their editing and mastering magic, and
  • have a few hundred CDs made.

Having disposable income has never really been my forte (although I'm hopeful that will someday change); it would literally take me months to finish this project if left to my own devices. So instead of bearing the entire brunt of the funding burden myself, I thought, why not enlist my friends and family members each to chip in just a little? Many hands make light work and many donations will make a finished EP. Multiple copies of it, in fact.

When my EP is finally released into the world like a dove taking flight, I will become famous. Just like that. And I will invite you all to lavish parties at my celebrity friends' mansions. Kidding. Maybe. I can't predict all the events my EP release will catalyze, but I do know this: I'll be able to create a Bandcamp page. I'll have some quality tracks to e-mail to venues when I'm trying to book gigs. I'll increase my chances of being able to go on tour. People who don't know me may learn about me, which will just be so crazy. I'll have CDs to sell at shows and to ship to people who order them from afar. Most important, you and I will both have access to a record, physical and digital, of the painstaking excavation, and then re-forming into coherent and aesthetically legitimate songs, of myriad feelings and thoughts and inspirations--which has comprised, to sound really pretentious, my creative process. And for some reason, if all that happened, it would mean a lot to me.

I've cooked up some concrete awards for certain amounts, as you can see, but I also want to be clear that any amount you can give will be appreciated. Any amount will bring me that much closer to my goal. No contribution is too small.

And if you really can't give anything (believe me, I know how it is) you can still help by spreading the word. That will be huge, too.

Thanks for reading! Let's do this!

story:
Swardhara is an organisation dedicated to showcasing the best contemporary talent in Indian classical music and dance. Gaur Baran Radhika is an especially vibrant collaboration between artists, who bring the legends of Lord Radha and Krishna to life through classical and folk forms. 

The stories of Lord Krishna and Radha have pervaded the Indian consciousness for generations, and have been a constant source of inspiration for artists - folk, classical, as well as contemporary. 
Gaur Baran Radhika is a celebration of their eternal story, and brings artists together for an evening of poetry, music, dance. The show comprises 8 kathak dances interspersed with 6 solo vocal performances. We perform this in the dhrupad, khayal, thumri, yarana, sargam, bhajan and kajri forms of music.

India’s premier cultural institution, NCPA is our esteemed venue partner for the event. 

With this performance, we hope to attract the patronage of connoisseurs, teachers, aspiring students and professionals of classical music and dance forms.

All funds from this campaign will go towards compensation for the performers, renting of rehearsal space, props and costumes.

story:
The Project and the People

Hi. My name is Anna, and I'm a singer-songwriter. 

Since moving to Brooklyn in 2011, I've been making YouTube music videos and playing the occasional show. But recording has always been my favorite way to express myself musically, and over the last few years, I began to realize that my most meaningful songs, new and old, had nowhere to land -- no place of permanence.

"Skins" is the landing pad. Scheduled for a mid-November release, it's a nine-track album showcasing the most important songs from the last several years of my life. The oldest song, "Six Days," I wrote seven years ago. "Skins," the title track and newest song, was written specially for the record earlier in 2014. 

These songs are deeply personal. They're about people I've loved (or thought I loved) and ways my heart has been broken. They're messy life stories I've whittled down in an attempt to make concise and built up in an attempt to make artful. They're about the big things that I notice in small moments. They're about the intense emotions we experience beneath the tough skin that we all wear to protect ourselves. 

The recording stage is almost complete. I couldn't have done it without the help of several talented friends:

^ Austin Greenfield: co-producer, sound engineer, vocalist, Abraham Lincoln lookalike when he doesn't shave

^ Will Levine: lead guitarist, pizza enthusiast

^ Nick Pulito: bassoonist, saxophonist, keyboardist, the Will to my Grace

^ Pete Schirmer: bassist, high school prom date

Clint Dodson: percussionist, owner of an instrument made out of goat claws (yes, of course the goat claws are on the album)

Last-not-least, Ryan Luikens has created the beautiful album cover art. Click here to see more of his amazing work.

What We Need

Recording itself has been relatively low-cost because we've been using a home set-up rather than relying on a studio. What we need now falls into four categories:

Mastering (approx. $1,000): Mastering is a process by which the final mix of an album is given a volume adjustment, equalization, and compression. In plain English, getting "Skins" mastered will ensure that the record has a cohesive feel and sounds good on all playback devices. Mastering isn't something that can be done without a lot of experience and fancy equipment, so we need to hand this part over to a professional. 

Distribution (approx. $350): "Skins" will be a digital-only release. I decided not to create physical CDs in order to simplify the overall process and to bring down the campaign goal. However, there are still some costs associated with this route of distribution, including the purchase of digital download codes. Anyone who gives $10 or more to the campaign will receive one of these codes in advance of the album's release. To distribute the album at shows and other in-person contexts, I'm having digital download "cards" made. 

Compensation (approx. $1,000): The dudes you read about above have made "Skins" possible. Their skills, talent, and enthusiasm have improved upon this project immeasurably -- and they haven't asked for anything in return. Each deserves a gift for his generous contribution.

Miscellaneous (approx. $150): Guitar strings. Train tickets to and from Long Island, where most of the recording occurred. Copious amounts of coffee? All recording projects have minor, sometimes unforeseen costs. 

    Risks & Challenges

    The most significant challenge so far has been pulling together "Skins" in a timely fashion. Any musician will tell you that recording an album will often take up as much time as you allow it to. Lucky for us, the recording part is almost done, and we have a schedule for the rest of the process (mixing, mastering, production) that will promise a mid-November release of "Skins."

    In other words, we have all our ducks in a row. But there is always the possibility of things going wrong unexpectedly -- files can be lost or corrupted, a contributor might have a conflict that prevents timely delivery of some important piece of the puzzle, or we may decide the finished product isn't up to our standards. I hope that none of these things will happen, but there is always a chance. 

      That's All She Wrote

      Thanks for reading, and I hope you can contribute. If you're not able to, you can still help! Please consider spreading the word about the campaign and about my music in general to any friends who might be interested. You can post the campaign link (igg.me/at/skins-album) all over the interwebs, direct folks to my Facebook page or YouTube channel, and use #skinsalbum to join the conversation. 

      Thank you, thank you, thank you!

      Much love, 

      Anna

Thank you, thank you, thank you!
Much love, 
Anna

story:
Short Summary

My name is Patrick Kervin, I am currently in my final semester of the Screen Arts program at Nova Scotia Community College. Our team consists of a director (Jake Ivany) and an art director and cinematographer (Alex Garnett), along with myself in a duel position of production manager and producer. Our campaign is based around a Halifax local band known as "The Regal Beagle Band". The band has recently released their debut album and are looking to work with us in creating their first music video for the album. Being part of a project within our community while supporting local music and talent has always been important to us as filmmakers. Any support from contributors would be beyond amazing and greatly appreciated as it shows us you believe in what we can achieve. Any donation would greatly benefit us no matter what the amount, and if you are unable to contribute I would like to thank you for taking the time to read about our project. This project is close to our hearts and we're all very excited to make this happen.

More Information

Facebook link : https://www.facebook.com/TheRegalBeagleBand/timeline

Website link : http://www.theregalbeagleband.com


What We Need & What You Get

The video for "Waiting on a Sign" will consist of a mixture of interior and exterior locations where two characters will interact. It will also be filmed in studio at the NSCC Waterfront Campus where a team of us will be building and dressing full sets. Filming will take place in March 2015, and will likely require numerous shoot days. For a goal for this project, we aimed for $600. Funding will be used for construction cost, set dressing cost, sound, lighting and camera equipment, locations, craft, and any other surprise cost that may arise. Receiving funding for this project would not only mean everything to the band, but also to the filmmakers behind the video. The campaign will begin January 14th, 2015 and run for roughly a month depending on progress and time constraints. Rewards will be sent out roughly a month after the completion of the video (timeframe depends on the reward). Rewards come in vast and different forms including personalized t-shirts, signed posters, a dinner prepared for you by the band, and a free show anywhere in NS at the venue of your choice for you and your friends. If we don't end up reaching our goal, funds received will still be used towards the video and be allocated into appropriate departments. Again I'd like to thank you for taking the time to read about our project, and any little bit helps us get closer to our goal.


The Impact

Making a contribution to this project would be great for not only the band but also for the community. The Regal Beagle Band has racked up multiple East Coast tours, a handful of Ontario trips, and a vast amount in Nova Scotia. With over 160 live performances, they have shared the stage with such critically acclaimed acts as The Stanfields, The Town Heroes, and Ben Caplan, as well as Halifax favourites The Stogies, Alert the Medic, Jessie Brown and Floodland. It would be great to have this band get noticed and take off. This is my first Indiegogo campaign but I have numerous experiences with budgeting short films, and other project types. I look forward to working with Indiegogo and gaining experience and learning from this project.


Risks & Challenges

For this video numerous locations will have to be acquired, both interior and exterior. Getting locations can always be challenging depending on availability, cost, and space. Having some money put off to the side as an honorarium often helps. Another way which helps from past experiences is to offer something, whether it be marketing or promoting the location to others, to doing favours or a free show. I feel acquiring these locations won't be a challenge that we can't overcome with the knowledge and perspective of the students at NSCC as we are taught how to acquire locations and how to treat the space respectfully.

Funding of course is another issue, that at this time is unpredictable. As Producer I am weighing in different possibilities and outcomes of this campaign so I can be prepared either way. Working will a none specific budget has been different, yet challenging in a good way. Allowing me to polish up my skill set. At NSCC we are taught and giving resources on how to plan accordingly to any issues that may arise.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that everyone can't help, and not everyone has extra money to donate to a project they can relate and care about. That is perfectly okay, we still appreciate you taking the time out of your day to read about our project. What we're asking of you is to please share on your social media, comment, or post what you like about our cause. Any little bit of  awareness will help our project get noticed and is appreciated.

story:
Bref résumé

  • Nous sommes un groupe de musique populaire, québécois et francophone. Nous travaillons sur ce projet depuis plusieurs années et nous sommes fin près à lancer le matériel original de AMTRIO. Avec d'excellents musiciens tel que Tommy Levesk, Alexandre Marcotte, Frédérick Marcotte et Jonathan Vachon. Nous nous donnons en spectacle à travers le Québec et les environs. Pour nous voir en spectacle, vous pouvez nous suivre sur la page Facebook officielle de AMTRIO.
  • Nous voulons réaliser un album de chansons original et vous pouvez nous aidez en commandant nos articles dès maintenant. Tous les items vendus seront remit lors du lancement de l'album "AMTRIO". Nous irons enregistrer la majorité de l'oeuvre dans un studio professionnel. C'est ce qui engendre le plus de dépense. C'est pourquoi nous vous invitons à contribuer.

Donnez et recevez!

  • Le fonctionnement est très simple. Vous n'avez qu'à acheter un article au prix indiqué sur votre droite et vous aurez le choix de donner plus si vous le désirez. Le programme accepte les paiements par carte de crédit et PayPal.
  • Les profits seront utilisés pour enregistrer les chansons en studio, pour faire la production de la pochette et pour en faire des copies.
  • Lors du lancement officiel nous inviteront tous les investisseurs qui aurons permis au projet de devenir réalité.
  • Si l'objectif n'ai pas atteint nous allons commencer le projet et nous ferons une autre campagne pour terminer le travail dans le courant de l'année 2015.

Nos expériences

  • Nous sommes dans le domaine de la musique depuis longtemps et nous avons vécu de magnifiques expériences lors des concerts avec la formation. Certains des membres on été engagés par des artistes populaires influents, tel que: Rick Hughes, William Deslauriers, Andy Duquette etc.
  • Nous avons eu la chance de partager la scène en jouant nos compositions avec des groupes tel que: Kamakazi, The New Cities, Rick Hughes, Alain-Francois etc. 
  • AMTRIO a déjà été engagé en tant que "house band" pour les Mardi de l'humour au Box Office de drummondville en 2010 et 2011. Ce qui donna la chance au groupe de jouer pour des humoristes tel que: Martin Matt, Les Chick'N'Swell, Jean-Marie Corbeil ect.

Risques et défis

  • Notre objectif est d'avoir notre album prêt en printemps 2015. Nous sommes tous sérieux et déterminés à accomplir le projet.

D'autres façons d'aider

  • Pour nous aider d'avantage, partagez cette page au maximum. Plus il y aura de gens informés et plus nous aurons de chance d'atteindre notre but.
  • Allez voir notre page Facebook et parlez en à vos amis.
story_txt:
Bref résumé

Nous sommes un groupe de musique populaire, québécois et francophone. Nous travaillons sur ce projet depuis plusieurs années et nous sommes fin près à lancer le matériel original de AMTRIO. Avec d'excellents musiciens tel que Tommy Levesk, Alexandre Marcotte, Frédérick Marcotte et Jonathan Vachon. Nous nous donnons en spectacle à travers le Québec et les environs. Pour nous voir en spectacle, vous pouvez nous suivre sur la page Facebook officielle de AMTRIO.
Nous voulons réaliser un album de chansons original et vous pouvez nous aidez en commandant nos articles dès maintenant. Tous les items vendus seront remit lors du lancement de l'album "AMTRIO". Nous irons enregistrer la majorité de l'oeuvre dans un studio professionnel. C'est ce qui engendre le plus de dépense. C'est pourquoi nous vous invitons à contribuer.


Donnez et recevez!

Le fonctionnement est très simple. Vous n'avez qu'à acheter un article au prix indiqué sur votre droite et vous aurez le choix de donner plus si vous le désirez. Le programme accepte les paiements par carte de crédit et PayPal.
Les profits seront utilisés pour enregistrer les chansons en studio, pour faire la production de la pochette et pour en faire des copies. 
Lors du lancement officiel nous inviteront tous les investisseurs qui aurons permis au projet de devenir réalité.
Si l'objectif n'ai pas atteint nous allons commencer le projet et nous ferons une autre campagne pour terminer le travail dans le courant de l'année 2015.


Nos expériences

Nous sommes dans le domaine de la musique depuis longtemps et nous avons vécu de magnifiques expériences lors des concerts avec la formation. Certains des membres on été engagés par des artistes populaires influents, tel que: Rick Hughes, William Deslauriers, Andy Duquette etc.
Nous avons eu la chance de partager la scène en jouant nos compositions avec des groupes tel que: Kamakazi, The New Cities, Rick Hughes, Alain-Francois etc. 

AMTRIO a déjà été engagé en tant que "house band" pour les Mardi de l'humour au Box Office de drummondville en 2010 et 2011. Ce qui donna la chance au groupe de jouer pour des humoristes tel que: Martin Matt, Les Chick'N'Swell, Jean-Marie Corbeil ect.



Risques et défis

Notre objectif est d'avoir notre album prêt en printemps 2015. Nous sommes tous sérieux et déterminés à accomplir le projet.


D'autres façons d'aider

Pour nous aider d'avantage, partagez cette page au maximum. Plus il y aura de gens informés et plus nous aurons de chance d'atteindre notre but.
Allez voir notre page Facebook et parlez en à vos amis.

story:
Help Rocket Jackson fund Full Tilt Music Group

It's time. After graduating from Shenandoah University in 2012 with a degree in Music Production and Recording Technology I found myself captured by student loans and the obligation to make money, and started to stray away from the music, only pursing it part- time. After a series of life events, combined with missed opportunities due to being focused on the 9-5 grind, I am now more ready than ever to pursue my career in music full time. I plan to move to the city that never sleeps, New York City.

Why $40,000?

On top of the cost of living in NYC, the equipment that is necessary to make award show winning music in today's industry is very expensive. Additionally, in the cost of renting a production room in an established studio ranges from $60-100 per hour, which can add up very quickly. In order to absorb those costs, a portion of the money will go towards leasing out a room at a monthly rate, and having a fully functioning production room for Full Tilt Music.
Expenses involved:
  • Production Room Lease- $2,000 a month
  • Advertising- $7,500
  • Apple Mac Pro- $3,000
  • (2) Studio Monitors- $1,500
  • Neumann u87 Microphone- $3,000
  • Microphone Preamps
  • Audio Interface
  • DAW Software and Plugins
  • Musicians
  • Songwriters
  • Engineers
  • Session Players
Why Give?

It takes a community of people to make anything successful! On top of giving back and having the heart warming reward of seeing a young person live their dreams, there's a lot of Full Tilt swag! Make sure to check out the perks and claim yours now!

I only have $5, what good is that going to do for a $40k goal?

ALOT!!! Every little bit helps! Additionally any shares of the page will be greatly appreciated!  Word of mouth is going to be the most effective way for me to reach this goal!

story:
Who We Are: We are I, The Colossus from Chicago, IL. 

What We're Looking For:  To be completely honest we're looking for money to buy a van for tour. With summer fast approaching as well as the release of our debut EP Desolation we're are reaching that crunch time where we need to start preparing for tours. We have already had to deny a couple tours due to the fact that we can't afford it right now. 

Desolation EP: Our EP Desolation is to release May 3, 2014. We always have had this idea of making our fans feel stronger and larger than life, and this summer we really want to bring this idea across the country. 

Any little bit helps!

Love, I, The Colossus

story:
I'm asking for support to enable me to record my album this autumn. I have fifteen songs written and ready to take into the studio to be recorded/produced... But I lack the spare funds to do so, right now. These songs have been ready for a few months now, since I began teaching myself the basics of guitar almost three years ago... If I wait too much longer, I am afraid they will fade out, never to return. Please help me turn my songs into a tangible record to share with the hearts/minds who care to listen...

The Record...

There are personal reasons for wanting to get this album made. Mostly, because the songs have been written for a while now, but have been put on the back-burner for various reasons. To create something tangible with artwork and liner notes, would feel a massive achievement. As well as music, I am working on a collection of short stories which are sometimes loosely connected to the song themes - as yet, I am not sure when this will be completed but the album and the book will work in conjunction and one will help to explain and inform the other...

I hope I can bring something to the world with my music and writing.

If I can inspire you even just a small amount, as I have been inspired in my lifetime, then I will feel like it wasn't a waste.

This will remain in the world beyond my own existence. Art and thought remains.

The Process...

The songs I would like to include on my album are written in their basic bones stage of evolution. I'd like to build on these demos and take the songs to the studio where I can record the vocals and guitar parts - and then work with adding additional instrumentation and production - mixing them up & getting the final album made and hopefully a few physical copies of CDs too (that's the hope)!

* To do this, I need to first decide where to record the tracks.

* I need to work out alongside a sound engineer, the best ways to add to my work - this is where the big costs come in - and a reason why I am crowdfunding.

Your Encouragement...

Really helps! Seriously. Apart from helping me to fund the recording - it is also a boost to know that there are folks out there who actually would sit down and listen to my songs at the end of it all.

* Please feel free to share this campaign and support where possible.

* Please contact me with any questions or ideas you might have - happy to respond! :)

Thank you so much for reading/listening/watching/sharing - it means a LOT.

story:
A Barrel Of Monkeys

Greetings! I'm making a new album, my first solo record--

For the last 7 years, since I quit the rock band touring circuit, I've been playing and studying music in a new way, for me: from theatrical productions to busking in the streets; from folk dance camps to marching band festivals; all while writing and learning traditional songs from a wide variety of cultures.

My New Orleans musical background has led me to jazz traditions; my Hungarian/Eastern European heritage has opened up an obsessive study of Klezmer and other Balkan musics; and my time spent communing with the wilds out in the Big Bend of west Texas has inspired my story-telling. All of these interests led me to: "A Barrel Of Monkeys", my first full length solo album.

Have a listen to "Old Joe", recorded with the Mighty Dony Wynn on drums, Willie Crash Landin on tuba, and Dahktur Sick the fiddle killer!

Old Joe



I've been blessed to collaborate with a multitude of great musicians, and many of them have helped me record the songs I've been writing. My longtime friend and recording guru Rob Halverson has been my co-producer, and we've gotten some incredible results, fleshed out versions of these tunes that are mighty indeed.

Example: "Coffee With A Clown"; with Amanda, Michelle, Corinne, Will, and John Bush on percussion--

Coffee With A Clown

Here's a list of the fabulous musicians who have helped me create this music:

Michelle Alany: violin, vocals

Amanda Kitchens: accordion, vocals

Laura Scarborough: vibraphone, marimba, vocals

Rob Halverson: hammond, pedal steel guitar

William Landin: tuba

Brad Houser: bass, bass clarinet

Dony Wynn: percussion, trap set

John Bush: percussion, drums

Dahktur Sick: the fiddle killer!

Dylan Blackthorn: accordion, vocals

Corinne Zappler: viola

Steve Bernal: cello

Ralph E. White: fiddle

Elizabeth Lee: vocals

Emilie Clepper: vocals



I'm an independent artist at this stage which allows me the freedom of choices that I might not have with front end investment. So I've launched this campaign to offer pre-sales of the album (along with other perks) to finish and release the project. Here's where I need your help--

These funds raised by this campaign will go directly to the recording, mixing, mastering, designing and reproduction of the album. Basically, paying off the debts already incurred, and future costs. 

Recording, mixing $3,000

Mastering $500

Cover Art $500

Limited run CD reproduction $500

$4,500

Listed to the right numerous great perks to choose from. These are essentially gifts which you can buy for yourself, or for someone dear to you--

Whether you’re able to financially contribute or not, it’s important that the word gets spread! Please pass this along to your friends on Facebook and Twitter, email it, whatever and however you think best. I'd be so very grateful to have your help in any way!

Thanks, and see you on down the road!

Balmorhea

story:
Welcome to the "Might Crash" project.This album traces the epic journey of an off the grid Romantic seeking to solve the conundrum of life on the margins of American society. How do you know when you might crash? Here's your chance to elevate an American artist whose music gets to the core of the struggle between light and darkness, security and insecurity. 

 

I grew up in the swamps of Massachusetts, wandering the woods, a free agent, running from cops and neighbors with frogs and lady slippers (Cypripedium calceolus) in my hands. 

Despite the known existence of classical trained musicians in my family, I didn’t pick up the guitar until age 15.  I attended Marlboro College in Vermont as a creative writing major, but didn’t take well to structure--only to my guitar and songwriting. I left college after a year, working on various farms and eventually ended up on small island called Naushon off the coast of Cape Cod, Massachusetts. 

On Naushon I met world renowned ethnomusicologist Ralph Rinzler, who discovered Doc Watson and started Folkways Records.  Ralph asked me to play a song for him, and then took it upon himself to give me a lesson or two.  Later, he hired me to drive his private collection of priceless Blues cylinders from DC to Ojai, California.  Along the way I went through New Mexico and was completely taken by its strange beauty. 

EAST OR WEST

Soon after, while working on a hay wagon on Naushon I fell into one of Einstein’s “wormholes” and ended up in Santa Cruz, California studying sustainable agriculture, permaculture, horticulture and organic gardening.  I started an organic farm in Sebastopol in 1994.  After a year or so, I found myself lured back to New Mexico. 

In December of 1999, after five years in Santa Fe, I moved back to Massachusetts to dedicate my life to music and songwriting.  After five years in Boston, landing on a European label and winning Boston’s Best Male Vocalist Award, I decided to leave it all on a good note and returned to New Mexico.  Back in the Land of Enchantment I continued this musical dream, along with buying an “off the grid” farm, planting an orchard, getting married, raising two free-range kids, being Mayordomo of the valley, being an arborist and touring Europe every two years. 

DEEPER PURPOSE

This dream continues with one of the greatest undiscovered bands of all time, the Mighty Salt Licks.  I have been told by fans that we “saved their lives”, “helped them heal”, “performed the best show they have ever seen in their life” and one fan even went as far as to say “Boris, if you make me cry one more time, I’m gonna have to kick your ass”.  My music draws from simple everyday life and its strange cast of players; and compels and asks to find a deeper purpose in it all. 

THE STUDIO AND THE SONGS

I arranged in October 2011 to go back into the studio and try to knock out some new songs the band and I had been kicking around since the Spring.  We had tested the new songs out at the Moab Folk Festival, in Holland, and at various New Mexican venues and had settled on some long-tried and tested arrangements. From the beginning of Fall 2011 I had been completely overcome by the seasons tone, its light and intensity. It really struck me in a way that I had not felt in a while or maybe ever. 

My wife and I had been struggling for years to raise our kids in a remote, off the grid valley and really not making ends meet with her schoolteacher salary and my musician’s chump change.  It was all really coming to a head and the Fall just brought it there quickly in a raving yellow sea of aspens. 

MIGHT CRASH TAKES SHAPE

One of the main songs to be recorded that weekend was a song entitled “Might Crash”.  It was a song that began as a joke, to bring some lightness to the dark mood of the times.  I was feeling regretful and worthless and when I saw one of our dogs dining on a diaper in the melting snow, I turned and asked my wife if we had turned into white trash.  How did our ideals morph into this gruesome image?  Babies crying, broke, stuck on the mountain splitting wood in a snowstorm.  Why were we here, what were we doing?  The song became “Might Crash”, the title track of the new album.  A song that in the end, sums up our New Great Depression.

How do you know when you might crash?

Is the dog eating diapers on the dying lawn?

Do your lips not reach her before she leaves?

Is she wondering where the fun has gone?

Finally, the morning came to meet with the Mighty Salt Licks at the studio.  As I drove down the mountain from Truchas, NM, the aspen groves were on fire, and my heart was on fire.  I was overtaken again, and had to pull over and try to sum up the feeling.  I wrote the song “Flesh and Dream” on the shoulder of the ribbon of death, Highway 76.  I finished the song before I had arrived at Frogville Studios.  I decided to show it to Susan and the band and we recorded it first, hardly knowing it at all. Cautiously we entered “Flesh and Dream” trying to find its groove and depth.  Going into the studio and recording a song that the band has never heard and I have never played on guitar is something I would never do, but somehow it felt right then and we did it and triumphed.  It is also one of the strongest songs on the new album.  The “Might Crash” project has been recorded live from the beginning with the entire band in one big room.  The core tracks of the project were recorded that fall week, in October 2011 by Bill Palmer.  All said and done there have been 20 songs recorded live at John Treadwell's Frogville with a few guest performers.  It has been a stunning project, one that has mellowed and matured over time like a good whiskey. This project would never have made it off the ground without the dynamic engineering powers and generosity of Bill Palmer.

THE MIGHTY BAND

At any given show multi-instrumentalist Brett Davis seeks out the perfect tone through one of his handmade perfect amps. He is a scholar of North American music and draws his greatest influence probably from guitarist Robbie Robertson. I have collaborated with him for almost twenty years. His soulful playing was absolutely essential in the making of the analog albums “When We Were Big”, and “Cactusman Versus The Blue Demon”.  Brett is one of a kind and since he is the only member from New Mexico he brings that vibe with him, relaxed and behind the beat. His playing speaks volumes on this new “Might Crash" project.

Susan Holmes or “Thunder Hoof”, as we affectionately call her, is the finest bass player in the Land of Enchantment and I am blessed to have shared the stage with her for almost ten years. She is a truly awesome presence and breaks up the ugly white boy syndrome in the band. Susan can conquer a crowd with her smile and bass thunder and regularly schools the band in true three-part harmony.

Kevin Zoernig aka “Professor Furious” produced ”Cactusman”, and the “Wheel of Life” albums. He is the most gifted musician and teacher I have ever had the privilege to work with. Kevin is daring to the end on keys and with visions and ideas to boot in the studio.

Paul Groetzinger is one the finest drummers in the Southwest. Because he is a fine singer too, his drums follow suit and play to the phrasing of each song accordingy. He studied at the College of Santa Fe under you guessed it, “Professor Furious”.  He has the guts to go out on a limb. He tries new things. He experiments. He feels it and everyone knows it. His approach is fantastically fluid but with a Charlie Watts rock ‘n’ roll appeal.

Guest performers on the album include: Sharon Gilchrist, Stephanie Hatfield, George Langston, Ollie O'Shea, Michael Chavez, Chris McGandy.

BUDGET

To bring this project to the world, we need funds to pay for the final production, engineering, mixing, mastering, and distribution of the album. That's a fair piece of change, and anything at all that you contribute will be used for this purpose.  If we don't make our goal, the fund will pay for each stage in steps, and we will try to keep moving the project forward over time.

Engineer: $1600

Mastering: $800

Production: $2000

Duplication from master: $1400.

Airfare to studio: $300

Postage for old-fashioned promotions: $200.

New-fangled promotions and album publicity: $1000 

Therapy for the band: $ Just kidding.

THANK YOU

Thanks so much for stopping by to check out our project. And thanks for signing up to help this album and this band get out there. Money is scarce, and any donation you can make is going to have real and tangible value.  Even if you can't afford to make a contribution, you can still help by emailing this around to your colleagues and friends. Please pass the word about the Might Crash project.

I arranged in October 2011 to go back into the studio and try to knock out some new songs the band and I had been kicking around since the Spring.  We had tested the new songs out at the Moab Folk Festival, in Holland, and at various New Mexican venues and had settled on some long-tried and tested arrangements. From the beginning of Fall 2011 I had been completely overcome by the seasons tone, its light and intensity. It really struck me in a way that I had not felt in a while or maybe ever. 
My wife and I had been struggling for years to raise our kids in a remote, off the grid valley and really not making ends meet with her schoolteacher salary and my musician’s chump change.  It was all really coming to a head and the Fall just brought it there quickly in a raving yellow sea of aspens. 
MIGHT CRASH TAKES SHAPE
One of the main songs to be recorded that weekend was a song entitled “Might Crash”.  It was a song that began as a joke, to bring some lightness to the dark mood of the times.  I was feeling regretful and worthless and when I saw one of our dogs dining on a diaper in the melting snow, I turned and asked my wife if we had turned into white trash.  How did our ideals morph into this gruesome image?  Babies crying, broke, stuck on the mountain splitting wood in a snowstorm.  Why were we here, what were we doing?  The song became “Might Crash”, the title track of the new album.  A song that in the end, sums up our New Great Depression.
How do you know when you might crash?
Is the dog eating diapers on the dying lawn?
Do your lips not reach her before she leaves?
Is she wondering where the fun has gone?
Finally, the morning came to meet with the Mighty Salt Licks at the studio.  As I drove down the mountain from Truchas, NM, the aspen groves were on fire, and my heart was on fire.  I was overtaken again, and had to pull over and try to sum up the feeling.  I wrote the song “Flesh and Dream” on the shoulder of the ribbon of death, Highway 76.  I finished the song before I had arrived at Frogville Studios.  I decided to show it to Susan and the band and we recorded it first, hardly knowing it at all. Cautiously we entered “Flesh and Dream” trying to find its groove and depth.  Going into the studio and recording a song that the band has never heard and I have never played on guitar is something I would never do, but somehow it felt right then and we did it and triumphed.  It is also one of the strongest songs on the new album.  The “Might Crash” project has been recorded live from the beginning with the entire band in one big room.  The core tracks of the project were recorded that fall week, in October 2011 by Bill Palmer.  All said and done there have been 20 songs recorded live at John Treadwell's Frogville with a few guest performers.  It has been a stunning project, one that has mellowed and matured over time like a good whiskey. This project would never have made it off the ground without the dynamic engineering powers and generosity of Bill Palmer.
THE MIGHTY BAND

At any given show multi-instrumentalist Brett Davis seeks out the perfect tone through one of his handmade perfect amps. He is a scholar of North American music and draws his greatest influence probably from guitarist Robbie Robertson. I have collaborated with him for almost twenty years. His soulful playing was absolutely essential in the making of the analog albums “When We Were Big”, and “Cactusman Versus The Blue Demon”.  Brett is one of a kind and since he is the only member from New Mexico he brings that vibe with him, relaxed and behind the beat. His playing speaks volumes on this new “Might Crash" project.
Susan Holmes or “Thunder Hoof”, as we affectionately call her, is the finest bass player in the Land of Enchantment and I am blessed to have shared the stage with her for almost ten years. She is a truly awesome presence and breaks up the ugly white boy syndrome in the band. Susan can conquer a crowd with her smile and bass thunder and regularly schools the band in true three-part harmony.
Kevin Zoernig aka “Professor Furious” produced ”Cactusman”, and the “Wheel of Life” albums. He is the most gifted musician and teacher I have ever had the privilege to work with. Kevin is daring to the end on keys and with visions and ideas to boot in the studio.
Paul Groetzinger is one the finest drummers in the Southwest. Because he is a fine singer too, his drums follow suit and play to the phrasing of each song accordingy. He studied at the College of Santa Fe under you guessed it, “Professor Furious”.  He has the guts to go out on a limb. He tries new things. He experiments. He feels it and everyone knows it. His approach is fantastically fluid but with a Charlie Watts rock ‘n’ roll appeal.
Guest performers on the album include: Sharon Gilchrist, Stephanie Hatfield, George Langston, Ollie O'Shea, Michael Chavez, Chris McGandy.
BUDGET

To bring this project to the world, we need funds to pay for the final production, engineering, mixing, mastering, and distribution of the album. That's a fair piece of change, and anything at all that you contribute will be used for this purpose.  If we don't make our goal, the fund will pay for each stage in steps, and we will try to keep moving the project forward over time.
Engineer: $1600
Mastering: $800
Production: $2000
Duplication from master: $1400.
Airfare to studio: $300
Postage for old-fashioned promotions: $200.
New-fangled promotions and album publicity: $1000 
Therapy for the band: $ Just kidding.
THANK YOU
Thanks so much for stopping by to check out our project. And thanks for signing up to help this album and this band get out there. Money is scarce, and any donation you can make is going to have real and tangible value.  Even if you can't afford to make a contribution, you can still help by emailing this around to your colleagues and friends. Please pass the word about the Might Crash project.

story:
**NEW UPDATE**

I have been fortunate enough to have received an offer from a match funder! Each donation from now until the end of July will be equally matched by a generous donor. Your contributions will now be doubled -- how exciting!!

 

First, let me share my sincere and appreciative thanks, as your love and support of music has fueled my passion to continue pursuing a career in classical music.

Since graduating from Wartburg College with a Bachelor of Music, I moved to London to study Arts Administration, Cultural Policy and Music Management. I made the conscious decision to follow this path because of the stability and security the program would provide and the wealth of performing and growth opportunities in my vocal studies that London has to offer.

Through my coursework I undertook a self-management project and spent four months auditioning, taking lessons and coachings, rehearsing, applying for vocal programs and programming, marketing and performing in a solo recital. As an outcome of this I was selected to three prestigious programs and have a busy summer planned:

• June at Aldeburgh Festival: After applying in March, I was nearly immediately awarded one of 12 places on the Princess Margaret of Hesse and the Rhine Student Scheme at the Aldeburgh Festival. I just finished my week in Snape and Aldeburgh on the Eastern coast of England working behind the scenes of the Festival and performing at an end-of-week student programmed and performed recital. The concert was a success, and one couple even stopped me on their way out of the carpark to tell me how much they loved my voice and hope I continue singing! The funds you contribute will help reimburse my travel and subsistence costs associated with spending a week in Aldeburgh and Snape.

• July in Dartington: This residential school welcomes musicians of all nationalities, ages and abilities but has select advanced courses for students of exceptional talent and promise. I was selected to the advanced voice course, during which I will spend a week studying under the world-renowned and early music specialist soprano Dame Emma Kirkby while participating in several small ensembles and choirs. The funds you give will help pay for travel to/from Dartington, course fees, accommodation and three meals per day as well as entrance into all concerts and events during my stay.

•August in Abingdon: I was one of 65 singers accepted to attend this intensive training course for aspiring young singers. Led by expert and renowned teachers and professionals from top UK conservatoires, I will spent a week in master classes, lessons, movement and technique courses and performing both opera and song repertoire for peers and professionals. The ethos of the school is one of extreme hard work in a supportive and friendly atmosphere. Funds raised will contribute toward travel to/from Abingdon, course fees, accommodation, meals and all concerts and special events.

While I have been saving as much as possible and have received modest bursaries for each, I still need help to meet the expenses for the summer programs- approximately £1,500. I humbly ask for your assistance and continued support to help make up the difference.

Why Support Me?

The most common voice type in the opera world is a soprano. In the beginning
of a career in opera, what can separate my name from those of other sopranos in are the experiences that help build stamina and artistry at a young age.

The growth to be had from a summer like this is vital. They will provide me with knowledge of my own voice as well as that of the industry, specifically in a British music context.

My voice teacher in Iowa, Dr. Jennifer Larson, told me earlier this year something that has helped me believe in the continuance of my studies. “If you aren’t practicing, someone else is. And when you meet her, she will beat you.” While this may be considered a negative outlook, it has given me the drive and ambition I needed to achieve success. If I don’t go for it, others will!

These experiences this summer will act as a catalyst to my confidence and career- they are happening for my benefit and will allow others to pick me out of a crowd of sopranos. The knowledge I gain will be indispensible and boost my acceleration into the world of classical music performance.

Also, all donors will be invited to a London venue to be determined, for a recital sharing my experiences and learning at the beginning of September!

Thank you for your support and love, and please contact me for more information.

I look forward to sharing my career with you!

With gratitude,

Leah Podzimek

story:
www.RockYourInnerMama.com

Thank you for your support! The Indiegogo campaign is over.  Please visit RockYourInnerMama.com for immediate download or to order the CD.

 

 

 

In Just One Simple CD, I’ll Show You How To Start, End & Live Each Day As The Amazing Parent You Strive To Be.

Dear Rockin’ Mamas (And Dads, You Rock Too),

I knew I had landed on a unique idea when I could confidently call myself “Cool as a Cucumber” during my son’s major meltdowns.   

I also knew I was onto something when my parent coaching clients started asking me to record our sessions so that they could listen to my guided visualizations over and over again. 

Now, it’s time to get this CD on the market so that parents everywhere can have a quick and easy way to reset themselves and show up for their kids as completely awesome.  When we act consistently with our parenting goals and family values, we thrive.  And when we thrive, our kids thrive.  That’s what this CD is all about.  Listening to this CD inspires parents to stop their habit of barely surviving and build new practices of parenting with compassion, positivity and strategies that work.    

 

It’s Like A Quick Mental Yoga Workout For Parents 

I use these visualizations during parent coaching calls and my clients love them.   They are relaxing, practical and related to the core set of principles from which I coach, known as the “Rock Your Inner Mama Mantras.”  My clients wanted these recorded, so here we are, making a CD.   With this CD, I can help more parents say with confidence, “I’m cool as a cucumber,” and truly mean it.     

 

About To Fly Off The Handle?  Relax Your Body and Open Your Heart To A New Way Of Parenting  

  • Start the morning right with a 3-minute reminder of your parenting goals.
  • Listen in the car for 5 minutes before you pick your kids up from school or come home from a busy work day.
  • Prepare yourself for tricky transitions, meal time stress and bedtime battles.    
  • Say Good Night with a sense of peace, gratitude and compassion.  
  • Overcome insomnia as you fall asleep to soothing music and positive imagery. 
  • Learn how to set your intention to be a rockin’ parent in any circumstance.

Let Me Guide You On A Journey To The Heart Of Parenting.  Your Kids Will Thank You!  Mine Did. 

When I started my private practice as a PCI Certified Parent Coach® & Strategist, I began seeing huge results in the lives of my clients AND in my own family.   I have two spirited boys who challenge me every day to rise above my ego and dig deep (inside and out) for strength and wisdom.  My children reap the benefits as much as I do.  We all reach a boiling point, and we all need support.   That’s why I’m creating this CD (to support you) and that’s why I’m here on IndieGogo (so you can support other parents).  Coaching and strategizing with parents is the most satisfying work I’ve ever done, and you’re making it possible to expand this offering on a whole new level.

 

Success Stories From Clients Who Have Experienced These Visualizations Live During Coaching

“I feel more confident in my parenting, more confident in myself and more present for my son. I often think, “How would Rachel guide me in this situation?”   She offered me tangible tools and skills that I took and applied to my whole life.  I carry these tools and Rachel’s voice with me daily.   Rachel gave me permission to take care of myself in order to make me a better mom.”  Michelle, Southern California

“Rachel’s visualizations challenge me without making me feel wrong.  Her words guide my thoughts and actions to greater possibilities and deeper connection with my children.  She is a gifted practitioner who delivers results.” Aaron, Northern California.

How Does the CD Work? 

The CD includes a series of tracks that parents can listen to during various points in their day.   These tracks weave together:

  • Practical tips for parents who just need answers in a given moment.
  • Thoughtful questions that encourage parents to look within for those answers.
  • Universal reminders that set the stage for success in any home.
  • New perspectives to help parents refocus their attention and provide much needed hope. 

The Rock Your Inner Mama CD is for you if:  

  • Your stress and lack of sleep is filtering down to your kids. 
  • You lose your patience easily, raise your voice, and regret it. 
  • You’re trying to squeeze every last drop out of your day because there’s never enough time. 
  • You’re burned out on parenting but never want to feel burned out on your kids. 
  • You’re at your wits end with behavioral issues at home.   
  • You’re open to a new and transformational way of thinking about your family.

Actually, any parent can benefit from this series of relaxing sounds, affirming visualizations and quiet reflections on their journey to the heart of parenthood.

So What’s the Status?  

My goal is to release the CD in time for the holidays so that parents can find peace and joy in the hustle and bustle of parenting during this crazy time.   I have already recorded half the CD, done the graphic design and chosen a production company.   I’m so close to being done!  

What if I’m Not a Parent?  

If you're not a parent, but think this CD is an important contribution to parents and children, you can gift the CD, coaching sessions, or seminar series to a parent in need.   

Thanks for joining me on IndieGogo.   Together, we’ll make a difference.

Warmly,

Rachel Sklar, MSW

Parent Coach and Strategist

story:
Hi There!

My name is Kartika Nair, and I have been passionate about composing and performing conscious and spiritual music for the past 8 years. I run a brand called "Synchroshakti" that is geared towards helping people empower themselves mentally, emotionally and spiritually. Music has always been a big part of how these empowering messages are translated to audiences across the world. Over the years I have composed a lot of original music, and now I am in the final stages of putting together a new album titled "Love Unites Us", under the genre of Reggae and conscious music.

Inspiration came through!

With the great success of the funding for the first music video project "Love Unites Us", I want to first thank everyone from the very bottom of my heart for contributing to make the previous music video campaign a massive success! I was blessed to continue receiving so much of your love and support even after the campaign goals were met. I feel truly blessed to have so many people believe in my music and this mission and I really hope I made you all proud! 

About this campaign!

This is a campaign to fund my music video, that acts as a visual message to the people to not lose faith in their trying times and raise above their circumstances. The song speaks of the strife of human existence when faced with mental and emotional pain.  Then it emphasizes the fact that when we look within and find our own light and power, we can rise above our suffering.

To help raise the energy of the listener alongside uplift his spirit, this song “Look up” is very upbeat, very bright and has a groovy bassline that will make you want to jump up, dance and sing along to the catchy chorus, changing your mood altogether! The campaign is also important to me for the reason of being able to do my part in helping spread positive energy and also be given further opportunities to able to bring such empowering music to more people across the world.

"Look Up" is produced by a Hungarian Label called Little Zion Studios, a connection brought together by Song Embassy from Kingston, Jamaica. 

What you will help me achieve

By contributing to this project you will be an integral part of a conscious movement to bring more positive energy and positive messages to the ears of many who need it as well as creating another chapter in the history of reggae music in India. You will also be helping me create a video that represents Indian reggae to the world over.

What We Need & What You Get

The projects requires a total amount of $1000, which goes into the following areas:

1. Equipment: Hiring equipment (Camera, Lenses, Rigs) for a few days of shooting.

2. Lights (indoor & outdoor)

3. Production: This video requires shots of nature, people, places and therefore the funds move towards transport, props, location scouting, studio rental, food etc.

4. Actors and presentation costs: Fee for makeup and presentation of additional individuals other than myself involved as characters within the music video

5. Video Crew: Director, DOP, Stylist , Makeup Artist & Art Director

6. Post production costs: Video Editing and Color Grading.

A unique perk!

You are welcome to donate any amount you are comfortable with. Donations of $50 and above do get a special mention in the video credits.

All the funds collected regardless of meeting the entire goal will continue to be put into this production process until all the funds can be gathered to finish materializing the production.

The Impact

Your contribution to this project will aid in bringing the power and influence of positive music to the hearts and minds of many, spreading the message of love, gratitude, community and self love and personal power to a world that is battling demons within themselves as well as within the structures of modern day society. This music personally took me out of very deep negative states and I am of firm conviction that it will bring more people like myself back into their hearts and smiling again!

Do you know that one song that brightens your day and makes you feel great? Where the beat, the groove, melodies and the lyrics just put you in that happy zone? Well this song will do the same for you and for many who chance upon it. We have enough music in the world that depresses us,and negatively conditions us, so let’s support and create music that brightens us up! We sure could use more positive music on our radios and televisions! Don’t you think?

I am a go- getter, a hard worker and I will do what it takes to get this labor of love ready and running because it is a core part of my purpose and path, and it is this determination that will help me overcome any hurdles that lie on the path to materializing this production.

If a donation is not possible for you, don't worry you can still contribute by spreading the word of this campaign across to others who also support positive music and positive movements for our society and the world. Make sure to use the Indiegogo sharing tools to spread the message far and wide!

My deepest thanks to everyone who is a part of this journey and this production, for your support goes beyond just me and to many across the world who would be grateful to receive the power of positive and groovy music in their lives.

The Impact
Your contribution to this project will aid in bringing the power and influence of positive music to the hearts and minds of many, spreading the message of love, gratitude, community and self love and personal power to a world that is battling demons within themselves as well as within the structures of modern day society. This music personally took me out of very deep negative states and I am of firm conviction that it will bring more people like myself back into their hearts and smiling again!
Do you know that one song that brightens your day and makes you feel great? Where the beat, the groove, melodies and the lyrics just put you in that happy zone? Well this song will do the same for you and for many who chance upon it. We have enough music in the world that depresses us,and negatively conditions us, so let’s support and create music that brightens us up! We sure could use more positive music on our radios and televisions! Don’t you think?
I am a go- getter, a hard worker and I will do what it takes to get this labor of love ready and running because it is a core part of my purpose and path, and it is this determination that will help me overcome any hurdles that lie on the path to materializing this production.
If a donation is not possible for you, don't worry you can still contribute by spreading the word of this campaign across to others who also support positive music and positive movements for our society and the world. Make sure to use the Indiegogo sharing tools to spread the message far and wide!
My deepest thanks to everyone who is a part of this journey and this production, for your support goes beyond just me and to many across the world who would be grateful to receive the power of positive and groovy music in their lives.

story:
Operatunities - The Story 

Operatunities was created by singer Carla Swedish as a "win-win" arts organization and community service organization; and as an answer to two questions.

As a singer, Carla had observed that there comes a point when finishing and performing one's work IS the work. This is why many advanced and professional level singers develop classical recitals or small cabarets of musical theatre material; invite their friends and family; and get themselves up in front of an audience. These recitals and small shows can cost the singer a fair amount of money to put together; and often it is necessarily a one-time performance. While repeated performance of material is yet the next step for an artist's development and is of great value to the artist; it is not always possible. So, Carla's first question was "where are the venues where a singer can develop at this level of their work, performing for an appreciative audience, without having to "pay to perform"?

Meanwhile, Carla's Mom, while living in a retirement community, went from independent living to assisted living to skilled nursing; and Carla noticed that the quality and quantity of the artistic, enriching experiences to which her mother had access dramatically decreased. In full agreement with statistics that music is healing to mind, body and spirit; Carla's second question was "how can I provide quality musical performances to the people who would appreciate it and benefit the most; but whose access has become limited?"

Operatunities was therefore born to bring advanced and professional level singers with finished, quality classical or "classic" musical programs right into retirement and other types of care communities; thus providing singers with venues, and under-served audiences with quality programming. To date, Operatunities has presented 3 different programs by 2 different singers for a total of 10 times at 4 different venues.

We are not only repeating venues, but we are seeing repeat individual audience members as well. Audiences really seem to love what we are offering. There is always a natural receiving line after the performances when individuals come up to thank us for performing. They tell stories about how they used to sing or play piano or attend opera on a regular basis; and there is a very clear and rewarding sense that we have provided an uplifting and valuable experience.

The venues are all getting into the spirit of Operatunities, making the programs special by serving refreshments or arranging the room to reflect the theme or feel of the music. An unexpected benefit is that Operatunities is providing an event that brings family members of residents in to share an experience with residents. It is lovely to see children and/or the caretaking spouse be able to step out of that role and just "be" with their loved one.

Operatunities is committed to exponentially increasing its number of singers, programs and venues. That makes raising the money to make these programs possible Operatunities' current number one priority. Funds donated to Operatunities will be used to subsidize finished, advanced or professional level vocal performances for deserving audiences, while providing venues for deserving singers.

story:
Thank you for checking out this campaign to support the release of The Dead XIII’s second studio album! You probably clicked a link we (or someone you know) shared to get here, so it’s likely you already know who we are, but just in case you don’t….


The Dead XIII are a 5-piece band from the UK, we are purveyors of the darker side of metal. In 2015 we released our critically acclaimed debut album, Catacombs. It set the scene for our unique take on horror metal. We are especially proud of gaining a 4K review and being named in the writer’s top 10 albums of the year by Kerrang!


We want to be able to release the best album we possibly can. We wouldn’t be here today if it wasn’t for your support, so by providing you this opportunity to be part of the process, we are hoping together we can do something incredible.


We hear a lot of people saying that the music industry is dead and that bands can’t survive, in some ways that is true, but we are proud of our fans, our Army Of The Dead, who have been the great force behind us being able to do what we do.


So what’s the deal?


We are using this campaign to offer advance sales of the CD version of the album, along with some other great perks that you won’t find anywhere else. Simply having advanced sales removes some of the financial risk that we face and helps us fund essential promotional and marketing opportunities that we may not be able to do otherwise. The old school method says that we pay for everything in the hope people buy the album when it’s released, so this just flips that and gives you the opportunity to support the process as well as the finished album. It allows us to get the record into your hands quicker and gets us back out on the road meeting you guys sooner.


We've put together some fantastic perks as part of the campaign including Skype Lessons, signed cymbals, drum heads, exclusive T-Shirts and as its nearly Christmas we will be producing official ‘The Dead XIII Christmas cards’ personally signed by all of the band. Every single order will include a personalized note thanking you for helping!


This campaign will be the ONLY place to pre-order the album in CD format for release day. So, if you pledge, as a thank you for support you will be the first people to get a copy of the album.

#TheGhostsAreWaiting

story:
Your support will result in a new rock album that will blow you away!

We have very high hopes for this album; which is why we're eager to take advantage of the opportunity to work with some multi-platinum producers.

We know you're going to love it! And we're going to love making it! :)

 

As a contributor, you can be the proud owner of special edition items like:

 

 




 
 
 

Why are you asking for SO MUCH MONEY?

To be clear, we ARE NOT ASKING FOR MONEY FOR OURSELVES. This money is going RIGHT BACK into what will prove to be an amazing album FOR YOU!

 

What's so SPECIAL about the Special / Limited Edition Album?

The album you're pre-ordering will have special-edition cover art (clearly distinguishing your copy from the mass-release version later) and a BONUS TRACK that will NOT be on the mass-released version. Think of it as a special song that you get to be one of the few to own. As such, if this album is successful, you'll have something that may be very valuable in the future!

 

And the Poster and T-Shirt?

They'll contain special-edition art as well; which will be discontinued after we get them out to our backers from this campaign. So, again, you'll be one of the few to have one. And, again, if this album blows up, you'll have a piece of rock history that may be of greater value in the future.

 

What songs will be on the new album?

We've been working diligently to write and pre-produce works that we're confident you'll fall in love with. Though listing names won't really do much, here are a few of the track names that you'll see on the upcoming album: "Safety Net", "Fantasy", and "The One".

 

What songs are on the Next September debut (that I also get)?

Check out the "Gallery" tab for some samples. :)

 

Am I guaranteed to receive the things I order, even if you don't make funding?

Yes. Regardless of how well we do here, you WILL get everything promised to you. 

 

When will I get my stuff?

Downloads of the Next September demo album, Next September, will become available immediately following this campaign.

Posters and T-shirts will arrive first (usually within 60 days from the close of this campaign).

The new album will drop no later than January 2014, although we're hoping for a September 2013 release.

Live events must be scheduled individually...

story:
Movement for Musicians:  

My goal is to help musicians enhance their playing. In the spring of 2014, I am offering a series of movement workshops for those who play musical instruments. We will explore principles of Spacial Dynamics® to deepen the experience of playing and sharing music. Drawing from hands-on techniques, posture work, and spatial exercises, we will discover more balanced movement patterns.  
In developing more sustainable ways to play one’s instrument, the musician gains flexibility while maintaining focus.  The field of Spacial Dynamics® offers many tools to enable musicians to play their best for longer periods of time.  The goal is to come away with methods to prevent and alleviate discomfort that can arise from on-going practicing and performing.

This is an opportunity for musicians to encounter new ways of using their instrument, leading to increased awareness and fluidity in their playing.  When we modify how we approach the instrument, we can gain a fuller experience of listening and playing with others.

Each participant will receive individualized attention to address particular concerns. This series of classes is open to all who play music, novice and experienced.

As a new program, we need your help getting this of the ground. Your financial support will help tremendously in making this program a reality. People are eager to explore this way of working, but we cannot embark on the journey without your support! Please donate to this project so that we can delve into this area of movement research.

Many thanks for your generosity!

Cate Decker & the Foundation for Human Movement Studies

<<<>>>

A little about Catherine:

Catherine Decker, M.Ed., has completed advanced training in Spacial Dynamics® and is certified in Bothmer Gymnastics. She is on the faculty of the Resonare Orientation in Music program. Over the years, she has worked with children and adults in both regular and adaptive education. Cate has led movement classes and workshops at music conferences, on both the east and west coasts.

<<<>>>

The Budget:  

Projected Expenses of this project include the following:

  • Recruitment: Copying costs for flyers, notices in local publications, announcement fees. $150.
  • Rental fees for space(s) used for the series of workshops. $320.
  • Cate's  teaching salary 40 hours at $30/hr. $1200.
  • Publication/printing costs for final article/documentation $200.
  • Videography. $300
  • Credit Card/ Indiegogo/ FHMS Fees $450

TOTAL: $2,620*

*If additional funding is received Cate will hold additional classes.

<<<>>>

In Memoriam & with Gratitude:

When I first contemplated using Spacial Dynamics® to meet the needs of those who play musical instruments, I went to Cordula Feurerstack for her suggestions. In addition to her professional work as a movement therapist and teacher, she was also an accomplished musician.  She played viola and sang regularly with a local chorale.

Cordula was an extraordinary teacher of the work developed by Jaimen McMillan. Discussions I had with Cordula about the ways in which Spacial Dynamics® can benefit musicians served as inspiration for this project.  It is with love and deep appreciation that I honor Cordula as we explore the marvelous connections between Spacial Dynamics® and the realm of music.

<<<>>> 


Thank you for your Generous Support!

story:
In early 2017 two long time musical collaborators decided to throw a former opera singer into the front seat of a rock band...meet Claire and The Bears.

“Janis Joplin vocals meets soulful rockabilly backing to create the perfect soundtrack for born-again sinners.” - Cassandra Rose

Claire and The Bears is comprised of queers and allies who seek to challenge the heteronormativity inherent in traditional boy/girl pop songs. Some of us grew up listening to music we loved, but could never truly connect with due to the lyrical constraints of gender pronouns. And while we are definitely suckers for a belty chorus and fiery guitar solos; our true goal as songwriters is to create lyrics that anyone can identify with, regardless of their gender or orientation. When each of us is able to see a part of ourselves in a song, it helps us recognize that some joys and struggles are universal, and that's a great step towards bridging the gaps that divide us as humans.

This is why we are humbly asking all of you who have been supporting our live shows to please help us get these songs out to a wider audience, and enjoy some great perks along the way!

We can't wait to start working with John Abbey at Kingsize Soundlabs, right in our home city Chicago! Your generous funding will go towards studio rental, final mastering, digital distribution through CD Baby, copyright and publishing registration, marketing, and graphic design.

If you want to help but are unable to financially contribute at this time, please consider sharing our campaign on social media and letting folk know why our music means something to you. Getting and keeping the word out is worth its proverbial weight in gold!

Regardless of your level of support, we truly appreciate your taking the time to hear what we're about. We create and play music because we love it, and the gift that other people love it too is one do not take for granted.

Thank you!
