Upon the release of this project, I worked hard to get local performances, bars, small clubs, picnics, community fairs and the like, in order to introduce it, and begin building my niche in the jazz market.In 2006, after seeing the success of "Timeless", I went in the studio and began recording my 2008 release,  "The Shedd".  Working full time as a high school counselor, raising 2 children plus one on the way, and owning/operating a beautiful brand new recording studio, I barely had time to breathe.  I spent every waking hour working to cover the expense of what would be the album that officially launched my jazz career. "The Shedd" featured Steve Cole, Gerald Veasley, Carol Riddick, one of my bass hero's, Alex Al, Donald Robinson and a host of other amazing and notable jazz greats.  Immediately upon it's release,"The Shedd" grabbed the attention of radio DJ's,  online magazines, interviewers, club owners, etc..  Almost instantly my band went from playing community picnics, to being in the top clubs in and around Philadelphia.  In fact, we began to play so frequently, that there was not enough time to record the next project for 3 years.In 2011, I finally had the opportunity to record my 2013 release,  "Epiphany"!  To date, I have been so amazed at the response and support of this album.  "Epiphany" featured artists such as Gerald Albright, Gerald Veasley, Carol Riddick, Jamie Knight, Frank McComb, Elan Trotman and many more!  A far cry from 2005, "Epiphany" opened doors for me to begin traveling the country and the world, performing in places that I've only dreamed of!  One amazing opportunity came in September of 2013, The Capital Jazz Cruise, where I was a featured artist along side, Alex Bugnon, Gerald Veasley, Jeff Lorber, Paul Taylor, Najee, Jeanette Harris, Joey Sommerville, Jeff Bradshaw, Chrissette Michelle, Stephanie Mills, Larry Graham, Anthony Hamilton and many more.  As a result, I was also featured with Alex Bugnon in NYC at the Irridium, along side Elan Trotman.  Another highlight stemming from this release, would be my very recent European tour, in which I headlined for 3 weeks through Europe with my band, meeting wonderful people and performing in the most amazing of venues!Inspired by my musical journey so far, I am now ready to release "Mr. Guitar"!  In between travels, I spent time writing and producing one of my most personal projects to date!  This new album features some of the new, young, invigorating jazz and soul artists on the scene right now.  Elan Trotman, Jeanette Harris, Gail Jhonson, Andrew Neu, Jamie Knight and Jaguar Wright, make up my fresh and youthful 4th album.  If each album has allowed me to see more of the world, and more of my dreams come true, I can only imagine the outcome of "Mr. Guitar"! Campaign:I have always funded my own albums and releases.  I've taken on 2 jobs, borrowed money, performed to make enough to cover the process, etc.  I've been able to create great projects through hard work, but I have not been able to advertise, market or promote any of them.  This time I funded my project as usual, but I am asking for your support to package the project (IE, mastering, pictures, CD duplication/manufacturing), and to advertise/market the project, (IE, radio, publicity, publications, etc).Packaging my project is estimated at $2,000.00  After packaging, the advertising and marketing could cost anywhere from $2,000 -$3,000 per month for 3 months, depending on the team I go with, in order to do this job.  Usually a record label would cover these items.  I however, have made the decision to stay independent, because I want to have the power to release whatever music is in my head and heart, without being controlled by a third party.  Your help in this endeavor will be priceless!  I want to come perform in your cities, but I am constantly being met with the word "No" from festival owners, clubs, booking agents and promoters, because I am not known enough to be on their bill.  After much research, I finally discovered the channels to go through, in order to eradicate this problem!  I can't do it without your help.  Thank you so much for your time.  Please feel free to email me at bookdpsnow@gmail.com, for any questions or concerns!  If you are unable to contribute financially, please still send this message around.  Any help you can give to get the word out to people, would be of great help to me.  Thank you!!Sincerely,David P Stevens (Mr. Guitar)

story:
Short Summary

Hey everybody!!! Thank you very much for checking out our funding page. 

Here, at the eastside cultural center, we are getting ready for the 14th annual Malcolm X Jazz Arts Festival where we bring the diverse communities of Oakland together to celebrate the life and legacy of Malcolm X. There will be live hip hop performances, dance, graffiti battles, many tabling organizers and venders, delicious food, and if course Jazz. 

Sadly, we recently lost our dear friend Amiri Baraka, who’s work in the Black Arts Movement inspired the Eastside Cultural Center. He was a model revolutionary artist and intellectual whom we learned so much from, and his contributions to our shared struggle where invaluable. That’s why this year’s festival is going to be a tribute to Amiri Baraka and the Black Arts Movement. This Years festival will feature artist that where a part of, or heavily influenced by the Black Arts Movement.

 What We Need & What You Get

This is where we need your help. We are bringing out original Black Arts Movement artist from the east coast as well as artist inspired by the movement. We need help covering the cost of their transportation lodging and their valuable time. So please contribute what you can so we can not only keep this festival sustainable but also make this one of the best jazz festivals we have ever had.

For $100, doners will receive a gift pack that includes hip hop CD's produced by our very own Beats Flows program, vintage jazz festival t-shirts, limited edition art buttons, and other surprises. Those who donate $250 will receive all of the above as well as our Black Power Poster Trio-Pack. This includes full size posters of Malcolm X (art by Emory Douglas), Bobby Seale, and Assata Shakur.

The Impact

One of our goals every year is to expose a new generation of young people to Jazz Music.  But this year we also want to talk about the huge effect the Black Arts Movement had in transforming black culture.  We want to connect the dots between Jazz music, spoken word poetry, and hip-hop. In doing so we hope to inspire a new generation of youth to continue the legacy of Amiri Baraka and the Black Arts Movement!

story: After nearly 11 years of service, my old van is no longer in a condition for me to tour in. After pooling all my resources I am turning to the fans of my music to help me purchase a new van, this will enable me to tour more in 2014 and onward. Your support of me and my art is something I am forever thankful for.

Your support of me and my art is something I am forever thankful for.

story:
Composer, Charles Coleman to see and hear his own Violin Concerto in performance.

Hey guys!
I am a New York, born and raised, composer who has had the great fortune to have my music performed by various great ensembles and orchestras all over the world, like the above performance of my Violin Concerto, world premiered last October in Cincinnati by the dynamic Violinist, Tatiana Berman (www.tatianaberman.com) with the Constella Festival of Music.  

On July 19, 2014, Tatiana will perform this work of mine again in it's European premiere in Pärnu, Estonia with the celebrated conductor Neeme Järvi (www.neemejarvi.ee) leading the Järvi Academy Youth Symphony Orchestra at the Pärnu Music Festival (www.parnumusicfestival.ee/index.php?id=106&...).   Yep, all I can say is "Wow!!!"

But the only problem is that I can't afford to fly from New York to Estonia and see this awesome performance.  And the thought of a composer not being able to attend a major performance of his own work simply because of the lack of funds doesn't seem right.  So, at the suggestion of a friend of mine, I decided to start this campaign.  What have I got to lose?  :)


What I Need

Based on general travel costs in flying back and forth  to Northern Europe,  the average cost of a round trip varies between $1000 - $2000 USD. Therefore, my overall goal is for $1500.   The money donated here goes directly into my travel to and from Estonia. 


What do I get out of it?

Besides the obvious benefit of the composer (me) to witness this awesome performance of his major 30 minute work in Estonia, this concert which is part of the Pärnu Music Festival Järvi Academy is one of the most celebrated annual events in Northern Europe for classical music.  Some of the worlds greatest artists will be there.  Therefore it seems necessary for me to be present and meet some of these people in the hope of possible future opportunities,  commissions and jobs that may very well result because of the great performance of my concerto and my being there in person.   In life, timing is everything.

In any case, I want to thank you all in advance for reading this and your considering to donate whatever you can to make this trip happen.  I've never done anything like this before.  Not sure how it'll pan out. Nonetheless........let's go for it!!!  :)

story:
I NEED YOU!

So I'm calling upon "TripleF's" everywhere - Family, Friends and Fans - to help me create my new CD, short film and to get back on the road (worldwide that is)!

As an independent artist it's always a tough decision on how to finance your next project. Since there's no major backing, which in return you lose creative control, then I must ask YOU to please partner with me. $25 (€18/£15) is what I'm asking from YOU to take part in this project.

As many of you know, Berlin inspired me to start writing and performing again and the creativity in this city is crazyyyyy... This new project will consists of songs I've written since I've been here. So I would love for you to partner with me and help me push my message of LOVE, through entertainment, out to the world.

So I'm asking YOU to please partner with me by donating $25 (€18/£15) to this project to get it up and running. Throughout the duration of this campaign I will be posting snippets of the songs so you can hear what's to come. Remember to please share and ask your "TripleF's" to join in. Request me on your local radio stations, festivals and local TV shows.... Let's reach the world together with a message of LOVE!

love's in need of love today ~ stevie wonder

Thanks for the support,

Shon


Visit:

www.shonabram.com

Fb: shonabramentertainment

youtube: shonabram

Instagram/Twitter: shonabram

#shonabram

story:
Thanks for coming by and checking out the NORTHEART Indiegogo page. This project is something we've been working towards for a long time. Dreams of this EP have been around for a few years now, and last year I was able to record the single, Keep Me Alive, with the guys from The Digital Age in Waco,Texas. What a great experience that was! But now is the time for finishing this EP and getting it into your hands!

This Year we've been working with talented producer Dryw Owens (From Indian Lakes, Hearts Like Lions etc). With your help we will be able to pay for the songs, get them liscensed, and finally distrubuted to you. We can not do this without your help. Take a look through the perks, pick one you want, then share with someone you know who would like NORTHEART's music! You'll find links to all social media sites to keep you updated on how the funding is going. Please also head over to my YouTube where you can watch my newly released single, Keep Me Alive! If you like this, and want more of it, click that contribute button, and we'll be on our way!

Our goal is to put out the best EP possible! We would love to have you be a part of it!

story:
Our Story

A DEUX is the musical and personal marriage of Claude Pineault and Eden Atwood. Claude and Eden “met” through shared musical friends on Facebook and began corresponding and soon after collaborating musically. Claude is a well-known singer/songwriter/producer from Montreal with several number one hits to his credit. Eden is best known for her work as a jazz singer. She has 12 full length CDs to her credit and has been heralded as “one of the most undersung heroes in modern jazz history.”

 

Claude and Eden immediately felt kinship with one another musically. Their musical partnership began with finding material that the native English speaking jazz singer and the native French speaking songwriter had in common…what else? The Beatles.

 

Claude and Eden took such songs as I Will and Help and began creating what would become their signature sound…a spare, acoustic duo merging smart pop and jazz sensibilities into soulful duets.

 

Claude and Eden soon fell in love and married in February 2010. Claude moved to Montana the following summer to open Pinewood Studios with his new wife. Since that move, Claude has produced a number one album for Hugo Lapointe out of Pinewood Studios with his partner in Montreal, Jeff Grenier. Eden has been travelling to Japan and has produced two jazz records for a Japanese label.

 

Currently, Claude and Eden are working on their first full length CD, eponymously titled, A DEUX. A DEUX will feature several new original songs from Claude and Eden as well as new acoustic versions of some of Claude’s hits including MON ANGE and JE PENSE ENCORE A TOI. The new CD will also feature the two newly arranged Beatles’ songs I WILL and HELP that provided the score for their musical and personal partnership.  The result is a unique and soulful new duo whose sole goal is to share their music and happiness with whomever wants to listen. 


The Impact

The biggest issue facing full time professional musicians is sustainability. Add raising kids to the mix and it can get downright dicey! That is why Indie Go Go is so brilliant. YOU...the folks we make music for...can help us continue to be creatively productive without the need of a record label or publicity team as well as providing us with a sustainable way to raise our family and stay local most of the time. 


What We Need & What You Get

We have a studio in our converted garage that has already produced a number 1 record in Quebec. We have already laid down the basic tracks for most of our recording. But we need money for graphics/reproduction/distribution. We estimate that we need right around $8,000.00 to finish our project and get it on the shelves and onto online distribution. If we don't reach our entire goal we will get as far as we can with the funds raised and then continue to squirrel away what we can over time to finish the project. Our funders will get digital downloads of the music we have finished and, of course, hard copies when we finish the project. 


If you donate $20.00: You get a signed finished CD!


If you donate $50.00: You get everything above AND a signed poster!


If you donate $100.00: You get everything above AND a thank you in the liner notes!


If you donate $200.00: You get everything above AND a Tshirt!


If you donate $500.00: You get everything above AND any song of your choice specially arranged and recorded by us and sent to you as a digital download!


If you donate $1000.00: You get everything above AND a private 60 minute concert in your home (if you live within 200 miles of Missoula,MT or if farther way, on SKYPE!


If you donate $1500.00: You get everything above AND your name listed as EXECUTIVE PRODUCER on our CD!


Other Ways You Can Help

We need your help to let people know about our project! We would be eternally grateful for your help spreading the word through Indie GoGo's share tools. You can let people know about us on your Facebook and Twitter accounts and through your own email lists. Or you can write down the URL to this page on the palm of anyone's hand! Any help is appreciated!!!

story:
Gamelan Dharma Swara: Inspiring Wonder

Gamelan Dharma Swara filled the floor of Basilica Hudson . . . their ornate golden forms producing tones just as gilded, the whole sound a complete wonder.  -Audiofemme

Gamelan Dharma Swara is Gotham’s hometown Balinese gamelan ensemble. Our ensemble has earned critical acclaim from national and international press and has established a reputation as one of the leading gamelan groups in North America.

“Gamelan” refers to the large traditional percussion orchestras found throughout Indonesia, including Bali, where a multitude of groups perform everything from centuries-old court music and dance to explosive early 20th-century forms and contemporary experimental works.

For 20 years, Dharma Swara has been a gateway to the Balinese performing arts. We want to inspire wonder with exhilarating experiential performances and to cultivate a community of learning, creativity, collaboration, and dialogue among artists and audiences.

Dharma Swara has always relied on the generosity of host institutions for instruments and rehearsal space. The current arrangement at Queens College, however, carries logistical challenges that prevent the group from continued artistic growth. Scheduling restrictions and a multi-legged commute limit our rehearsal time and limit our development.

We can’t continue to grow without having our own instruments, so . . .
we’re getting a gamelan!

Fundraising efforts to finance the gamelan have been fruitful so far:

  • Total cost of instruments, sea freight to NYC, customs fees: $27,000

  • Contributions from every DS member + a match from the org.: $8,646

  • Major gift from private donor: $10,000

  • $18,646 raised so far

  • $8,354 to go

Will you help to put the “gamelan” in Gamelan Dharma Swara by making a contribution today?

Grab one of our fabulous perks over there on the right side of this page. Please note: if you choose to give a custom amount, we’ll contact you to get your details and provide you with the perks of the contribution level nearest to your gift.

Your contribution will make it possible for Dharma Swara to thrive: to freely rehearse, hold public workshops, collaborate with other artists, take on ambitious projects, and perform more often. You’ll also enable the enrichment of our repertoire because we’ll be acquiring instruments -- gender rambat and penyacah -- that the Queens College set doesn’t have and that certain repertoire requires.

As you read this, the instruments are being made by the pande (gamelan-smith clan) in Bali. They’ll be completed and shipped in late-summer. With your support, we’ll be starting the 2016-17 season with our own beautiful gamelan!

Highlights

  • Bali Tour 2010: Dharma Swara was the first non-Balinese ensemble ever invited to perform in the prestigious gong kebyar competition at the annual Bali Arts Festivals in 2010. Our performance was called “awesome” and “astonishing” by the Bali Post.

  • Basilica Soundscape 2014: We had a blast playing for the responsive audience at this Hudson, NY, music festival! Wondering Sound said we “unleashed a cleansing, battering, multicolored hail of sound. . . . ringing, resonant, multi-layered and hypnotic;" The New York Times said we were “one of the most talked-about performances all weekend;” and The New Yorker said we “got perhaps the weekend’s most rapturous response.” (video here)

  • Geregel Premiere (NYC) 2014: Dharma Swara was the first non-Balinese group to perform Dewa Ketut Alit’s Geregel, a progressive and important composition for semara dana that made waves in Bali in 2000.

  • Le Poisson Rouge (NYC) 2015:  It was a packed, standing-room only, sold-out show! The New York Times called us "an ambitious and powerful ensemble." (video here)

  • The Stone and The Met Museum (NYC) 2015: December was a month of contrasts from playing in The Met Museum’s charming Astor Court with a crowd gathered around us to a full house at the intimate East Village venue for experimental music The Stone, performing with Matthew Welch during his residency.

Looking Ahead

Once equipped with the new gamelan and relocated, Dharma Swara will recommence with rehearsals, and:

  • We'll continue to host Balinese artists to refine our technique and artistry.
  • We'll engage experimental collaborations with artists from music, dance, theater, puppetry, and other arts fields.
  • We want to initiate the classic friendly and spirited battle-of-the-bands type competition we took part in at the Bali Arts Festival in 2010. Imagine NYC's Gamelan Dharma Swara facing off with Boston's Gamelan Galak Tika? Or Dharma Swara vs. [name of your favorite group here]?
  • And of course we'll be performing in and around NYC in the months and years to come.

More about Gamelan Dharma Swara

Gamelan Dharma Swara (DS) is an ambitious, artist-led 501(c)3 organization based in New York City. Dedicated to performing traditional Balinese gamelan music/dance and new works by leading Balinese and non-Balinese composers, DS has earned critical acclaim from national and international press and has established a reputation as one of the leading gamelan groups in North America.

DS has collaborated with Momenta Quartet, the NOW Ensemble, and with some of Bali’s leading artists, including Dewa Ketut Alit, Gusti Sudarta, Made Sidia, I Gusti Nyoman Darta, and I Made Bandem. The ensemble has performed in top New York venues, including Basilica Hudson, Lincoln Center, The Asia Society, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, MoMA, The New Museum, Symphony Space, LaMama, The Stone, Japan Society, Roulette, Joe’s Pub, and Le Poisson Rouge.  DS has also performed at Princeton, Bucknell, Rider, New York, New Jersey City and Yale Universities, and the University of Richmond.

The ensemble has commissioned works from Balinese and North American composers, including Dewa Ketut Alit, Gusti Sudarta, Vivian Fung, Matthew Welch, Joel Mellin, Richard Marriott, and Andrew McGraw. DS has won grants from the National Endowment for the Arts, the Lower Manhattan Cultural Council, the Mid-Atlantic Arts Fund, and the Asian American Arts Alliance, among others.

The group has won grants from the National Endowment for the Arts, the Lower Manhattan Cultural Council, the Mid-Atlantic Arts Fund, and the Asian American Arts Alliance, among others.

www.dharmaswara.org

Video by Raphe Evanoff and Jared Hohl
story_txt:
Gamelan Dharma Swara: Inspiring WonderGamelan Dharma Swara filled the floor of Basilica Hudson . . . their ornate golden forms producing tones just as gilded, the whole sound a complete wonder.  -Audiofemme
Gamelan Dharma Swara is Gotham’s hometown Balinese gamelan ensemble. Our ensemble has earned critical acclaim from national and international press and has established a reputation as one of the leading gamelan groups in North America.“Gamelan” refers to the large traditional percussion orchestras found throughout Indonesia, including Bali, where a multitude of groups perform everything from centuries-old court music and dance to explosive early 20th-century forms and contemporary experimental works.For 20 years, Dharma Swara has been a gateway to the Balinese performing arts. We want to inspire wonder with exhilarating experiential performances and to cultivate a community of learning, creativity, collaboration, and dialogue among artists and audiences.Dharma Swara has always relied on the generosity of host institutions for instruments and rehearsal space. The current arrangement at Queens College, however, carries logistical challenges that prevent the group from continued artistic growth. Scheduling restrictions and a multi-legged commute limit our rehearsal time and limit our development.We can’t continue to grow without having our own instruments, so . . .we’re getting a gamelan!Fundraising efforts to finance the gamelan have been fruitful so far:
Total cost of instruments, sea freight to NYC, customs fees: $27,000
Contributions from every DS member + a match from the org.: $8,646
Major gift from private donor: $10,000
$18,646 raised so far
$8,354 to go
Will you help to put the “gamelan” in Gamelan Dharma Swara by making a contribution today?Grab one of our fabulous perks over there on the right side of this page. Please note: if you choose to give a custom amount, we’ll contact you to get your details and provide you with the perks of the contribution level nearest to your gift. Your contribution will make it possible for Dharma Swara to thrive: to freely rehearse, hold public workshops, collaborate with other artists, take on ambitious projects, and perform more often. You’ll also enable the enrichment of our repertoire because we’ll be acquiring instruments -- gender rambat and penyacah -- that the Queens College set doesn’t have and that certain repertoire requires.As you read this, the instruments are being made by the pande (gamelan-smith clan) in Bali. They’ll be completed and shipped in late-summer. With your support, we’ll be starting the 2016-17 season with our own beautiful gamelan!
Highlights

Bali Tour 2010: Dharma Swara was the first non-Balinese ensemble ever invited to perform in the prestigious gong kebyar competition at the annual Bali Arts Festivals in 2010. Our performance was called “awesome” and “astonishing” by the Bali Post.


Basilica Soundscape 2014: We had a blast playing for the responsive audience at this Hudson, NY, music festival! Wondering Sound said we “unleashed a cleansing, battering, multicolored 
hail of sound. . . . ringing, resonant, multi-layered and hypnotic;" The New York Times said we were “one of the most talked-about performances all weekend;” and The New Yorker said we “got perhaps the weekend’s most rapturous response.” (video here)

Geregel Premiere (NYC) 2014: Dharma Swara was the first non-Balinese group to perform Dewa Ketut Alit’s Geregel, a progressive and important composition for semara dana that made waves in Bali in 2000.
Le Poisson Rouge (NYC) 2015:  It was a packed, standing-room only, sold-out show! The New York Times called us "an ambitious and powerful ensemble." (video here)
The Stone and The Met Museum (NYC) 2015: December was a month of contrasts from playing in The Met Museum’s charming Astor Court with a crowd gathered around us to a full house at the intimate East Village venue for experimental music The Stone, performing with Matthew Welch during his residency.
Looking AheadOnce equipped with the new gamelan and relocated, Dharma Swara will recommence with rehearsals, and:
We'll continue to host Balinese artists to refine our technique and artistry.
We'll engage experimental collaborations with artists from music, dance, theater, puppetry, and other arts fields.
We want to initiate the classic friendly and spirited battle-of-the-bands type competition we took part in at the Bali Arts Festival in 2010. Imagine NYC's Gamelan Dharma Swara facing off with Boston's Gamelan Galak Tika? Or Dharma Swara vs. [name of your favorite group here]?
And of course we'll be performing in and around NYC in the months and years to come.


More about Gamelan Dharma SwaraGamelan Dharma Swara (DS) is an ambitious, artist-led 501(c)3 organization based in New York City. Dedicated to performing traditional Balinese gamelan music/dance and new works by leading Balinese and non-Balinese composers, DS has earned critical acclaim from national and international press and has established a reputation as one of the leading gamelan groups in North America.DS has collaborated with Momenta Quartet, the NOW Ensemble, and with some of Bali’s leading artists, including Dewa Ketut Alit, Gusti Sudarta, Made Sidia, I Gusti Nyoman Darta, and I Made Bandem. The ensemble has performed in top New York venues, including Basilica Hudson, Lincoln Center, The Asia Society, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, MoMA, The New Museum, Symphony Space, LaMama, The Stone, Japan Society, Roulette, Joe’s Pub, and Le Poisson Rouge.  DS has also performed at Princeton, Bucknell, Rider, New York, New Jersey City and Yale Universities, and the University of Richmond.The ensemble has commissioned works from Balinese and North American composers, including Dewa Ketut Alit, Gusti Sudarta, Vivian Fung, Matthew Welch, Joel Mellin, Richard Marriott, and Andrew McGraw. DS has won grants from the National Endowment for the Arts, the Lower Manhattan Cultural Council, the Mid-Atlantic Arts Fund, and the Asian American Arts Alliance, among others.The group has won grants from the National Endowment for the Arts, the Lower Manhattan Cultural Council, the Mid-Atlantic Arts Fund, and the Asian American Arts Alliance, among others.
www.dharmaswara.org
Video by Raphe Evanoff and Jared Hohl

story:
Our Story

We are a new entertainment company based out of Portland, Oregon.  Called Octopus, we have eight arms in the music community and are doing everything we can to provide Pacific Northwest musicians with the tools they need to succeed. We provide booking and management services, PR and marketing, graphic and web design, CD duplication, photography, music videos, and more! We started just this year and are already growing by leaps and bounds.  With a killer roster already and more bands joining in, great things are going to come from us in 2011. 


We are Octopus Entertainment - eight arms in music.  


www.octopus-entertainment.com


The current Octopus booking/management roster includes:

The Dimes

Hello Morning

Water & Bodies

Jonah

Norman

Chris Robley & The Fear of Heights

NIAYH

The Shivas

SexyWaterSpiders

The Angry Orts

No Kind of Rider

Buoy LaRue

John Craig

Joshua English

Worth

Kelly Anne Masigat

dKOTA

A Leaf 

Midlman

Nicole Berke


The Impact

Our impact will be huge. As we succeed, so will our bands. We want nothing more than to see all of the bands on our roster join the national ranks and prove to the rest of the U.S. that the Pacific Northwest truly is a musical mecca. Los Angeles and New York will be shaking in their boots soon enough! With the amount of talent we have here in the Pacific Northwest, all these musicians need is a little help - that's where we come in. With your assistance, we can build our company to be even stronger for these bands, we can help them gain exposure, help them get posters and CD's made, and even help them get on the road and tour the states. 


What We Need & What You Get

Our goal here is two-fold. First, we want to put out our first album. Second, we want to put our bands on the road. 


We currently need to raise funds in order to start the record label portion of the company and put out one record in 2011 for a band on the roster. With the amazing roster that we have, this is very exciting, and we hope to expand the label and help more local bands get on the map!


ALSO! We want to put our bands on the road  - How are we going to do this, you ask? You give us money, and we buy a van, bus or trailer. This way, our wonderful Portland bands can get down to Austin in something other than a Kia or Geo that breaks down halfway there. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give us dollars, join our mailing list, come see a show, or visit our bands' websites and support them there! You can join the Octopus mailing list at www.octopus-entertainment.com.


Also PLEASE tell others about what we are doing and how they can help - send them here to donate!

story:
European Tour 2017

We are QUEL BORDEL! - an energetic five-piece world punk band based out of San Diego. We need the help of our friends, fans, and supporters so that we may tour Europe this summer!!

We can only do this with your support!!

QUEL BORDEL! at the Winter NAMM Show 2017, photo by @handonam

Our (Musical) Foreign Exchange Program

In the summer of 2014, we hosted our friends of folk pop band BandàpArt (France) in the United States, and in 2015, we toured France with them (thanks to generous financial contributions from people like you!!)

It was an AMAZING time with them in France, full of long days and nights traveling from show to show, the creation of weird inside jokes, and some of the best live show experiences we've ever had as a band.

Again last year, BandàpArt returned to the United States, and so now it's our turn, in our fun foreign band exchange program of sorts, to head back overseas - this time to bring our music to several European countries!!

QUEL BORDEL! & BandàpArt at Crestone Music Festival 2016

What We Need

So far, we have dates booked in Spain on the Mediterranean coast, the 2-day festival BandàpArt produces (similar to our SD GypsyFest), at least one date in Germany, and then back to France for an amazing festival as the grand finale!! (And we are working on more!!)

International travel is expensive and touring in a five-piece band can be pretty costly. The estimated cost of five international flights (and taking into consideration the 5% IndieGoGo fee), we will need to raise $10,000 by May 15. If we aren't able to raise at least 90% of that, we're in jeopardy of not being able to go. If we are fortunate enough that contributions exceed this goal, any additional money will go toward a per diem, other travel costs, promotional materials, and any unforeseen costs that arise when on tour.

QUEL BORDEL! at Festibaloche (festival in France), 2015

For Our Backers

We are offering some pretty cool rewards this time around, most of them being limited-edition, personalized items or exclusive experiences.

Beyond the physical or experience rewards, we hope, as a backer, that you also feel the reward of contributing to QUEL BORDEL! - in helping us deepen our musical and cultural roots, gain inspiration by sharing and creating music in new countries, and strengthen our valued friendship with BandàpArt, which goes beyond any language barrier. It would also mean a lot that you'd be providing us with an experience above and beyond what we ever thought was possible when QUEL BORDEL! was formed.

We hope to be able to give back to you through these rewards, but also by sharing our experience with you along the way and in our future performances.

QUEL BORDEL! at Get Shamrocked Pre-Party, 2017, photo by @handonam

Risks & Challenges

In the last four years, QUEL BORDEL! has put out three musical releases, obtained many great endorsements, established residencies, created unique merchandise and videos, and gone on many local, regional, and international tours - so you can say we are well aware of the risks and challenges that come with making big things happen!!

We understand that it takes a lot of hard work and consistent dedication to see any project through. From creating a plan, managing our time, creating excitement and working together, and following up with all the little details, we have proven that we can meet the challenges laid out before us.

A lot will go into our European tour, but we are prepared, ready, and excited for this new adventure.

Every contribution is truly appreciated!! Thanks in advance for being a part of this journey with us, no matter the level of your personal contribution!!

QUEL BORDEL! on the set of a live video for Deering Banjos, 2016

Other Ways You Can Help

We would appreciate any additional help in:

  • encouraging others to check out this campaign
  • using the IndieGoGo "share" tools to help us share our campaign on your social media
  • telling your international friends in cities that we're playing to check out a show

Please check out our progress on the Updates page of this campaign and on our social media:

  • www.facebook.com/quelbordelsd
  • IG: @quelbordel
  • www.quel-bordel.com

 

THANKS IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!

story:
Welcome friends and family!

I’m Colleen Solomon and I write song lyrics and produce music about women in the Book of Mormon. Their voices are generally silent and I want to tell their remarkable untold stories and give them a voice through my music. There is a groundswell movement happening in the creative arts to restore their voices, find their influence and celebrate their immeasurable contribution.

I Need Your Help.

My first goal is to create a 6 song CD. I have 3 songs produced and now need your financial help producing the next 3. Each song costs roughly $3000 CDN to produce. My Go Fund Me goal is $9000. Any contribution you make will go directly into the project.

story:
The Go Set has been releasing records and sleeping on floors all over the world for more than 12 years now. We've been around Australia and Europe more times than we can remember, and until now every tour, every album, and every clip we've ever made has been entirely self-funded. I mean, literally every record or T shirt sold at our gigs has gone towards putting fuel in the van. As many of you know, for a small independent band this has been a long struggle. In 2015 we took a big leap of faith and decided to have a serious attempt at getting our music out in the USA. A gamble which has happened to open some HUGE doors for us - finally!!

So now, for the first time in the band's existence we are right on the edge of some huge exciting developments - record deals, publishing, management contracts, and large scale radio and media exposure. Who knows where it will lead - but these are some opportunities that we've never had before.

The challenge for us now is just to get there - transporting 5 people to and around the USA with gear, as well as Visa costs and everything else is more than we can possibly afford. Which is why we have, somewhat reluctantly, decided to create a campaign that might generate some support and funding. We're not looking for something for nothing - but we are hoping to sell some Merchandise & Tour packages, VIP Memberships, and Sponsorships. We need to raise the money for flights within the next 30 days.

Whether it's a tiny amount, or a large amount, every bit is greatly appreciated, and we hope that we can return the favour in any capacity possible. Below are some templates, but feel free to let us know if you have your own ideas that we can help with....here's some PACKAGE OPTIONS (in USD):

MERCHANDISE

Poster: Tour poster signed by the band $8

CD/DVD or Vinyl signed by the band $20

Starter Pack: Album and T shirt $34

The Tour Pro: 2 x Tour T shirts, plus 2 x show tickets (valid in USA, AUS or UK) $50

VIP MEMBERSHIP PACKAGES - see the link below. These are a range of personalized ideas, from catered and full access show tickets to house concerts and backyard BBQs. These can be shared between a group too.

Bronze: $89

Silver: $219

Gold: $369 (yes, this is the one where we cook a BBQ and play at your house)

Lifetime Gold :$559

SPONSORSHIP PACKAGES

Minor Sponsor - we will promote your business through our social media channels (120K audience - FB, Insta, and Twitter) $100+

Mid-Level Sponsor - social media feeds, plus banner ads on our website and all tour posters and online ads will carry your logo $200+

Major Sponsor - complete social media, website, print and poster space, and logo included on either the stage backdrop and/or tour merchandise $400+

story:
You know when you watch the voice or some other talent show and the contestant always spills some kind of sad story in order to draw you in? I fucking hate that shit, but I need to tell you where I've been in order for this campaign to make sense. 

I found music for real in 2013. That's also when I found the world of drugs. I became consumed in it, yet it didn't take its tows on me as much as my best friend. She fell into a psychosis and later diagnosed as schizophrenic. I left home because of it. I was the one who introduced her to drugs. In my mind I should have been the one locked away in a hospital, so the punishment began. 

I spent most of 2014 traveling. It was a necessary journey, but also a painful one. After all, I left to escape from what happened at home. The good thing was that I got to play a lot of concerts and make my first album. I began to understand how much music meant to me.

The bad thing was that I was a ticking bomb waiting to explode. It took me to some dark places. I made some very poor decisions. I was raped at a music festival that I played at that year. A couple of months later I was mugged and molested in Los Angeles. The latter was actually the worse of the two because I thought that he was going to kill me, I really did. I was lucky to get away that night, but I did see my life flash by and I realized that I was going to die young if I kept on living that way. When you're faced with the probability of actually dying young you realize that it's not so glamorous, even if your idols did. 

I returned home and poured everything I had into work. In October 2015 I met the wall for real. All the things that I didn't mourn over before came crashing down. I remembered everything, even the bits and pieces that I'd forgotten.

I couldn't play my guitar anymore. I couldn't sing. I canceled shows.

Last year I had three options. 1) Disappearing , 2) Admitting myself to a mental hospital (which seemed like the most prominent option at the time) or 3) Take some time off to mourn.

I never took time off before because I've always been so damned ambitious, but I did.

I cried a lot. I spent a lot of time alone. I stared out the window. In the end I started writing music again. I started walking home in the dark again. I started performing again and for the first time in three years I was alive. 

Now I'm traveling indefinitely with my music. I'm in La Paz right now while writing this. My best friend is a sleep next to me. We're not traveling because we're escaping life. This time I'm traveling because I want to.

The last month has been a thrilling experience and I am forever grateful to still have my sanity and my common sense.

I will travel for a while, but I also want to make a new EP with the songs that have come out of my soul's coma. I have written a lot and in October I will meet with a producer and some incredible musicians in South of Spain to make sense of these songs. 

I ask for your help to make this happen. 

It would certainly mean the world to me.

I remembered everything, even the bits and pieces that I'd forgotten.I couldn't play my guitar anymore. I couldn't sing. I canceled shows.Last year I had three options. 1) Disappearing , 2) Admitting myself to a mental hospital (which seemed like the most prominent option at the time) or 3) Take some time off to mourn.I never took time off before because I've always been so damned ambitious, but I did.I cried a lot. I spent a lot of time alone. I stared out the window. In the end I started writing music again. I started walking home in the dark again. I started performing again and for the first time in three years I was alive. Now I'm traveling indefinitely with my music. I'm in La Paz right now while writing this. My best friend is a sleep next to me. We're not traveling because we're escaping life. This time I'm traveling because I want to.The last month has been a thrilling experience and I am forever grateful to still have my sanity and my common sense.I will travel for a while, but I also want to make a new EP with the songs that have come out of my soul's coma. I have written a lot and in October I will meet with a producer and some incredible musicians in South of Spain to make sense of these songs. I ask for your help to make this happen. It would certainly mean the world to me.

story:
Hannah needs $700 to register the copyrights for her 14 song album, as well as pay the distribution fees to make the album available on Apple Music, Google Play Music, Spotify, Amazon Prime Music, and others. Typically to track, mix, master, register copyrights, distribute, and market a full length album, it can cost anywhere from $3,000+ (and that is on the cheap side). Hannah wants to be able to do all of this for just $700 so that your friends, family, and people all around the world can listen for free and hopefully encounter Jesus.

 

Hannah does not make music to make money. She makes music to minister first to the Lord, and second to people. Help her reach others, even if it changes just one persons life. In the past Hannah has received emails from strangers thanking her for the free songs that helped shape their identity in Christ, break off a suicidal spirit, and encounter the living God. It is worth the cost of time and money if it means reaching just one person. Let's make this possible together!

story:
My name is Natalie and I'm an opera singer.

This summer, I have been given the incredible opportunity to study the art of classical singing in Payerbach, Austria. 

But to make this happen, I need your help.

 

I need to raise $5,000 to be able to attend. This money will help cover the cost of tuition as well as housing and travel expenses.  

Any amount helps, and I am incredibly grateful for any show of support.

 

This is a once in a lifetime opportunity.

Only a dozen young singers from across the country were chosen to participate in this highly selective program. After having completed my Masters Degree in music, this is the next step toward achieving my dream of having a serious opera career. This program will give me the opportuninty to work one-on-one with world-renowned voice and acting teachers, music coaches and conductors. It will also provide me with incredible performce opportunities in Europe. This kind of program is invaluable for a young singer's performance experience and resume, and having participated will help me secure singing positions in the future, ensuring the advancement of my career.

 

Come to my Masters Recital and Benefit Concert!!!

 

I will be presenting a program of art songs, chamber works and operatic arias at 8pm on June 29th, 2012 at The Parish of Calvary St. George's, a beautiful historic church located at 277 Park Avenue South

Whether you donate or not, I would absolutely love for you to attend my Masters Recital. A singer isn't worth very much without an audience, so please come and bring your friends.  In fact, feel free to invite everyone you know! 

 

Please spread the word.

If you have friends who love the arts, invite them to support an emerging young artist. If your friends have nothing better to do on a friday night (and what's better than spending your evening listening to wonderful music?), invite them to the concert. Email this link to your family members, put it on your facebook wall, tweet it to all and sundry. If everyone who comes to my concert brings one friend, my audience doubles.  And if every friend you bring to the concert donates even $10 or $15, I may just raise enough money to pay for this program after all. 

 

All of your support goes towards helping me create magic.

As a young girl, my grandmother would take me to the Metropolitan Opera, where the soaring voices swept me along with them to exotic places and fairy-tale lands. Hansel and Gretel came to life, Cinderella found her prince, and happily-ever-afters were accompanied by beautiful music. The people onstage had the ability to transport their audience to a different time and place using nothing more than a few well-placed, expressive notes. The things an opera singer could relate through song seemed incredible and the stories they acted out, combined with lavish costumes and larger-than-life sets made opera-going a magical experience. 

I have learned quite a bit since those early forays into the world of opera, and I now know the incredible amount of work that goes into creating operatic magic. What seems completely effortless onstage is actually the product of years of vocal training, language study, research, memorization, interpretation and collaboration.  

And this program is my opportunity to become a part of it all. In Austria, I will get the training and experience I need to start creating my own pieces of opera magic. And I thank you for being a part of that.

 

 

 

Thank you so much for your time and support,

 I look forward to seeing you on June 29th!

story:
Be a part of Inner Missing

Hello! We are Inner Missing, a duo from St. Petersburg, Russia. Our music is characterised by such terms as gothic/doom metal, dark metal, operatic metal, avant-garde metal and so on - we prefer to say that it is intelligent metal with operatic baritone vocals (Sounds incongruous? Check our latest album on our official bandcamp page: https://innermissing.bandcamp.com). We never stopped experimenting with composition, sound and different types of vocals - as a result we have recorded 5 absolutely different albums by now and we are not going to stop!

Almost 2 years passed since The Sentinel And The Murderer was released. During this time we participated in such great international festivals as Metal Blast Festival (Egypt), Noise Metal Fest (Mongolia) and Rock'N'Iasi festival (Romania), created 4 official videos 

and composed a lot of new songs - the best 7 of them will become our new, still nameless, album and we strongly believe that this album will be head and shoulders above everything that we created before!

What We Need & What You Get

Recording a  metal album is not an easy task now - especially for a duo. With every new album we sharpened our skills as composers and musicians - and we believe that the profoundness of music and sound quality also improved  - we do not want any of these characteristics to deteriorate but it depends not only on us but on professionalism of session musicians and, most of all, sound engineer - and professionals have to cost much. So 4 000 EUR is the minimal sum of money we need to record the new album. This is the money to pay for studio time, session musicians, sound engineer and artwork.

In return we offer you the best perks we could think of, which include the digital and physical versions of the album, various merch , some cool pastimes like joining us in Saint Petersburg, and so on.

Note: EVERY PERK INCLUDES SHIPPING TO ANY COUNTRY!

Budget

It’s always cool to know where exactly your money goes. So here it comes:

Studio time (90 hours) – 800 USD

Session musicians fees (bass, violin, drums) - 500 USD

Sound engineer’s fees (mixing, mastering) – 2500 USD

Artwork  - 200 USD

Total – 4 000 USD

What Happens if We Raise Less?

If we raise less than 4 000 EUR, the album will be made anyway and we will fulfill all our obligations to those who back us up. But of course it will take longer since we will have to do non-musical jobs to earn some of the money ourselves and borrow the rest of it. 

What Happens if We Raise More?

If we manage to raise more than 4 000 USD, we will add new perks for you! Also there will be possible some stretch goals like a video clip, for example.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute there is a lot other ways you can help us out!

Tell your friends about Inner MIssing and this campaign. Get them excited!

Share the campaign on your social media profiles: Facebook, Twitter, Google +, YouTube and others!

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Hello!

My name is Colton "Elwood" I am so so excited to be launching this campaign to help raise money for my first solo album! I really feel that this album and these songs represent a new era in my life and cannot wait to get these songs out to you! "The Unraveling", which is the song in the video will be on this very album!

I will have the honor of recording this album in Wallowa County, OR with Mr. Bob Web and have the first weekend of recording booked at the beginning of march. I also have a list of fabulous guest artists that will be gracing this album with there musicianship... .here are a few:

Lauren Bihr

Ashley O'toole

Brent Smith

Hope Medford

Jay Colton Hughes

Seth Kinzie

and more to come!

Here is a rough breakdown of how the funds will be spent:

$1000- Studio musicians

$1500- CD printing and Duplication

$2000- Studio Time

$500- Mastering

I'm projecting to have this album released by June 2015 if this project fundraiser goes through!

Thank you for all and any support!

Love & Blessings

Colton Elwood

story:
Who we are:

Die Sektor has been around in one form or another for around 10 years now, and over the last few years has been touring the US quite extensively...but now we're about to set off on our most ambitious tour yet.

Over the course of 2 whole months from the start of October 2015 through to the end of November 2015 we will be playing nearly every night in a different city - first as special guests of God Module and after that with Ego Likeness.

We love to play, live to play, of course - but a tour on this epic a scale will be not only physically and mentally strenuous but financially challenging. While of course we will have the opportunity to recover some of the costs involved by selling merch at concerts as we go along, we have first of all to design and manufacture all that merchandise - and then to actually physically get from show to show and pay for somewhere to stay each night we'll be on the road for. All of that has to be paid for in advance - and when we sat down and added it all up, its quite a frightening sum: at minimum around $4,000, to be precise.

So that's where we hope that you - our fans not only in the US but around the world - can help us...and in return we have assembled an array of personal items, services and of course new and exclusive Die Sektor product to offer you in exchange for your support.

No matter where in the world you might be, via this international campaign YOU can help make our US tour the best it can be - and you can get a whole range of amazing rewards for yourself at the same time!


How you can help us, and what you can get in return:

To break it down for you, our campaign total of $6,000 is made up of

  • October dates with God Module: $2,000 transport and accommodation
  • November dates with Ego Likeness: $1,500 transport and accommodation
  • Printing/manufacturing costs of this campaign merch: $2,500

We've got a whole load of exciting and exclusive funding options for you to look through, ranging from a colossal 4CD retrospective special edition of last 3 albums ("The Void Trilogy") to some one-of-a-kind stage props we've used on the road over the years that we'd love to find a new home for.

You picking up any one of the perks we have on offer - as well as in most cases getting you something special and severely limited (if not unique!) - really helps us out.

And remember - Indiegogo is NOT "like Kickstarter" in this respect: you can pay for as many of these different things as you like, and then you can come back later to fund us again...and again...and again! As often and as much as you want! And we will be adding more things to this list as the weeks go by...so be sure to stay tuned!

Let's take a look at what's currently on offer:

"This Broken Shield" lathecut 10"vinyl record: $25 + shipping

Limited edition of x20 hand-numbered copies of new single "This Broken Shield" on black lathecut 10" vinyl, b/w another brand new Die Sektor track "This Shattered Sword". Around 14 minutes of vinyl goodness, each copy lovingly cut by hand in real-time...

"These Broken Shields" CDEP: $10 + shipping

Massive 36 minute 6-track EP featuring 2 new Die Sektor tracks "This Broken Shield" and "This Shattered Sword" plus a further 4 remixes from Chainreactor, Seraphim System, Wychdoktor and the enigmatic Faults - ranging from the slamming through the groovy to the downright creepy! Comes in a card wallet. Limited Edition of 200 copies!

"Die T-Shirt": $20 + shipping

It's that beautiful "The Void Trilogy" design by Nikos Markogiannakis, lovingly printed in FULL COLOR process on black Gildan 5000 shirts. Available in S, M, L, XL and 2XL - and yes, on "girlie" shirts too. We've printed up an initial quantity to take on tour - but are only taking limited numbers of some sizings. So even if coming to one of the shows, the best way to get your hands on one of these in the size you want is to order it here - and if not able to come or living in the "Rest Of The World" then this is the ONLY place you'll be able to find this shirt!

To Be Fed Upon Again 2CD: $20 + shipping

The legendary debut album with which Die Sektor announced their arrival in 2006 is finally available again – this time with previously unreleased bonus tracks from the same period. AND with the initial re-pressing, an entire second CD of almost entirely previously unreleased material!

Scheduled for a general release in jewelcase this December, an initial first edition of this 2CD Limited Edition is available NOW AND EXCLUSIVELY through this crowdfunding campaign - in double-digifile packaging EXCLUSIVE to this “fan edition”, redesigned by DWA from the original artwork by Nathan Winter (Industriarts). Mastering comes like for the original album by Kolja Trelle (SOMAN).

STRICTLY LIMITED to just 100 copies worldwide, like the Indiegogo campaign version of the accompanying 4CD “The Void Trilogy” retrospective, this 2CD limited edition of “To Be Fed Upon Again” is an absolute essential for any serious Die Sektor collector – compiling as it does the cream of all the bands earliest recorded material. 14 previously unreleased tracks, 2 lost rarities, 1 exclusive package at 1 great price of just $20 plus shipping. SHIPPING OUT NOW!!!

The Void Trilogy 4CD Set: $45 + shipping

A re-pressing of all 3 "Void Trilogy" albums, each disc with previously unreleased bonus content (and each disc even with alternate artwork)! Comes in extra-wide DVD-box format to accommodate MASSIVE 20-PAGE full-color 180x120mm booklet with all art and lyrics to all 3 albums! PLUS "From Out Of The Void" as bonus CD4! This will be the ONLY physical pressing of "From Out Of The Void"! Hand-numbered limited edition of 100. 50 tracks including 17 unreleased! Yes, we will take any unsold copies on tour - BUT the ONLY way to guarantee getting one is to buy it here! SHIPPING OUT NOW!!!

The Void Digitally: $35

Don't want to be burdened with the 4CD Limited Edition? Then how about this download version of the entire "Void Trilogy" - all 3 albums plus the "From Out Of The Void" album. A whopping 44 tracks + the 6 bonus tracks and we'll even throw in a .pdf version of the 20-page lyric booklet of the limited edition CD version too. 50 songs in all, all for $35: the best digital package we have on offer for the Die Sektor collector. Delivery: you will be sent a download code from October 30th.

To Be Fed Upon Again Digitally: $18

Download version of the sumputuous 2CD reissue! Delivery: you will be sent a download code from October 30th.

"From Out Of The Void" (digital): $10

Download version of our own brand new self-remix album "From Out Of The Void" - where we rebuilt tracks from all 3 "Void Trilogy" albums in the way only Die Sektor knows how. This album will go into general digital distribution in December - but if you pre-order it from us here you will get it at the start of October....and we will get all the money $$$.... You give us 10 bucks, we give you 11 tracks - that's like $1 a track, with one extra thrown in for free, right? Delivery: you will be sent a download code from October 30th.

These Broken Shields (digital): $5

OUT NOW! Buy it here or on Bandcamp. Buy it here, we will send you a download code ASAP. Buy it on Bandcamp, code will be sent to you automatically, and DWA will credit this campaign fund on your behalf!

OR, what about some personal items:

(caveat emptor: may or may not contain trace-DNA of Die Sektor members :-)

SOLD OUT! White Straightjacket Top: $50 + shipping

Covered in stage blood and rust scrapes from our rusty chain live routine. Worn by Edwin every date of the 2012 Theory of Evolution tour.

SOLD OUT! Boney Black Bondage Vest: $50 + shipping

Black bondage vest with a hand sewn deer spine down the back. Worn by Edwin and Scott live from 2011 to 2014.

SOLD OUT! Devil Mask: $50 + shipping 

Gore covered Japanese devil mask worn by Edwin at every show from 2012 to 2013.

SOLD OUT! "To Be Fed Upon" Stage Banner: $100 + shipping

6ft by 4ft full color "To Be Fed Upon" banner. Autographed. One of a kind.

or how about:

Hand-drawn art: $75 + shipping

We will hand draw any Die Sektor album cover and autograph it. Remembering that we will be on tour until the end of November, please allow a minimum timeline of around 4 weeks from the point in December when we will be able to start work on this (see "Estimated delivery date: January 2016"). Of course, it might be sooner!

or if wanting Edwin to wax lyrical, how about:

Custom lyrics for you by Edwin: $50 

Edwin will write lyrics for your song. Remembering that we will be on tour until the end of November, please allow a minimum timeline of around 4 weeks from the point in December when Edwin will be able to start work on this (see "Estimated delivery date: January 2016").

or take it one stage further and go for:

Guest vocals by Edwin: $100

Edwin will write and perform guest vocals on your song. Remembering that we will be on tour until the end of November, please allow a minimum timeline of around 4 weeks from the point in December when Edwin will be able to start work on this (see "Estimated delivery date: January 2016").

or why not go the whole hog and for $150 Die Sektor will mix and produce one of your songs:

Song production: $150

Remembering that we will be on tour until the end of November, please allow a minimum timeline of around 4 weeks from the point in December when we will be able to start work on this (see "Estimated delivery date: January 2016").


Why you should care about this campaign:

Through this campaign, all those of you Stateside already planning on attending one or more shows of the tour itself can get your hands on some extra goodies - but also a whole load of you around the world who won't be able to come can still be involved in a very meaningful way. And we can offer you things via this campaign that would basically be impossible to offer via "regular retail channels".

And because this campaign is running on a "flexible funding" model, even if we don't reach our target we will still get as much money as is raised.

And if we manage to break through that goal, we will use any extra money raised to repair or replace the gear we use live, and to get us to the first date of the tour...because all that could in fact easily set us back another $1,000 on top of the $6,000 we're asking for help with.

And if you help us manage to break through our  $6,000 target, you'll be helping to make everything better for everybody...including of course most importantly YOURSELF. Because if we DO manage to break through, for every additional $500 we reach, we'll be adding FREE UPGRADES like stickers, badges, patches and posters for every single one of you who contributed to the campaign! Jamie at DWA is already losing sleep about what he can come up with next. Why help him rest - he's always saying that he can sleep when he's dead...


Other Ways You Can Help:

Bought something here already...or just broke? You can still help us hugely - simply by spreading word of this campaign.

Tell your friends, tell the friends of your friends, tell the fans of the friends of your friends. Talk about this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, any and all avenues of social media where you hang out. Once, twice, three times...share, repost, reTweet...we'll give you reasons enough with all the weekly updates we'll be posting.

And even if you don't have any spare cash at the moment, we hope to see a lot of you as we head out on tour this fall - and we can't wait for you to hear our new album for the first time!
